original: Uḍḍāmareśvaratantra
translated: Uḍḍāmareśvara Tantra

original: Uḍḍāmareśvaratantra /
translated: Uḍḍāmareśvara Tantra.

original: Prathamaḥ paṭalaḥ
analyzed: prathamaḥ paṭalaḥ
translated: First Chapter

original: uḍḍīśena samākīrṇā yogivṛndasamākulā /
analyzed: uḍḍīśena samākīrṇā yogi vṛnda samākulā
translated: Filled with Uḍḍīśa and crowded with groups of yogis,

original: praṇamya śirasā devī gaurī pṛcchati śaṃkaram // /
analyzed: praṇamya śirasā devī gaurī pṛcchati śaṃkaram
translated: Having bowed with his head, Goddess Gaurī asks Śaṅkara:

original: īśvara śrotum icchāmi lokanātha jagatprabho /
analyzed: īśvara śrotum icchāmi lokanātha jagatprabho
translated: O Lord, I wish to hear, O Lord of the world, O Lord of the universe,

original: prasādaṃ kuru deveśa brūhi dharmārthasādhakam // /
analyzed: prasādam kuru deveśa brūhi dharma artha sādhakam
translated: Be gracious, O Lord of gods, tell me what accomplishes Dharma and wealth.

original: vaśīkaraṇam uccāṭaṃ mohanaṃ stambhanaṃ tathā /
analyzed: vaśīkaraṇam uccāṭam mohanam stambhanam tathā
translated: Enchantment, expulsion, infatuation, and immobilization,

original: śāntikaṃ pauṣṭikaṃ vātha karaṇāni bahūni ca // /
analyzed: śāntikam pauṣṭikam vā atha karaṇāni bahūni ca
translated: And many other rites such as pacification and prosperity,

original: cakṣurhāniṃ maheśāna śrutihāniṃ tathaiva ca /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ hānim maheśāna śruti hānim tathā eva ca
translated: Loss of eyesight, O Maheśāna, and likewise loss of hearing,

original: jñānahāniṃ kriyāhāniṃ kīlakaṃ ca tathāparam // /
analyzed: jñāna hānim kriyā hānim kīlakam ca tathā aparam
translated: Loss of knowledge, loss of action, and another is the stake,

original: kāryastambhaṃ sureśāna śoṣaṇaṃ pūraṇaṃ tathā /
analyzed: kārya stambham sureśāna śoṣaṇam pūraṇam tathā
translated: Immobilization of action, O Lord of gods, and likewise drying up and filling,

original: mantradhyānaṃ viśeṣeṇa tat sarvaṃ vada me prabho // /
analyzed: mantra dhyānam viśeṣeṇa tat sarvam vada me prabho
translated: And especially the meditation on mantras, tell me all that, O Lord.

original: anyac ca vividhaṃ kāryaṃ prasādād brūhi bhairava /
analyzed: anyat ca vividham kāryam prasādāt brūhi bhairava
translated: And tell me other various rites out of grace, O Bhairava,

original: yasya vijñānamātreṇa manuṣyo bhuvi durlabhaḥ // /
analyzed: yasya vijñāna mātreṇa manuṣyaḥ bhuvi durlabhaḥ
translated: By merely knowing which a man is rare on earth.

original: śrīr īśvara uvāca /
analyzed: śrīḥ īśvaraḥ uvāca
translated: Lord Śiva said:

original: śṛṇu tvaṃ hi varārohe siddhyarthaṃ yadi pṛcchasi /
analyzed: śṛṇu tvam hi varārohe siddhi artham yadi pṛcchasi
translated: Listen, O beautiful lady, if you ask for the sake of accomplishment,

original: tadvad iṣyāmi te devi tat sarvaṃ samudāhṛtam // /
analyzed: tadvat iṣyāmi te devi tat sarvam samudāhṛtam
translated: I will tell you all that, O Goddess, just as it is.

original: auṣadhair mantrajāpaiś ca ripuṃ hanyān na saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: auṣadhaiḥ mantra jāpaiḥ ca ripum hanyāt na saṃśayaḥ
translated: One should kill the enemy with herbs, mantra recitation, and spells, there is no doubt.

original: uḍḍīśāt sāram ākṛṣya mayoktaṃ tava bhaktitaḥ // /
analyzed: uḍḍīśāt sāram ākṛṣya mayā uktam tava bhaktitaḥ
translated: Having extracted the essence from the Uḍḍiśa, I have told it to you out of devotion.

original: uḍḍīśaṃ ca namaskṛtya rudraṃ caiva sudurlabham /
analyzed: uḍḍīśam ca namaskṛtya rudram ca eva su durlabham
translated: Having bowed to Uḍḍiśa and to Rudra, who is very difficult to obtain,

original: kapardinaṃ virūpākṣaṃ sarvabhūtabhayāpaham // /
analyzed: kapardinam virūpākṣam sarva bhūta bhaya apaham
translated: To Kapardin, Virūpākṣa, the remover of the fear of all beings,

original: vakṣye rudrodbhavān yogān sarvaśatruvināśakān /
analyzed: vakṣye rudra udbhavān yogān sarva śatru vināśakān
translated: I will describe the yogas arising from Rudra, which destroy all enemies.

original: tais tu prayojitaiḥ saḥ prāṇān hanti na saṃśayaḥ // /
analyzed: taiḥ tu prayojitaiḥ saḥ prāṇān hanti na saṃśayaḥ
translated: By employing them, he kills the life force, there is no doubt.

original: prathamaṃ bhūtakaraṇaṃ dvitīyonmādanaṃ tathā /
analyzed: prathamam bhūtakaraṇam dvitīya unmādanam tathā
translated: The first is the creation of beings, the second is the maddening,

original: tṛtīyaṃ dveṣaṇaṃ cātha turyam uccāṭanaṃ tathā // /🔽grāmoccāṭaṃ pañcamaṃ ca jalastambhaṃ ca ṣaṣṭhakam /
analyzed: tṛtīyam dveṣaṇam ca atha turyam uccāṭanam tathā  grāma uccāṭam pañcamam ca jalastambham ca ṣaṣṭhakam
translated: The third is the arousing of hatred, and the fourth is the scattering,🔽The fifth is the scattering of the village, and the sixth is the freezing of water,

original: vahneḥ stambhakaraṃ cātha vaśīkaraṇam uttamam // /
analyzed: vahneḥ stambhakaram ca atha vaśīkaraṇam uttamam
translated: And then the freezing of fire, and the excellent enthralling,

original: anyān api prayogāṃś ca bahūn śṛṇu varānane /
analyzed: anyān api prayogān ca bahūn śṛṇu varānane
translated: And listen to many other practices as well, O beautiful-faced one.

original: śivena kathitā yogā uḍḍīśe śāstraniścaye // /
analyzed: śivena kathitāḥ yogāḥ uḍḍīśe śāstra niścaye
translated: The yogas described by Śiva are ascertained in the Uḍḍiśa scripture.

original: andhīkaraṇaṃ mūkīkaraṇaṃ badhirīkaraṇaṃ tathā /
analyzed: andhīkaraṇam mūkīkaraṇam badhirīkaraṇam tathā
translated: The blinding, the dumbing, and the deafening,

original: bhūtajvarasya karaṇam astraśastrasya dūṣaṇam // /
analyzed: bhūta jvarasya karaṇam astra śastrasya dūṣaṇam
translated: The causing of bhūta fever, the defiling of weapons and arms,

original: jaladoṣapraśamanaṃ dadhno madhuvināśanam /🔽vināśaṃ mattakaraṇaṃ gajavājiprakopanam // /
analyzed: vināśam matta karaṇam gaja vāji prakopanam
translated: The pacification of water pollution, the destruction of curd and honey,🔽The destruction of intoxication, the enraging of elephants and horses,

original: ākarṣaṇaṃ bhujaṃgānāṃ mānavānāṃ tathā dhruvam /🔽vahner vināśanaṃ kuryāt parṇānāṃ hi vināśanam // /
analyzed: ākarṣaṇam bhujaṃgānām mānavānām tathā dhruvam  vahneḥ vināśanam kuryāt parṇānām hi vināśanam
translated: The definite attraction of snakes and humans,🔽The destruction of fire, the destruction of leaves,

original: gardabhasyātmakaraṇaṃ parakāyapraveśanam /
analyzed: gardabhasya ātma karaṇam parakāyapraveśanam
translated: The making of oneself a donkey, the entering into another's body,

original: vetālapādukāsiddhim ulvakāj jvalanaṃ tathā // /
analyzed: vetāla pādukā siddhim ulvakāt jvalanam tathā
translated: The accomplishment of the vetāla sandals, the burning from the caul,

original: anyān bahuprayogāṃś ca raudrān romapraharṣaṇān /
analyzed: anyān bahu prayogān ca raudrān roma praharṣaṇān
translated: And many other fierce practices that make the hair stand on end,

original: vidyāmantraprayogādīn auṣadhāṃś cābhicārikān // /
analyzed: vidyā mantra prayoga ādīn auṣadhān ca ābhicārikān
translated: The use of vidyā mantras and other such things, and the magical herbs,

original: guptāguptatarāḥ kāryā rakṣitavyāḥ prayatnataḥ /
analyzed: kāryāḥ rakṣitavyāḥ prayatnataḥ
translated: Should be kept very well hidden and guarded with effort.

original: uḍḍīśaṃ yo na jānāti sa ruṣṭaḥ kiṃ kariṣyati // /
analyzed: uḍḍīśam yaḥ na jānāti sa ruṣṭaḥ kim kariṣyati
translated: One who does not know the Uḍḍiyāna, what will he do in anger?

original: sumeruṃ cālayet sthānāt sāgaraiḥ plāvayen mahīm /
analyzed: sumerum cālayet sthānāt sāgaraiḥ plāvayet mahīm
translated: He can shake Mount Meru from its place, flood the earth with oceans,

original: sūryaṃ ca pātayed bhūmau nedaṃ mithyā bhaviṣyati // /
analyzed: sūryam ca pātayet bhūmau na idam mithyā bhaviṣyati
translated: And bring down the sun to the ground - this will not be false.

original: yathaivendrasya vajraṃ ca pāśaṃ hi varuṇasya ca /
analyzed: yathā eva indrasya vajram ca pāśam hi varuṇasya ca
translated: Just as Indra's thunderbolt and Varuṇa's noose,

original: yamasya ca yathā daṇḍaṃ kuberasya gadā yathā // /
analyzed: yamasya ca yathā daṇḍam kuberasya gadā yathā
translated: As Yama's staff, Kubera's mace,

original: vahneḥ śaktir yathā proktā khaḍgas tu nirṛter yathā /🔽yathā vāyoś cāṅkuśaṃ hi triśūlaṃ śūlapāṇinaḥ // /
analyzed: vahneḥ śaktiḥ yathā proktā khaḍgaḥ tu nirṛteḥ yathā  yathā vāyoḥ ca aṅkuśam hi triśūlam śūlapāṇinaḥ
translated: As the spear is said to be of Agni, as the sword is of Nirṛti,🔽As the goad is of Vāyu, and the trident of the Trident-wielding One,

original: skandasya ca yathā śaktir viṣṇoś cakraṃ sudarśanam /
analyzed: skandasya ca yathā śaktiḥ viṣṇoḥ cakram sudarśanam
translated: As Skanda's śakti and Viṣṇu's discus Sudarśana,

original: tathaite ca mahāyogāḥ prayuktāḥ śatrukāraṇe // /
analyzed: tathā ete ca mahā yogāḥ prayuktāḥ śatru kāraṇe
translated: So are these great yogas employed in the cause of enemies.

original: anivṛtte nivartante amoghā nātra saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: a nivṛtte nivartante amoghāḥ na atra saṃśayaḥ
translated: They cease when they have not succeeded, they are infallible, there is no doubt about it.

original: saṃtuṣṭena prayuktena sidhyanti suvicārataḥ // /
analyzed: saṃtuṣṭena prayuktena sidhyanti su vicārataḥ
translated: When employed by one who is content, they succeed when well considered.

original: ratānāṃ karaṇaṃ vakṣye śatrusādhanam uttamam /
analyzed: ratānām karaṇam vakṣye śatru sādhanam uttamam
translated: I will tell the means of pleasing, the excellent means of subduing enemies,

original: yenaiva kṛtamātreṇa bhūto gṛhṇāti mānavam // /
analyzed: yena eva kṛta mātreṇa bhūtaḥ gṛhṇāti mānavam
translated: By which alone, as soon as it is done, the bhūta seizes a man.

original: nimbakāṣṭhaṃ samādāya caturaṅgulamānataḥ /
analyzed: nimba kāṣṭham samādāya catur aṅgula mānataḥ
translated: Taking neem wood, four fingers long,

original: śatruviṣṭāsamāliptaṃ tathā nāma samālikhet // /🔽citāṅgāreṇa tannāmnā dhūpaṃ dadyān maheśvari /
analyzed: śatru viṣṭā samāliptam tathā nāma samālikhet         dadyāt
translated: Smeared with the urine of a donkey, and likewise the name should be written,🔽With the ashes of a funeral pyre, one should offer incense with that name, O Maheśvari.

original: citāntaḥ saṃsthito bhūtvā yasya gātramṛdāharet // /
analyzed: citā antar saṃsthitaḥ bhūtvā yasya gātra mṛdā āharet
translated: Having remained in the middle of a funeral pyre, one should take the ashes of the body of the one

original: kṛṣṇāṣṭamyāṃ caturdaśyām aṣṭottaraśataṃ japet /
analyzed: kṛṣṇa aṣṭamyām caturdaśyām aṣṭottaraśatam japet
translated: On the eighth or fourteenth day of the dark fortnight, one should recite one hundred and eight times.

original: bhūto gṛhṇāti taṃ śīghraṃ mantreṇānena mantritaḥ // /
analyzed: bhūtaḥ gṛhṇāti tam śīghram mantreṇa anena mantritaḥ
translated: The spirit quickly seizes him, enchanted with this mantra.

original: uoṃ namo bhagavate sarvabhūtādhipataye virūpākṣāya nityaṃ krūrāya daṃṣṭriṇe vikarāline
analyzed: namaḥ bhagavate sarva bhūta adhipataye virūpākṣāya nityam krūrāya daṃṣṭriṇe vikarāline
translated: Om, salutations to the Blessed Lord, the master of all beings, the multi-eyed one, the ever-cruel one, the fanged one, the extremely terrible one,

original: grahayakṣabhūtavetālena saha śaṃkara manuṣyaṃ daha daha paca paca gṛhṇa gṛhṇa gṛhṇāpaya
analyzed: graha yakṣa bhūta vetālena saha śaṃkara manuṣyam daha daha paca paca gṛhṇa gṛhṇa gṛhṇāpaya
translated: along with the planet, Yaksha, ghost, and vampire, burn, burn, cook, cook, seize, seize, cause to seize,

original: gṛhṇāpaya huṃ phaṭ svāhā /
analyzed: gṛhṇāpaya hum phaṭ svāhā
translated: cause to seize, hum, phat, svāhā.

original: pratyānayaṃ yadīccheta tasyaiṣā kriyate kriyā /
analyzed: pratyānayam yadi iccheta tasya eṣā kriyate kriyā
translated: If one wishes to recall him, this rite is performed for him.

original: dāpayed devam īśānaṃ ghṛtena vacayā saha // /
analyzed: dāpayet devam īśānam ghṛtena vacayā saha
translated: One should make the god Īśāna drink ghee along with the mantra.

original: guggulaṃ pradaded dhūpaṃ ghṛtamiśraṃ samantataḥ /
analyzed: guggulam pradadet dhūpam ghṛta miśram samantataḥ
translated: One should offer incense of guggula mixed with ghee all around,

original: mantreṇa mantrayitvā tu tataḥ svāsthyaṃ bhavet kila // /
analyzed: mantreṇa mantrayitvā tu tatas svāsthyam bhavet kila
translated: enchanted with the mantra, then it is said that he will be well.

original: mantraḥ uoṃ namaḥ śivāya śāntāya prabhāya muktāya devādhidevāya śubhrabāhave vyādhiṃ śamaya śamaya amukaḥ svastho bhavatu namo 'stu te /
analyzed: mantraḥ uoṃ namaḥ śivāya śāntāya prabhāya muktāya deva adhidevāya śubhra bāhave vyādhim śamaya śamaya amukaḥ svasthaḥ bhavatu namaḥ stu te
translated: The mantra is: Om, salutations to Śiva, the peaceful one, the radiant one, the liberated one, the supreme god of gods, the one with the white arms, pacify, pacify the disease, let so-and-so be well, salutations to you.

original: iti svāsthyamantraḥ /
analyzed: iti svāsthya mantraḥ
translated: This is the mantra for well-being.

original: athānyat sampravakṣyāmi prayogaṃ bhuvi durlabham /
analyzed: athā anyat sampravakṣyāmi prayogam bhuvi durlabham
translated: Now I shall explain another practice, rare on earth,

original: yenaiva kṛtamātreṇa jvaro gṛhṇāti mānavam // /
analyzed: yena eva kṛta mātreṇa jvaraḥ gṛhṇāti mānavam
translated: By which alone, as soon as it is done, fever seizes a man.

original: nimbakāṣṭhākṛtiṃ kṛtvā caturaṅgulamānataḥ /
analyzed: nimba kāṣṭha ākṛtim kṛtvā catur aṅgula mānataḥ
translated: Having made an image of neem wood, four fingers long,

original: tasyā hṛdi viṣonmattarājikālavaṇais tathā // /
analyzed: tasyāḥ hṛdi viṣa unmatta rājikā lavaṇaiḥ tathā
translated: In its heart, with poison, madder, and rock salt,

original: nāma saṃlikhya prakṛtau pācyamānāyāṃ tataḥ param /
analyzed: nāma saṃlikhya prakṛtau pācyamānāyām tatas param
translated: Having written the name in the original, then when it is being cooked,

original: tatas tu śatrunāmnā ca aṣṭottaraśataṃ japet // /
analyzed: tatas tu śatru nāmnā ca aṣṭottaraśatam japet
translated: Then with the name of the enemy, one should recite one hundred and eight times.

original: tataḥ sa praharārdhena jvarabhūtena gṛhyate /
analyzed: tatas sa prahara ardhena jvara bhūtena gṛhyate
translated: Then within half a watch, he is seized by the fever demon.

original: atha japamantraḥ uoṃ bakāmukhā cāmuṇḍā amukasya kṣīramāṃsaśoṇitabhojinī amukaṃ khaḥ khaḥ jvareṇa gṛhṇa gṛhṇa gṛhṇāpaya gṛhṇāpaya huṃ phaṭ svāhā
analyzed: atha japa mantraḥ uoṃ bakāmukhā cāmuṇḍā amukasya kṣīra māṃsa śoṇita bhojinī amukam khaḥ khaḥ jvareṇa gṛhṇa gṛhṇa gṛhṇāpaya gṛhṇāpaya hum phaṭ svāhā
translated: Now the mantra for recitation: Oṃ, O Bakamukha Cāmuṇḍā, who feeds on the milk, flesh, and blood of so-and-so, seize so-and-so with fever, seize, seize, cause to be seized, cause to be seized, huṃ phaṭ svāhā.

original: pratyānayaṃ yadīccheta tasyaiṣā kriyate kriyā // /
analyzed: pratyānayam yadi iccheta tasya eṣā kriyate kriyā
translated: If one wishes to recall him, this rite is performed for him.

original: dugdhasnātanāmākṣarāṇi tadā svastho bhaved iti /
analyzed: dugdha snāta nāma akṣarāṇi tadā svasthaḥ bhavet iti
translated: The syllables of the name of one who has bathed in milk, then he will be well.

original: athānyat sampravakṣyāmi prayogaṃ bhuvi durlabham // /
analyzed: atha anyat sampravakṣyāmi prayogam bhuvi durlabham
translated: Now I will explain another practice, which is difficult to find on earth,

original: yena vijñānamātreṇa śatror uccāṭanaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: yena vijñāna mātreṇa śatroḥ uccāṭanam bhavet
translated: By which, merely through knowledge, the enemy will be driven away.

original: brahmadaṇḍī citābhasma gomayasya tathaiva ca // /
analyzed: brahmadaṇḍī citā bhasma gomayasya tathā eva ca
translated: Brahmadaṇḍī, funeral pyre ashes, and cow dung,

original: kṣāraṃ cāpi samādāya kākajaṅgāsamanvitam /
analyzed: kṣāram ca api samādāya kākajaṅgā samanvitam
translated: Taking alkali and mixing with crow's feet,

original: kṣipec chirasi śatrūṇāṃ tūrṇam uccāṭayed ripum // /
analyzed: kṣipet śirasi śatrūṇām tūrṇam uccāṭayet ripum
translated: One should sprinkle it on the head of enemies, and quickly drive away the foe.

original: tataḥ saṃsnāpayed enaṃ gokṣīreṇa samanvitam /
analyzed: tatas saṃsnāpayet enam go kṣīreṇa samanvitam
translated: Then one should bathe him with cow's milk,

original: muṇḍanaṃ cātha keśānāṃ tataḥ svastho bhaved dhruvam // /
analyzed: muṇḍanam ca atha keśānām tatas svasthaḥ bhavet dhruvam
translated: And then shave his hair, and he will certainly become well again.

original: athānyat sampravakṣyāmi śatror uccāṭanaṃ varam /
analyzed: athā anyat sampravakṣyāmi śatroḥ uccāṭanam varam
translated: Now I shall explain another excellent method for driving away enemies,

original: dhūpaṃ nirbhedakaṃ nāma svayaṃ rudreṇa bhāṣitam // /
analyzed: dhūpam nirbhedakam nāma svayam rudreṇa bhāṣitam
translated: The incense called Nirbhedika, spoken by Rudra himself.

original: brahmadaṇḍī samūlā ca kākajaṅgā samanvitā /🔽nirmokaṃ sarparājasya dhūpam uccāṭayed ripūn // /
analyzed: nirmokam sarparājasya dhūpam uccāṭayet ripūn
translated: Brahmadatta with its roots, along with crow's feet,🔽The cast-off skin of the king of snakes, this incense will drive away enemies.

original: sarpakañcukam ādāya kṛṣṇoragaśiras tathā /
analyzed: sarpa kañcukam ādāya kṛṣṇa uraga śiraḥ tathā
translated: Taking the skin of a black snake and its head,

original: nikhaned yasya ca dvāre tam uccāṭayate haṭhāt // /
analyzed: nikhanet yasya ca dvāre tam uccāṭayate haṭhāt
translated: One should bury it at the door of the enemy, and he will be forcibly driven away.

original: brahmadaṇḍī surāmāṃsī kacchapasya śiras tathā /
analyzed: brahmadaṇḍī surāmāṃsī kacchapasya śiraḥ tathā
translated: Brahmadatta, Suramasha, and the head of a tortoise,

original: śmaśānabhasmasaṃyuktaṃ kapāle mānuṣe nyaset // /🔽śatror dvāre nikhātena tūrṇam uccāṭayed ripūn /
analyzed: śmaśāna bhasma saṃyuktam kapāle mānuṣe nyaset  śatroḥ dvāre nikhātena tūrṇam uccāṭayet ripūn
translated: One should place in a human skull along with cremation ground ashes,🔽By burying it at the door of the enemy, one will quickly drive away the foe.

original: saptarātrau deveśi samūlaṃ naśyate gṛham // /
analyzed: sapta rātrau deveśi sa mūlam naśyate gṛham
translated: O Goddess of the gods, in seven nights the house will be destroyed along with its roots.

original: atha vidveṣaṇaṃ vakṣye śatrūṇāṃ śṛṇu śaṃkari /
analyzed: atha vidveṣaṇam vakṣye śatrūṇām śṛṇu śaṃkari
translated: Now I will tell you about the enmity of enemies, listen, O Śaṅkara's consort,

original: yenaiva kṛtamātreṇa vidveṣo jāyate nṛṇām // /
analyzed: yena eva kṛta mātreṇa vidveṣaḥ jāyate nṛṇām
translated: By which alone, as soon as it is done, enmity arises among men.

original: brahmadaṇḍī samūlā ca kākamāṃsena saṃyutā /
analyzed: brahmadaṇḍī sa mūlā ca kāka māṃsena saṃyutā
translated: Brahmadaṇḍī with roots, along with crow meat,

original: jātīpuṣparasair bhāvyā saptarātraṃ punaḥ punaḥ // /
translated: Should be soaked in the juice of jasmine flowers for seven nights, again and again.

original: tato mārjāramūtreṇa saptāhaṃ bhāvayet tataḥ /
analyzed: tatas mārjāra mūtreṇa sapta aham bhāvayet tatas
translated: Then it should be soaked for seven days in cat's urine.

original: eṣa dhūpaḥ pradātavyaḥ śatrugotrasya madhyataḥ // /
analyzed: eṣa dhūpaḥ pradātavyaḥ śatru gotrasya madhyatas
translated: This incense should be offered in the midst of the enemy's clan.

original: yathā gandhaṃ samāghrāti pitā putraiḥ samaṃ kaliḥ /
analyzed: yathā gandham samāghrāti pitā putraiḥ samam kaliḥ
translated: Just as the father smells the fragrance along with the sons, there is quarrel.

original: vidveṣaṇaṃ paraṃ teṣāṃ suhṛdbhir bāndhavaiḥ saha // /
analyzed: vidveṣaṇam param teṣām suhṛdbhiḥ bāndhavaiḥ saha
translated: There is great enmity between them and their friends and relatives.

original: svasthīkaraṇakaṃ proktaṃ ghṛtagugguladhūpataḥ /
analyzed: svasthīkaraṇakam proktam ghṛta guggula dhūpataḥ
translated: The pacification is said to be by the incense of ghee and guggula.

original: atha māraṇam /
analyzed: atha māraṇam
translated: Now, the killing.

original: surāṃ mānuṣamāṃsaṃ ca samādāya vicakṣaṇaḥ // /
analyzed: surām mānuṣa māṃsam ca samādāya vicakṣaṇaḥ
translated: Taking wine and human flesh, the wise one,

original: gṛdhrāsthi śatruviṣṭhāṃ ca dvāramadhye nikhātayet /
analyzed: gṛdhra asthi śatru viṣṭhām ca dvāra madhye nikhātayet
translated: Should bury the vulture bone and the enemy's feces in the middle of the door.

original: saptāhena bhaven māro yathā rudreṇa bhāṣitam // /
analyzed: sapta ahena bhavet māraḥ yathā rudreṇa bhāṣitam
translated: In seven days, there will be death, as spoken by Rudra.

original: brahmadaṇḍī citābhasma surāmāṃsīsamāyutam /
translated: Brahmadaṇḍī, funeral ashes, wine, and māṃsī, mixed together,

original: ariṣṭasya ca pattrāṇi viṣaṃ rudhiram eva ca // /
analyzed: ariṣṭasya ca pattrāṇi viṣam rudhiram eva ca
translated: The leaves of ariṣṭa, poison, and blood,

original: mohāya ca prayoktavyaḥ śatrūṇāṃ nāmayogataḥ /
analyzed: mohāya ca prayoktavyaḥ śatrūṇām nāma yogataḥ
translated: It should be employed for the delusion of enemies by combining their names.

original: saptarātraprayogena sarvaśatrupraṇāśanam // /
analyzed: sapta rātra prayogeṇa sarva śatru praṇāśanam
translated: By employing it for seven nights, all enemies will be destroyed.

original: eteṣāṃ duṣṭayogānāṃ śatrave tad udāhṛtam /
analyzed: eteṣām duṣṭa yogānām śatrave tat udāhṛtam
translated: For these wicked yogas, that is stated for the enemy.

original: śatam aṣṭottareṇaiva mantrayitvā vicakṣaṇaḥ // /
analyzed: śatam aṣṭa uttareṇa eva mantrayitvā vicakṣaṇaḥ
translated: The wise one, having recited the mantra one hundred and eight times,

analyzed: uoṃ namaḥ bhagavate śrī uḍḍāmara īśvarāya amukam uccāṭaya uccāṭaya vidveṣaya vidveṣaya svāhā  eka rātra uṣitaḥ bhūtvā kṛṣṇa aṣṭamyām samāhitaḥ
translated: Oṃ, salutations to the Blessed Lord, the glorious Uḍḍāma-Īśvara. Drive so-and-so away, drive away, create enmity, create enmity, svāhā.🔽Having fasted for one night, with a focused mind, on the eighth day of the dark fortnight,

original: devam abhyarcya ceśānaṃ śatam aṣṭādhikaṃ japet // /
analyzed: devam abhyarcya ca īśānam śatam aṣṭa adhikam japet
translated: having worshipped Lord Īśāna, one should recite the mantra one hundred and eight times.

original: mantram etat prayoktavyaṃ siddhaye siddhikāmyayā /
analyzed: mantram etat prayoktavyam siddhaye siddhi kāmyayā
translated: This mantra should be employed by one who desires success for the sake of accomplishment.

original: śatrusainye prayoktavyaṃ rājñaś ca vijayārthinaḥ // /🔽lāṅgūlaṃ gṛhagodhāyāḥ kṛkalāsasya mastakam /
analyzed: śatru sainye prayoktavyam rājñaḥ ca vijaya arthinaḥ  lāṅgūlam gṛhagodhāyāḥ kṛkalāsasya mastakam
translated: It should be employed against the army of enemies by a king who seeks victory.🔽The tail of a house lizard, the head of a chameleon,

original: indragopakasaṃyuktaṃ jambūkasya śiras tathā // /
analyzed: indragopaka saṃyuktam jambūkasya śiraḥ tathā
translated: mixed with an Indian earthworm, and the head of a jackal,

original: etāni samabhāgāni sūkṣmacūrṇāni kārayet /
analyzed: etāni sama bhāgāni sūkṣma cūrṇāni kārayet
translated: these should be made into fine powders in equal parts.

original: amukte hi prayoktavyaṃ sarvaṃ janaśataṃ haret // /
analyzed: amukte hi prayoktavyam sarvam jana śatam haret
translated: When released, it will kill all the people in a hundred villages.

original: nṛkapālaṃ samūtraṃ ca pecakasya śiras tathā /
analyzed: nṛ kapālam sa mūtram ca pecakasya śiraḥ tathā
translated: Human skull, urine, and the head of a peccadillo,

original: vṛścikasya tu lāṅgūlaṃ hālāhalakam eva ca // /
analyzed: vṛścikasya tu lāṅgūlam hālāhalakam eva ca
translated: The tail of a scorpion and the poison of a hala hala,

original: śvetamaṇḍūkamāṃsaṃ ca mūtraṃ caiva gajoṣṭrayoḥ /🔽gṛhītvā samabhāgāni sūkṣmacūrṇāni kārayet // /
analyzed: śveta maṇḍūka māṃsam ca mūtram ca eva gaja uṣṭrayoḥ  gṛhītvā sama bhāgāni sūkṣma cūrṇāni kārayet
translated: The flesh of a white frog, and the urine of an elephant and a camel,🔽Taking these in equal parts, one should make them into fine powder.

original: etāni śoṣayitvā tu kalkaṃ kṛtvā punaḥ punaḥ /
analyzed: etāni śoṣayitvā tu kalkam kṛtvā punar punar
translated: Having dried these, one should repeatedly make a paste,

original: uoṃ hīṃ yamāya śatrunāśanāya svāhā /
analyzed: uoṃ hīṃ yamāya śatru nāśanāya svāhā
translated: Om, hrim, to Yama, the destroyer of enemies, svaha.

original: anne pāne pradātavyaṃ ripusainyavināśanam // /
analyzed: anne pāne pradātavyam ripu sainya vināśanam
translated: This should be given in food and drink for the destruction of the enemy's army.

original: spṛṣṭamātreṇa tenaiva visphoṭās tu samantataḥ /
analyzed: spṛṣṭa mātreṇa tena eva visphoṭāḥ tu samantataḥ
translated: As soon as it is touched, blisters will appear all over,

original: tasya dehe jvaras tīvro bhavet tīvrā ca vedanā // /
analyzed: tasya dehe jvaraḥ tīvraḥ bhavet tīvrā ca vedanā
translated: And in his body, severe fever and intense pain will occur.

original: mriyate saptarātrau pratyānayanavarjitaḥ /
analyzed: mriyate sapta rātrau pratyānayana varjitaḥ
translated: He will die within seven nights, without any possibility of being brought back to life.

original: athānyat sampravakṣyāmi yasya dhyānena sādhanam // /
analyzed: atha anyat sampravakṣyāmi yasya dhyānena sādhanam
translated: Now I will explain another, whose practice is through meditation,

original: kathitaṃ caiva rudreṇa tridaśebhyaḥ prasādataḥ /🔽rudhiraṃ kṛṣṇasarpasya kukkuṭasya tu kasyacit // /
analyzed: kathitam ca eva rudreṇa tridaśebhyaḥ prasādataḥ  rudhiram kṛṣṇa sarpasya kukkuṭasya tu kasyacid
translated: Which was told by Rudra to the gods out of grace.🔽The blood of a black snake, and of some cock,

original: kacchapasya mayūrāṇāṃ rocanaṃ jātyañjanaṃ tathā /
analyzed: kacchapasya mayūrāṇām rocanam jātī añjanam tathā
translated: The bile of a tortoise and peacocks, and likewise rochana and black antimony,

original: kuṅkumaṃ bhadramustaṃ ca tagaraṃ kṛṣṇam eva ca // /
analyzed: kuṅkumam bhadramustam ca tagaram kṛṣṇam eva ca
translated: Saffron, bhadra musta, and black tagara,

original: etāni samabhāgāni puṣyārke ca samāharet /
analyzed: etāni sama bhāgāni puṣya arke ca samāharet
translated: These should be collected in equal parts on a day when the sun is in the sign of Pushya.

analyzed: aśleṣāyām tu piṣṭāni kṛtvā pātre ca rājate
translated: In the constellation Aśleṣā, having ground it in a silver vessel,

analyzed: daśa aham sthāpayet bhūmyām paścāt uddhṛtya lepayet
translated: one should keep it on the ground for ten days, and after that, having taken it out, one should apply it.

analyzed: asi dhārā aṅgadā nāma svayam rudreṇa bhāṣitā

analyzed: atha ālipet tu gātrāṇi sa kṛtvā asthīni atha api vā
translated: Then, having anointed the body or even the bones,

original: phalapuṣpe tathā pattre dhūpasattais tathaiva ca // /
analyzed: phala puṣpe tathā pattre dhūpa sattaiḥ tathā eva ca
translated: in the fruit, flower, and leaf, and also with incense and oil,

analyzed: agadaḥ yam mahā mantraḥ bhūtānām ca bhaya āvahaḥ

analyzed: anne pāne mantrayitvā prayuñjīta vidhānataḥ

analyzed: pīḍyamānam japet mantram śuciḥ bhūtvā samāhitaḥ

original: aṣṭottarasahasraṃ tu tato mantram imaṃ japet // /
analyzed: aṣṭottarasahasram tu tatas mantram imam japet
translated: Then, one should recite this mantra one thousand and eight times.

analyzed: kanyayā peṣayat ca eva goṣṭha madhye prayatnataḥ
translated: One should grind it with a virgin in the middle of the cow pen, with effort.

analyzed: tad aśaktau citāyām tu yathāśakti punar punar
translated: If unable to do that, then again and again on the funeral pyre, according to one's ability.

original: svayaṃ rudreṇa samproktaṃ sarvakāryaprasādhakam /
analyzed: svayam rudreṇa samproktam sarva kārya prasādhakam
translated: Self-uttered by Rudra, it accomplishes all tasks.

analyzed: sarve ca eva prayoktavyāḥ sarva śatru vināśakāḥ
translated: All of them should be employed, they destroy all enemies.

analyzed: tasmāt sarva prayatnena rakṣitavyāḥ prayogavān
translated: Therefore, with all efforts, the one who practices should protect them.

analyzed: abhukte nā eva yam krūre pāpa jane tathā
translated: It should not be given to one who has not eaten, to a cruel person, or to a sinful person.

analyzed: dātavyam bhakti yuktāya śāstra jñāya amareśvari
translated: It should be given to one who is devoted, who knows the scriptures, O Goddess of the Immortals.

original: Uḍḍāmareśvaratantra /
translated: Uddamasvara Tantra.

original: Dvitīyaḥ paṭalaḥ
analyzed: dvitīyaḥ paṭalaḥ
translated: Second Chapter

original: athānyat sampravakṣyāmi jalastambhanam uttamam /
analyzed: atha anyat sampravakṣyāmi jala stambhanam uttamam
translated: Now I will explain another excellent method of water-stambhana (arresting the flow of water).

original: kumbhīravelvadaṃṣṭrāni rudhiraṃ māṃsam eva ca // /
analyzed: kumbhīra velva daṃṣṭrāni rudhiram māṃsam eva ca
translated: The blood and flesh of a crocodile, a porpoise, and a shark,

original: hṛdayaṃ kacchapasyaiva śiśumāraṃ punaḥ punaḥ /
analyzed: hṛdayam kacchapasya eva śiśumāram punar punar
translated: The heart of a tortoise, and the flesh of a porpoise again and again,

original: vibhītakasya tailena sarvān ekatra kārayet // /
analyzed: vibhītakasya tailena sarvān ekatra kārayet
translated: All of them should be mixed together with the oil of Vibhitaka.

original: nyāsakarma tataḥ kṛtvā jale tiṣṭhed yathāsukham /
analyzed: nyāsa karma tatas kṛtvā jale tiṣṭhet yathāsukham
translated: Then having performed the nyasa (ritualistic placement of mantras on the body), one can remain in the water as one pleases.

original: madrakasya rasaṃ grāhyaṃ lakṣaṇasya makarasya ca // /
analyzed: madrakasya rasam grāhyam lakṣaṇasya makarasya ca
translated: The juice of Madraka (a kind of plant) and the juice of Makara (a kind of fish) should be taken,

original: ḍuṇḍubhasya śiro grāhyaṃ sarvān ekatra kārayet /
analyzed: ḍuṇḍubhasya śiraḥ grāhyam sarvān ekatra kārayet
translated: The head of a Dunda snake should be taken and all should be made into one.

original: vibhītakasya taile tu pacyamāne ca dāpayet // /
analyzed: vibhītakasya taile tu pacyamāne ca dāpayet
translated: It should be added when the oil of Vibhitaka is being cooked.

original: nyāsakarma prakurvīta saptāhaṃ tiṣṭhate jale /
analyzed: nyāsa karma prakurvīta sapta aham tiṣṭhate jale
translated: The Nyasa rite should be performed and it remains in water for a week.

original: tat tailaṃ pācayet lauhe kṛṣṇāṣṭamyāṃ samāhitaḥ // /
analyzed: tat tailam pācayet lauhe kṛṣṇa aṣṭamyām samāhitaḥ
translated: That oil should be cooked in a metal vessel on the eighth day of the dark fortnight, with a concentrated mind.

original: caturmāsoṣito bhūtvā devam abhyarcya śaṃkaram /
analyzed: catur māsa uṣitaḥ bhūtvā devam abhyarcya śaṃkaram

analyzed: abhimantrya ca mantreṇa mṛttikā snāna dakṣiṇam

analyzed: aṣṭa adhika sahasram tu japitvā homam ācaret

analyzed: anena mantrayitvā tu tatas sidhyati na anyathā
translated: Having consecrated with this mantra, it is then accomplished, not otherwise.

analyzed: uoṃ namaḥ bhagavate uḍḍāmara īśvarāya jalam stambhaya stambhaya hum phaṭ svāhā

analyzed: vakṣye tha lūtā karaṇam tam śṛṇuṣva samāsatas

original: bhallātakarasaṃ guñjā viṣaṃ citrakam eva ca // /
translated: The juice of Bhallataka, Gunja, poison, and Citraka,

original: kapikacchaparomāṇi cūrṇāṃ kṛtvā pradāpayet /
analyzed: kapikacchapa romāṇi cūrṇām kṛtvā pradāpayet
translated: having made them into a powder with the hair of a monkey and a tortoise, should be given.

analyzed: etat sarva samāyuktaḥ lūtā karaṇam uttamam
translated: This is the best for making a spider, combined with all of these.

original: tasya rūpaṃ pravakṣyāmi jāyate yas tu lakṣaṇaiḥ /
analyzed: tasya rūpam pravakṣyāmi jāyate yaḥ tu lakṣaṇaiḥ
translated: I will tell you about its form, which is born with the characteristics.

analyzed: aṅgāni dhūmam āyānti mūrchayanti muhur muhur

analyzed: etat rūpam bhavet tasya lūtā vikṛta lakṣaṇam
translated: This would be his form, the characteristic of the altered Lūta.

original: cikitsāṃ tasya vakṣyāmi yena sampadyate sukham // /
analyzed: cikitsām tasya vakṣyāmi yena sampadyate sukham
translated: I will describe its treatment, by which one becomes happy.

original: uśīraṃ candanaṃ caiva priyaṅgutagaraṃ tathā /
analyzed: uśīram candanam ca eva priyaṅgu tagaram tathā
translated: Uśīra, sandalwood, priyaṅgu, tagara,

original: raktacandanakuṣṭhaṃ ca lepo lūtāvināśanaḥ // /
translated: red sandalwood and kushtha - this paste destroys Lūta.

original: uoṃ namo bhagavate uḍḍāmareśvarāya kuhalīkurvanī svāhā /
analyzed: namaḥ bhagavate uḍḍāmara īśvarāya kuhalīkurvanī svāhā
translated: Oṃ, salutations to the Blessed Lord of the Uḍḍāmara, Kuhalīkurvanī, Svāhā.

original: mantrābhimantritaṃ kṛtvā tataḥ svastho bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: mantra abhimantritam kṛtvā tatas svasthaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: Having enchanted with the mantra, he will then become well.

analyzed: kṛṣṇa sarpa śiraḥ grāhyam mukhe niḥkṣipya sarṣapān
translated: The head of a black serpent should be taken, and mustard seeds should be placed in the mouth.

original: bhallātakena saṃyuktaṃ kṛṣṇasūtreṇa veṣṭayet /
analyzed: bhallātakena saṃyuktam kṛṣṇa sūtreṇa veṣṭayet
translated: It should be wrapped with a black thread along with a bhallātaka.

original: valmīkasya mṛdaḥ kośe antardhūmena pācayet // /
analyzed: valmīkasya mṛdaḥ kośe antardhūmena pācayet

original: yaralavaśaṣasaha tāny ākāśatattvākṣarāṇi /

analyzed: atra eva tiṣṭha kalyāṇi mama kārśya karī bhava

translated: Oṃ hīṃ rakta-cāmuṇḍe hūṃ phaṭ svāhā.

original: anena mantreṇa puṣyarkṣe hastarkṣe vā nakṣatre sarvāś cauṣadhya utpāṭanīyā yair naraiś
analyzed: anena mantreṇa puṣya ṛkṣe hasta ṛkṣe vā nakṣatre sarvāḥ ca oṣadhyaḥ utpāṭanīyāḥ yaiḥ naraiḥ
translated: By this mantra, all herbs should be uprooted on the Puṣya lunar mansion or Hasta lunar mansion, by those men

original: siddhikārikā na bhavanti /
analyzed: siddhi kārikāḥ na bhavanti

original: yady udite bhāskare utpāṭyante tadā tāsāṃ pūjā kartavyā /🔽japāraktotpalaraktakaravīraraktacandanakuṅkumena gavyagomayena sapādahastabhūmiṃ saṃlipya tanmadhye caturasraṃ kārayet /
analyzed: yadi udite bhāskare utpāṭyante tadā tāsām pūjā kartavyā  japā rakta utpala rakta karavīra rakta candana kuṅkumena gavya gomayena sa pāda hasta bhūmim saṃlipya tad madhye caturasram kārayet
translated: If they are uprooted when the sun has risen, then their worship should be performed.🔽Having smeared the ground with red water, red utpala, red karavīra, red sandalwood, saffron, and cow dung, one should make a square in the middle.

original: raktacandanakuṅkumābhyāṃ tanmadhye vartulaṃ vitastimātraṃ bhānuṃ pūjayet /
analyzed: raktacandana kuṅkumābhyām tad madhye vartulam vitasti mātram bhānum pūjayet
translated: With red sandalwood and saffron, one should worship the sun, one cubit in size, in the middle.

original: pārśve candrādigrahān pūjayet /
analyzed: pārśve candra ādi grahān pūjayet
translated: And one should worship the moon and other planets on the sides.

original: tato raktabhaktapuṣparaktair vakṣyamāṇamantreṇa baliṃ dadyāt /
analyzed: tatas rakta bhakta puṣpa raktaiḥ vakṣyamāṇa mantreṇa balim dadyāt
translated: Then, with red food, red flowers, and red [offerings], one should offer oblations with the following mantra.

original: uoṃ drāṃ drīṃ drūṃ draiṃ drauṃ draḥ saḥ svāhā /
analyzed: uoṃ drāṃ drīṃ drūṃ draiṃ drauṃ draḥ saḥ svāhā
translated: Om, Dram, Drim, Drum, Dreum, Dreum, Dreh, Sah, Svaha.

original: anena mantreṇa pūjāṃ kṛtvotpāṭayed vīryayuktā bhavati sarvakāryakṣamā bhavati // /
analyzed: anena mantreṇa pūjām kṛtvā utpāṭayet vīrya yuktā bhavati sarva kārya kṣamā bhavati
translated: Having worshipped with this mantra, one should uproot it. It becomes endowed with valor and capable of accomplishing all tasks.

original: Uḍḍāmareśvaratantra /
translated: Uddamara Ishvara Tantra.

original: Aṣṭamaḥ paṭalaḥ
analyzed: aṣṭamaḥ paṭalaḥ
translated: The Eighth Chapter

original: athānyat sampravakṣyāmi nārīṇāṃ garbhadhāraṇam /
analyzed: atha anyat sampravakṣyāmi nārīṇām garbhadhāraṇam
translated: Now I will explain something else, the retention of women's menstrual blood.

original: padmabījaṃ gavyapayasā saha yā narī pibati sā garbhavatī bhavati satyam eva ādityavāre nimantrayet candravāre bhakṣayet /
analyzed: padma bījam gavya payasā saha yā narī pibati sā garbhavatī bhavati satyam eva ādityavāre nimantrayet candravāre bhakṣayet
translated: A woman who drinks lotus seeds with cow's milk becomes pregnant, it is true. On Sunday, she should invite, and on Monday, she should eat.

original: pūrvadigbhāgasthitaṃ śarīṣamūlaṃ gavyaghṛtena saha ṛtusamaye bhakṣayet sā saṃvatsareṇa garbhavatī bhavati /
analyzed: pūrva digbhāga sthitam śarīṣa mūlam gavya ghṛtena saha ṛtu samaye bhakṣayet sā saṃvatsareṇa garbhavatī bhavati
translated: The root of Shariva located in the eastern direction, she should eat at the time of menstruation with cow's ghee. She becomes pregnant within a year.

original: anapatyā ca yā narī kapitthaṃ bhakṣayet sadā /
analyzed: anapatyā ca yā narī kapittham bhakṣayet sadā
translated: A woman who is childless should always eat wood apple.

original: abhimantrya tu mantreṇa sāpi putravatī bhavet // /
analyzed: abhimantrya tu mantreṇa sā api putravatī bhavet
translated: Having enchanted it with the mantra, she too will have a son.

original: ekavṛkṣataṭe nārī snānaṃ kṛtvābhimantrayet /
analyzed: eka vṛkṣa taṭe nārī snānam kṛtvā abhimantrayet
translated: A woman should bathe on the bank of a single tree and enchant it.

original: ādivandhyāpi deveśi bhaved garbhavatī hi sā // /
analyzed: ādivandhyā api deveśi bhavet garbhavatī hi sā
translated: O Goddess of the gods, even a barren woman will become pregnant.

original: devaḥ śivo bhaved yatra nadīsaṅgam asaṃnidhau /
analyzed: devaḥ śivaḥ bhavet yatra nadī saṅgam asaṃnidhau
translated: Where there is a river confluence in the vicinity of Lord Shiva,

original: tasyāṃ nadyāṃ diśi svāhā vandhyā putravatī bhavet // /
analyzed: tasyām nadyām diśi svāhā vandhyā putravatī bhavet
translated: In that river, in that direction, Svaha, the barren woman, would become endowed with a son.

original: vidhir atrocyate kapilāgomayenātha bhūmiṃ saṃlipya yatnataḥ /
analyzed: vidhiḥ atrā ucyate kapilā gomayena atha bhūmim saṃlipya yatnataḥ
translated: The procedure is stated here: Having smeared the ground carefully with the dung of a tawny cow,

original: snātvā vidhiprakāreṇa maṇḍalaṃ kārayet tataḥ // /
analyzed: snātvā vidhi prakāreṇa maṇḍalam kārayet tatas
translated: Having bathed in the prescribed manner, one should then have a mandala made.

original: caturasraṃ catuṣkoṇaṃ tanmadhye vartulaṃ smṛtam /
analyzed: catur asram catuṣkoṇam tad madhye vartulam smṛtam
translated: It should be square with four corners, and a circle is remembered in its center.

original: tanmadhye vilikhet paścād aṣṭapattraṃ sakarṇikam // /
analyzed: tad madhye vilikhet paścāt aṣṭa pattram sa karṇikam
translated: In its center, one should then inscribe an eight-petaled lotus with a pericarp.

original: madhye tu pūjayed devaṃ pattre śaktiṃ prapūjayet /
analyzed: madhye tu pūjayet devam pattre śaktim prapūjayet
translated: In the center, one should worship the Lord, and on the petals, one should worship the Shakti.

original: nirvraṇamaṇḍalasyāgre kamalaṃ sthāpayed budhaḥ // /
analyzed: nirvraṇa maṇḍalasya agre kamalam sthāpayet budhaḥ
translated: In front of the mandala without any defect, the wise one should place a lotus.

original: śikhipattranakhavarṇena likhet /
analyzed: śikhi pattra nakha varṇena likhet
translated: One should draw it with the color of peacock feathers.🔽The clay of the seven mountains of the Bhrngi clan,

original: bhṛṅgatā kulasaptaparvatamṛttikā / / / Zeichenjh svamalāmṛttikāvalmīkamṛttikānimbamūlamṛttikā
analyzed: bhṛṅga tā kula sapta parvata mṛttikā
translated: the clay of one's own body, the clay of an anthill, the clay of the root of a neem tree,

original: suvarṇarajatatāmrakāṃsyasahasramūlasarvatīrthāni samudrāḥ saritaḥ sarvāḥ sarvauṣadhayaḥ
analyzed: suvarṇa rajata tāmra kāṃsya sahasra mūla sarva tīrthāni samudrāḥ saritaḥ sarvāḥ sarva oṣadhayaḥ
translated: gold, silver, copper, brass, the root of a thousand, all the holy places, the oceans, all the rivers, all the herbs,

original: sarvadevatāḥ sarvasiddhayaḥ sarvayoginyaḥ sarve girayaḥ sarve nāgāḥ pañcajātyāni
analyzed: sarva devatāḥ sarva siddhayaḥ sarva yoginyaḥ sarve girayaḥ sarve nāgāḥ pañca jātyāni
translated: all the deities, all the accomplishments, all the yoginis, all the mountains, all the nagas, the five types of birth,

original: phalāni pañcaprakārākṣatāni pañca suvarṇapuṣpāṇi sthiracittena mantritakalaśe parikalpayet /
analyzed: phalāni pañca prakāra akṣatāni pañca suvarṇa puṣpāṇi sthira cittena mantrita kalaśe parikalpayet
translated: The fruits are of five types, the flowers are of five types, and the gold flowers should be imagined in the mantra-consecrated pot with a firm mind.

original: atha mantraḥ kṣaṃ kṣīṃ kṣūṃ kṣaiṃ kṣauṃ kṣaḥ /
analyzed: atha mantraḥ kṣaṃ kṣīṃ kṣūṃ kṣaiṃ kṣauṃ kṣaḥ
translated: Now, the mantra is: Kṣaṃ, Kṣīṃ, Kṣūṃ, Kṣaiṃ, Kṣauṃ, Kṣaḥ.

original: anena mantreṇa yā narī vidhānena niratavarjitā abrahmacāriṇī devī vandhyā pañcapativarjitā /
analyzed: anena mantreṇa yā narī vidhānena nirata varjitā abrahmacāriṇī devī vandhyā pañca pati varjitā
translated: By this mantra, a woman who is not devoted to the rules, who is not celibate, who is barren, who has abandoned five husbands,

original: aputrā labhate putrān durbhagā subhagā bhavet /
analyzed: aputrā labhate putrān durbhagā subhagā bhavet
translated: who is childless, obtains sons, and an unfortunate woman becomes fortunate.

original: anenaiva vidhānena kanyā prāpnoti satpatim // /
analyzed: anena eva vidhānena kanyā prāpnoti sat patim
translated: By this very method, a maiden obtains a good husband.

original: mantrauṣadhīprayogāś ca ye cānye cūrṇakīrṇakāḥ /
analyzed: mantra oṣadhī prayogāḥ ca ye ca anye cūrṇa kīrṇakāḥ
translated: The mantra and medicinal preparations, and the other powders and sprays,

original: navābhicāritāḥ kūrāḥ śuddhadehā bhavanti te // /
analyzed: nava abhicāritāḥ kūrāḥ śuddha dehāḥ bhavanti te
translated: the nine types of sorcery, they become pure-bodied.

original: ye cānye vighnakartāraś caranti bhuvi rākṣasāḥ /
analyzed: ye ca anye vighna kartāraḥ caranti bhuvi rākṣasāḥ
translated: And the other obstructing demons that roam the earth,

original: te sarve pralayaṃ yānti satyaṃ devi mayoditam // /
analyzed: te sarve pralayam yānti satyam devi mayā uditam
translated: they all perish, O Goddess, the truth has been spoken by me.

original: sakṛd uccarite mantre mahāpuṇyaṃ prajāyate /
analyzed: sakṛt uccarite mantre mahā puṇyam prajāyate
translated: When the mantra is uttered once, great merit is produced.

original: brahmahatyādayo doṣāḥ kṣayaṃ yānti na saṃśayaḥ // /
analyzed: brahmahatyā ādayaḥ doṣāḥ kṣayam yānti na saṃśayaḥ
translated: The faults such as Brahmanicide perish, there is no doubt.

original: atha prathamopāya ucyate nāgakesara māṣakaṃ gavyaghṛtena sahartusnānadivase pibet /
analyzed: atha prathama upāyaḥ ucyate nāgakesara māṣakam gavya ghṛtena saha ṛtu snāna divase pibet
translated: Now, the first method is described: One should drink a māṣaka of Nāgakesara together with cow ghee on the day of seasonal bathing.

original: tadanantaraṃ bhartrā saha rātrau saṃyogaṃ kuryāt /
analyzed: tad anantaram bhartrā saha rātrau saṃyogam kuryāt
translated: Then she should have intercourse with her husband at night.

original: sā avaśyam eva garbhavatī bhavati /
analyzed: sā avaśyam eva garbhavatī bhavati
translated: She will certainly become pregnant.

original: atha dvitīyopāyaḥ śvetajīrakam māṣamātrakaṃ rātrau mṛnmayapātre jalena saha nirāvaraṇasthāne samagrarātrau sthāpayet /🔽agnimadivase śilāyāṃ piṣṭvā paryuṣitajalena yā strī ṛtusnānadine pītvā rātrau bhartrā saha saṃyogaṃ kuryād avaśyaṃ sā garbhavatī bhavati /
analyzed: atha dvitīya upāyaḥ śveta jīrakam māṣa mātrakam rātrau mṛd maya pātre jalena saha nirāvaraṇa sthāne samagra rātrau sthāpayet  śilāyām piṣṭvā paryuṣita jalena yā strī ṛtusnāna dine pītvā rātrau bhartrā saha saṃyogam kuryāt avaśyam sā garbhavatī bhavati
translated: Now, the second method: One should place a measure of white cumin seeds in a clay pot at night, along with water, in an uncovered place for the entire night.🔽On the following day, one should grind it on a stone with old water, and the woman who drinks it on the day of her menstrual bath and has intercourse with her husband at night will certainly become pregnant.

original: atha tṛtīyopāya dakālvadmadīpi māṣakaṃ gavyadugdhena saha yā ṛtusnānadivase pītvā rātrau bhartrā saha saṃyogaṃ kuryāt sā avaśyam eva garbhavatī 🔽bhavati /
analyzed: atha māṣakam gavya dugdhena saha yā ṛtusnāna divase pītvā rātrau bhartrā saha saṃyogam kuryāt sā avaśyam eva garbhavatī  bhavati
translated: Now, the third method: One should drink a measure of the root of the white yam along with cow's milk on the day of her menstrual bath and have intercourse with her husband at night. She will certainly become pregnant.

original: iti tṛtīyopāyaḥ /
analyzed: iti tṛtīya upāyaḥ
translated: This is the third method.

original: uoṃ ghaṇṭākarṇāya svāhā imaṃ saptadhā japtvā grāme nagare vā praviśet tatra viśiṣṭaṃ bhojanaṃ prāpnoti /
analyzed: uoṃ ghaṇṭākarṇāya svāhā imam saptadhā japtvā grāme nagare vā praviśet tatra viśiṣṭam bhojanam prāpnoti
translated: One should recite this seven times and enter a village or town. There one will obtain special food.

original: anyac ca bho alla me siddhā anenāṣṭottaraśataṃ japet /
analyzed: anyat ca bho alla me siddhāḥ anena aṣṭottaraśatam japet
translated: And furthermore, O Blessed One, this is accomplished. One should recite it one hundred and eight times.

original: śirīṣamūlamṛdaḥ kṣetrasya catuṣkoṇeṣu mokṣayet tadā śaśakamūṣakavarāhacatuṣpādaprabhṛtīnāṃ mukhabandhanaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: śirīṣa mūla mṛdaḥ kṣetrasya catuṣkoṇeṣu mokṣayet tadā śaśaka mūṣaka varāha catuṣpāda prabhṛtīnām mukha bandhanam bhavati
translated: One should release the clay of Shirisha root in the four corners of the field, then there will be a mouth-binding of rabbits, mice, boars, quadrupeds, and so on.

original: adhunā sampravakṣyāmi mantrān me phaladāyakāḥ /
analyzed: adhunā sampravakṣyāmi mantrān me phala dāyakāḥ
translated: Now I shall explain the mantras that give me results.

original: ye sidhyati daśānyūnaṃ mantrasādhanamuktidāḥ // /
analyzed: ye sidhyati daśa anyūnam mantra sādhana mukti dāḥ
translated: Those that are accomplished are less than ten, giving liberation through the practice of mantras.

original: śatrumitrodāsīnasādhyasiddhasya lakṣaṇam /
analyzed: śatru mitra udāsīna sādhya siddhasya lakṣaṇam
translated: The characteristics of enemies, friends, neutrals, and those to be accomplished.

original: mantrākṣarāṇi likhitvā sādhakasya tasya yadāpi ca prathamavargākṣaro bhavati tadā mitraṃ dvitīyavargākṣaro bhavati tadā siddhaḥ /
analyzed: mantra akṣarāṇi likhitvā sādhakasya tasya yadā api ca prathama varga akṣaraḥ bhavati tadā mitram dvitīya varga akṣaraḥ bhavati tadā siddhaḥ
translated: Having written the syllables of the mantra, if the first syllable of the practitioner becomes the first group of syllables, then it is a friend. If the second group of syllables becomes the second group of syllables, then it is accomplished.

original: tṛtīyavargasya yadā bhavati tadā sādhyaḥ caturthavargākṣaro bhavati tadodāsīnaḥ pañcamavargākṣaro yadā bhavati tadā śatrur jñātavyaḥ /
analyzed: tṛtīya vargasya yadā bhavati tadā sādhyaḥ caturtha varga akṣaraḥ bhavati tadā udāsīnaḥ pañcama varga akṣaraḥ yadā bhavati tadā śatruḥ jñātavyaḥ
translated: When it becomes of the third group, then it is to be accomplished. If the fourth group of syllables becomes the fourth group of syllables, then it is neutral. When the fifth group of syllables becomes the fifth group of syllables, then it should be known as an enemy.

original: etān bhedān jñātvā mantraśodhanam ārabhet tadā sādhakānāṃ sukhāvaho bhavati atha kalpavṛkṣaṣaṇḍamūlāni yāni prakṣālitāni gavyadadhimiśritāyāṃ
analyzed: etān bhedān jñātvā mantra śodhanam ārabhet tadā sādhakānām sukha āvahaḥ bhavati atha kalpavṛkṣa ṣaṇḍa mūlāni yāni prakṣālitāni gavya dadhi miśritāyām
translated: Having known these distinctions, one should begin the purification of the mantra. Then it becomes a source of happiness for the practitioners. Then the roots of the Kalpa tree groves should be washed and purified in a mixture of cow's curd and

original: rājikāyāṃ saṃskāryāṇi /
analyzed: rājikāyām saṃskāryāṇi
translated: mustard seeds.

original: tato niyamapūrvakaṃ bhakṣayet /
analyzed: tatas niyama pūrvakam bhakṣayet
translated: Then one should eat it after performing the prescribed rituals.

original: nirvyādhiyogeṣv amuṃ svamukhe niyojayet /
analyzed: nirvyādhi yogeṣu amum sva mukhe niyojayet
translated: One should place this in one's own mouth in the case of diseases.

original: vidhānam asyā bravīmīti devī /
analyzed: vidhānam asyāḥ bravīmi iti devī
translated: The Goddess says: I will tell you the procedure for this.

original: atha mantraḥ uoṃ namaḥ ṣaṇmukhāya śaktihastāya mayūravāhanāya auṣadhīkena dehi me bhava svāhā /
analyzed: atha mantraḥ uoṃ namaḥ ṣaṇmukhāya śakti hastāya mayūra vāhanāya auṣadhīkena dehi me bhava svāhā
translated: Now the mantra: Oṃ, salutations to the Six-faced One, the one with a spear in hand, the one with a peacock as a vehicle, with the herb, give me well-being, svāhā.

original: anena mantreṇa caturdaśyāṃ śucir bhūtvā mayūraśikhām utpāṭayet tadā mahāprabhāvayuktā bhavati /
analyzed: anena mantreṇa caturdaśyām śuciḥ bhūtvā mayūra śikhām utpāṭayet tadā mahā prabhāva yuktā bhavati
translated: With this mantra, on the fourteenth day, having become pure, one should uproot the peacock's crest, then it becomes endowed with great power.

original: gavyaghṛtena saha saṃgṛhyeta tadā indriyabalo bhavati /
analyzed: gavya ghṛtena saha saṃgṛhyeta tadā indriya balaḥ bhavati
translated: If it is collected along with cow ghee, then one becomes strong in the senses.

original: pañcamalena svarṇakāro bhavati /
analyzed: pañca malena svarṇakāraḥ bhavati
translated: If it is mixed with the fifth essence, one becomes a goldsmith.

original: anyac ca śvetakaravīramūlaśvetagirikarṇikāmūlahevacanāṅbhīkṛtajātāñjalī pañcamalasamāyuktā khāne pāne pradātavyā maraṇāntaṃ vaśīkaraṇam //
analyzed: anyat ca pañcamala samāyuktā khāne pāne pradātavyā maraṇa antam vaśīkaraṇam
translated: And something else: the root of white karavīra, the root of white girikarṇikā, the root of heva, and the root of arjuna, mixed with the fifth essence, should be given in food and drink. It brings subjugation until death.

original: anyac ca śvetagirikarṇikāmūlaṃ svavīryeṇa saha svakīyapañcamalaharavīryaśvetārkamūlam
analyzed: anyat ca śveta girikarṇikā mūlam sva vīryeṇa saha svakīya pañcamalahara vīrya śveta arka mūlam
translated: And something else: the root of white girikarṇikā, along with its own potency, the potency of the fifth essence of one's own, and the root of white arka,

original: etāni hastarkṣe puṣyarkṣe vā ekīkṛtya kumārikāhastābhyāṃ mardayitvā aṣṭamyāṃ caturdaśyāṃ
analyzed: etāni hasta ṛkṣe puṣya ṛkṣe vā ekīkṛtya kumārikā hastābhyām mardayitvā aṣṭamyām caturdaśyām
translated: these should be mixed together under the constellation Hasta or Puṣya, and ground with the hands of a virgin, on the eighth or fourteenth day,

original: vā gajamadena saha haste guṭikāṃ kārayet /
analyzed: vā gajamadena saha haste guṭikām kārayet
translated: Or one should make a pill with the juice of an elephant's ichor.

original: yasyai ekāpi dīyate sā vaśyā bhavati nānyathā /
analyzed: yasyai ekā api dīyate sā vaśyā bhavati na anyathā
translated: If even one of these is given to a woman, she becomes enthralled, not otherwise.

original: śuklapakṣe 'pi sarpāṇāṃ dīyate te sarpā api vaśyā bhavanti śrīmahābhairavasya vaco yathā kuṅkumena saha dīyate tadā vai gajo vaśībhavati /
analyzed: śuklapakṣe sarpāṇām dīyate te sarpāḥ api vaśyāḥ bhavanti śrī mahābhairavasya vacaḥ yathā kuṅkumena saha dīyate tadā vai gajaḥ vaśībhavati
translated: Even snakes given in the bright fortnight become enthralled. As said by the illustrious Mahabhairava: When given with saffron, then the elephant becomes enthralled.

original: rocanayā kuṅkumena saha yadā tilakaṃ kriyate tadā sā strī pṛṣṭhalagnā bhramati /
analyzed: rocanayā kuṅkumena saha yadā tilakam kriyate tadā sā strī pṛṣṭha lagnā bhramati
translated: When a mark is made with rochana and saffron, then that woman wanders around clinging to one's back.

original: gurudārebhyaḥ tilako na darśayitavyaḥ /
analyzed: guru dārebhyaḥ tilakaḥ na darśayitavyaḥ
translated: The mark should not be shown to the wives of gurus.

original: rājadvāre tathā nyāye vivāhe yuddhe jayāvahe trailokyamohanam etat /
analyzed: rājadvāre tathā nyāye vivāhe yuddhe jayāvahe trailokya mohanam etat
translated: At the gate of a king, and in marriage and battle, it brings victory. This is the enthrallment of the three worlds.

original: triphalā māṣāḥ nimba māṣa kadamba māṣa nīpa māṣa tirāitā māṣa karañja māṣa bhṛṅgarāja māṣa mayūraśikhā māṣāḥ etāni samabhāgāni
analyzed: triphalā māṣāḥ nimba māṣa kadamba māṣa nīpa māṣa tirāitā māṣa karañja māṣa bhṛṅgarāja māṣa mayūraśikhā māṣāḥ etāni sama bhāgāni
translated: Triphala, black gram, neem, black gram, kadamba, black gram, black gram, tiraitta, black gram, karanja, black gram, bhrngaraja, black gram, peacock crest, black gram - these are taken in equal parts

analyzed: etat cūrṇam kapittha phalena saha ṛtu samaye aputravatī bhakṣayati sā strī putram āpnoti

original: etac cūrṇaṃ śvetakaṅkolīmūlaṃ lakṣmaṇācūrṇaṃ ca samaṃ kṛtvā kuṅkumakvāthena sahartusamaye sadā bhakṣaṇārthaṃ dīyate tadā tasyāḥ śarīraśuddhir 🔽bhavati /

translated: This powder, along with the root of white kankola and lakshmna powder, if given to eat every day during menstruation with saffron decoction, then her body becomes pure.

original: Uḍḍāmareśvaratantra /
