translated: Now I shall explain another, the tilaka that fulfills all desires.

original: gorocanaṃ vaṃśalocanaṃ matsyapittaṃ kaśmīrakuṅkumakesarasvayambhūkusumasvavīryaśrīkhaṇḍaraktacandanakastūrīkarpūrakākajaṅghāmūlāni
analyzed: gorocanam vaṃśalocanam matsya pittam kaśmīra kuṅkuma kesara svayambhū kusuma sva vīrya śrīkhaṇḍa rakta candana kastūrī karpūra kākajaṅghā mūlāni
translated: Gorochana, vamsha-lochanam, fish bile, Kashmiri saffron, kesara, self-arisen flower, one's own semen, shree-khanda, red sandalwood, musk, camphor, and the root of crow's thigh -

original: samabhāgāni kṛtvā kūpataḍāganadījalena mardayitvā kumārikāpārśvakāṃ guṭikāṃ kṛtvā
analyzed: sama bhāgāni kṛtvā kūpa taḍāga nadī jalena mardayitvā kumārikā pārśvakām guṭikām kṛtvā
translated: having made equal parts, grinding with the water of a well, pond, or river, make a pill on a virgin's side.

original: chāyāṃ guṭikāṃ kārayet /
analyzed: chāyām guṭikām kārayet
translated: Make a pill in the shade.

original: tayā lalāṭe tilakaṃ kṛtvā yāṃ yāṃ striyaṃ paśyati sā sā vaśyā bhavati /
analyzed: tayā lalāṭe tilakam kṛtvā yām yām striyam paśyati sā sā vaśyā bhavati
translated: Having made a tilaka on the forehead with that, whichever woman one sees, she becomes under one's control.

original: drauṃ vāṃ dhāṃ kṣauṃ aṃ kaṃ chaḥ ity anena mantreṇa mahiṣāsthimayaṃ kīlakam ekonaviṃśatyaṅgulaṃ sahasreṇābhimantritaṃ yasya nāmnā kūpataṭe
analyzed: draum vām dhām   aṃ kaṃ chaḥ iti anena mantreṇa mahiṣa asthi mayam kīlakam ekonaviṃśati aṅgulam sahasreṇa abhimantritam yasya nāmnā kūpa taṭe
translated: With the mantra Draum Vam Dham Kshaum Am Kam Chha, a stake made of buffalo bone, nineteen finger-breadths long, enchanted a thousand times with this mantra, if one buries it on the bank of a well

original: nikhanet sa mahiṣeṇa vadhyate /
analyzed: nikhanet sa mahiṣeṇa vadhyate
translated: with the name of the person, he is killed by a buffalo.

original: uoṃ cchaḥ cchaḥ ḹṃ amukaṃ huṃ īṃ cchaḥ cchaḥ uoṃ iti /
analyzed: uoṃ cchaḥ cchaḥ ḹm amukam hum īṃ cchaḥ cchaḥ uoṃ iti
translated: Om Chha Chha Ri Amukam Hum Im Chha Chha Om

original: anena mantreṇa mayūrāsthimayaṃ kīlakaṃ tryaṅgulaṃ sahasreṇābhimantritaṃ yasya nāmnā catuṣpathe nikhanet sa tatra bhramati /
analyzed: anena mantreṇa mayūra asthi mayam kīlakam tri aṅgulam sahasreṇa abhimantritam yasya nāmnā catuṣpathe nikhanet sa tatra bhramati
translated: With this mantra, a stake made of peacock bone, three finger-breadths long, enchanted a thousand times, if one buries it with the name of the person at a crossroads, he wanders there.

original: tatrānenāvatiṣṭhati paryaṭati kṣaṇamātreṇa uttolanena śāntir bhavati /
analyzed: tatra anena avatiṣṭhati paryaṭati kṣaṇa mātreṇa uttolanena śāntiḥ bhavati
translated: There he stays and wanders, and by lifting it up in an instant, there is peace.

original: uoṃ śrīṃ śrīṃ vrāṃ vrīṃ īṃ īṃ cchaḥ cchaḥ svāhā /
analyzed: uoṃ śrīṃ śrīṃ vrāṃ vrīṃ īṃ īṃ cchaḥ cchaḥ svāhā
translated: Om Shrim Shrim Vram Vrim Im Im Chha Chha Svaha

original: anena mantreṇa meṣāsthimayaṃ kīlakaṃ dvādaśāṅgulaṃ sahasreṇābhimantritaṃ kṛtvā yasya gṛhe nikhanet sarvasiddhir asiddhā tasya bhavati /
analyzed: anena mantreṇa meṣa asthi mayam kīlakam dvādaśa aṅgulam sahasreṇa abhimantritam kṛtvā yasya gṛhe nikhanet sarva siddhiḥ asiddhā tasya bhavati
translated: With this mantra, a stake made of ram bone, twelve finger-breadths long, enchanted a thousand times, if one buries it in the house of a person, all accomplishments become unaccomplished for him.

original: drīṃ bandhūkapuṣpasaṃkāśaṃ dhyātavyaṃ mantradīpake /
analyzed: drīṃ bandhūka puṣpa saṃkāśam dhyātavyam mantra dīpake
translated: Drim, one should meditate on the form resembling a bandhuka flower, in the lamp of mantra.

original: kumbhakena varārohe śṛṇu vakṣyāmi ṣaḍguṇam // /
analyzed: kumbhakena varārohe śṛṇu vakṣyāmi ṣaḍguṇam
translated: O beautiful lady, listen, I will tell you the six qualities by means of Kumbhaka.

original: dhyātvā tu māsam ekaṃ tu mahāstrīm ānayed dhruvam /
analyzed: dhyātvā tu māsam ekam tu mahā strīm ānayet dhruvam
translated: Having meditated for one month, one will certainly bring a great woman.

original: māsenaikena manunā ānayen nāgakanyakām // /
analyzed: māsena ekena manunā ānayet nāga kanyakām
translated: Within one month, by this mantra, one will bring a Naga maiden.

original: devakanyāṃ tribhir māsaiḥ sāyāhne nānyathā bhavet /
analyzed: deva kanyām tribhiḥ māsaiḥ sāyāhne na anyathā bhavet
translated: Within three months, one will bring a celestial maiden, in the evening, not otherwise.

original: uoṃ haṃ haḥ iti /
analyzed: uoṃ haṃ haḥ iti
translated: Om, Ham, Hah.

original: anenaiva tu mantreṇa dhyātavyāḥ krodhayājakāḥ // /
analyzed: anena eva tu mantreṇa dhyātavyāḥ krodha yājakāḥ
translated: By this very mantra, the wrathful sacrificers should be meditated upon.

original: yājyasya rudrasaṃkāśaṃ rudrahastaṃ surāsuraiḥ /
analyzed: yājyasya rudra saṃkāśam rudra hastam sura asuraiḥ
translated: The sacrificer's Rudra-like hand, resembling Rudra, of the gods and demons,

original: māsena mānuṣaṃ lokaṃ nāgalokaṃ dvimāsataḥ // /
analyzed: māsena mānuṣam lokam nāga lokam dvi māsataḥ
translated: Within one month, the human world, within two months, the Naga world,

original: tribhir māsais tu deveśi svargalokaṃ na saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: tribhiḥ māsaiḥ tu deveśi svarga lokam na saṃśayaḥ
translated: Within three months, the celestial world, O Goddess of the gods, there is no doubt.

original: ṣaṇmāsābhyāsayogena trailokyaṃ niścalaṃ kuru // /
analyzed: ṣaṣ māsa abhyāsa yogena trailokyam niścalam kuru
translated: By practicing for six months, make the three worlds motionless.

original: uoṃ raktahaṭā raktagaṭā mukuṭadhāriṇī edhati svāhā /
analyzed: uoṃ raktahaṭā raktagaṭā mukuṭa dhāriṇī edhati svāhā
translated: Om, Raktahata, Raktagata, wearing a crown, prospers, svaha.

original: mantrarāja ulṭā vedhā /
analyzed: mantrarājaḥ ulṭā vedhā
translated: The king of mantras, Ultta Vedha.

original: uoṃ hrīṃ śrīṃ dhrīṃ vikṛtānanā bāhye phaṭ svāhā /
analyzed: uoṃ hrīṃ śrīṃ dhrīṃ vikṛta ānanā bāhye phaṭ svāhā
translated: Om, Hrim, Shrim, Dhrum, Vikritanana, in the external, Phat, Svaha.

original: mantram imaṃ yantre likhitvā yasya īkṣitaṃ dīyate sa aikāhikadvyāhikatryāhikaviṣamajvareṇa gṛhyate tatkṣaṇād eva naśyati nātra saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: mantram imam yantre likhitvā yasya īkṣitam dīyate sa aikāhika dvyāhika tryāhika viṣamajvareṇa gṛhyate tad kṣaṇāt eva naśyati na atra saṃśayaḥ
translated: Writing this mantra on a yantra, if it is given to be seen by someone, they will be seized by a one-day, two-day, three-day, or irregular fever and will perish instantly, there is no doubt about it.

original: uoṃ bandhuna kṣayaṃ drīṃ drīṃ amukasyātmānaṃ nityajvareṇa pattrībandhanamātrasya sphura svāhā /
analyzed: uoṃ kṣayam drīṃ drīṃ amukasya ātmānam nitya jvareṇa pattrī bandhana mātrasya sphura svāhā
translated: Oṃ, bindhu, destroy, dṛṃ dṛṃ, the self of such-and-such, with a constant fever, the binding of a leaf, just flash, svāhā.

original: iti nityajvaraśodhanapattrikā /
analyzed: iti nitya jvara śodhana pattrikā
translated: Thus ends the leaf for purifying constant fevers.

original: uoṃ kṣaḥ svāhā /
analyzed: uoṃ kṣaḥ svāhā
translated: Oṃ, kṣaḥ, svāhā.

original: anena mantreṇa mantritaṃ jalaṃ bhṛśaṃ kṛtvā jvaritāṅgaṃ secayet tena jvaravimuktir bhavati niścitam /
analyzed: anena mantreṇa mantritam jalam bhṛśam kṛtvā jvarita aṅgam secayet tena jvara vimuktiḥ bhavati niścitam
translated: Having enchanted water with this mantra, one should sprinkle the feverish body, by that, liberation from fever is certain.

original: kharavāhanasiṃhasya kramād evānuśāsanam /
analyzed: khara vāhana siṃhasya kramāt eva anuśāsanam
translated: The instructions of Kharavāhana and Simha are in order.

original: ṛkṣaturagagato vāyur jīmūta iva garjitaḥ // /
analyzed: ṛkṣa turaga gataḥ vāyuḥ jīmūtaḥ iva garjitaḥ
translated: The wind mounted on a bear and horse roars like a cloud.

original: ravivāre ślokam imaṃ likhitvā śirasi nyaset /
analyzed: ravi vāre ślokam imam likhitvā śirasi nyaset
translated: On a Sunday, having written this verse, one should place it on the head.

original: tena sthāpitamātreṇa traimāsikajvaraṃ haret // /
analyzed: tena sthāpita mātreṇa traimāsika jvaram haret
translated: By merely placing it, one should remove a fever lasting three months.

original: vāneyasya biḍālasya gṛhītvā rudhiraṃ tataḥ /🔽padmasūtrotthavartiṃ ca bhāvayet saptavārakam // /
analyzed: vāneyasya biḍālasya gṛhītvā rudhiram tatas        ca bhāvayet
translated: Then, having taken the blood of a forest-born cat,🔽one should infuse a wick made of lotus thread seven times.

original: śivāgre tajjatailena pātayet kajjalaṃ tataḥ /
analyzed: śiva agre tad ja tailena pātayet kajjalam tatas
translated: Then, in front of Śiva, one should drop lampblack with that sesame oil.

original: tenāñjitalocanas tu adṛśyo bhavati dhruvam // /
analyzed: tena añjita locanaḥ tu adṛśyaḥ bhavati dhruvam
translated: One whose eyes are anointed with it becomes invisible, for sure.

original: hebhirihebherihe /
analyzed: hebhirihebherihe
translated: Hehirihehebirehi.

original: anenodakam ādāyālokya sahasravāraṃ parijapya anenaivāñjanena trirātreṇa siddhiḥ /
analyzed: anena udakam ādāya ālokya sahasra vāram parijapya anena eva añjanena tri rātreṇa siddhiḥ
translated: Having taken water with this, having recited it a thousand times while looking at it, with this very collyrium, success comes in three nights.

original: padmasūtravartikasya tailena kajjalaṃ pātayet tenāñjitanetras tu adṛśyo bhavati /
analyzed: padma sūtra vartikasya tailena kajjalam pātayet tena añjita netraḥ tu adṛśyaḥ bhavati
translated: One should drop collyrium in oil from a lotus thread wick. One whose eyes are anointed with it becomes invisible.

original: tato gomūtreṇa cakṣuṣī prakṣālya punaḥ pratyakṣo bhavati // /
analyzed: tatas go mūtreṇa cakṣuṣī prakṣālya punar pratyakṣaḥ bhavati
translated: Then, having washed the eyes with cow's urine, one becomes visible again.

original: atha ḍākinīdamanamantraḥ akṣaḥ kṣāṃ kṣaukājasinau devatā tattvadhūlinī ghonāśālinī
analyzed: atha ḍākinī damana mantraḥ akṣaḥ   devatā tattva dhūlinī
translated: Now, the mantra for subduing the Dākinīs: Aksha, Kshām, Kshou, Kaja, Sinau, the deity, Tatva, Dhūlinī, Ghonā, Shālinī,

original: bhamantri bandhuśanādaivataṃ laghukaṇṭakena purum abhiśāsano devatāṃ mahābhairava
analyzed: laghu kaṇṭakena purum abhiśāsanaḥ devatām mahā bhairava
translated: The deity of the Bhamantra, Bandhu, Shanadai, the deity, with the small thorn, the chastiser of men, the great Bhairava deity,

original: maṇḍalam acala uoṃ cchaḥ cchaḥ cchaḥ ḍākinīmatabandhu namaḥ /
analyzed: maṇḍalam acala uoṃ cchaḥ cchaḥ cchaḥ ḍākinī mata bandhu namaḥ
translated: The mandala, immovable, Oṁ, chh, chh, chh, the Dākinī's bound friend, homage.

original: uoṃ namo bhagavate vajrāya caṇḍeśvarāya īṃ īṃ phaṭ svāhā /
analyzed: uoṃ namaḥ bhagavate vajrāya caṇḍeśvarāya īṃ īṃ phaṭ svāhā
translated: Oṁ, homage to the Blessed Vajra, to Caṇḍeśvara, īṁ īṁ phaṭ svāhā.

original: iti sarvabhūtaḍākinīdamanamantraḥ /
analyzed: iti sarva bhūta ḍākinī damana mantraḥ
translated: This is the mantra for subduing all the Dākinīs of the Bhūtas.

original: damana sarpalaṅga ebhalisim ajabandhaniśi nāgapāśam acalaḥ iti damanamantraṃ bandhanaṃ ca /
analyzed: damana sarpa laṅgaḥ aja bandha niśi nāgapāśam acalaḥ iti damana mantram bandhanam ca
translated: Daman, sarpa, laṅga, ebhali, sim, ajabandhani, niśi, nāgapāśa, immovable - this is the daman mantra and the binding.

original: uoṃ raṃstrīṃ śīghraṃ ha svāhā /
analyzed: uoṃ raṃ strīm śīghram ha svāhā
translated: Oṃ raṃ stīṃ śīghraṃ ha svāhā.

original: tripurāṃ sindūraśaṅkhacūrṇābhyāṃ udanālapattre likhitvā śodhayitavyaḥ sa divasatrayeṇa jvareṇāgatya milati /
analyzed: tripurām sindūra śaṅkha cūrṇābhyām uda nāla pattre likhitvā śodhayitavyaḥ sa divasa trayeṇa jvareṇa āgatya milati
translated: One should purify Tripura written with vermilion and conch powder on a leaf of wild rice. He will be afflicted with fever for three days and will come and unite.

original: uoṃ ahohaḥ amukanamnīṃ śīghram ānaya svāhā ity ākarṣaṇam // /
analyzed: uoṃ ahohaḥ amuka namnīm śīghram ānaya svāhā iti ākarṣaṇam
translated: Oṃ ahohaḥ amukanāmni śīghram ānaya svāhā - this is for attraction.

original: uoṃ strīṃ strīṃ valīṃ valīm īṃ ahaḥ phaṭ svāhā /
analyzed: uoṃ strīm strīm valīm valīm īṃ ahar phaṭ svāhā
translated: Oṃ stīṃ stīṃ valīṃ valīṃ īṃ ahas phaṭ svāhā.

original: majjanasvastho bhavati /
analyzed: majjana svasthaḥ bhavati
translated: One becomes free from leprosy.

original: apsaraṇīṃ amukīṃ jīva /
analyzed: ap saraṇīm amukīm jīva
translated: Oṃ jīva amukī apsaraṇī.

original: tena anena mantreṇa saptavāraṃ jalaṃ prajapya kāminyai pānārthaṃ dātavyam /
analyzed: tena anena mantreṇa sapta vāram jalam prajapya kāminyai pāna artham dātavyam
translated: With this mantra, one should recite the water seven times and give it to drink to the beloved.

original: uoṃ namo jale mohe kule phalāni saṃkule svāhā /
analyzed: uoṃ namaḥ jale mohe kule phalāni saṃkule svāhā
translated: Oṃ namaḥ jale mohe kule phalāni saṃkule svāhā.

original: anena mantreṇa saptavārābhimantritaṃ yasya dīyate sa vaśyo bhavati /
analyzed: anena mantreṇa sapta vāra abhimantritam yasya dīyate sa vaśyaḥ bhavati
translated: With this mantra, one should give to someone, having enchanted it seven times. He becomes subservient.

original: uoṃ namo jale mohe drāṃ abjini phaṭ svāhā /
analyzed: uoṃ namaḥ jale mohe drāṃ abjini phaṭ svāhā
translated: Oṃ namaḥ jale mohe drāṃ abjiniphaṭ svāhā.

original: anena mantreṇa pratyūṣe pānīyena mukhaṃ prakṣālayet sarvajanapriyo bhavati sarvasiddhīśvaro bhavati // /
analyzed: anena mantreṇa pratyūṣe pānīyena mukham prakṣālayet sarva jana priyaḥ bhavati sarva siddhi īśvaraḥ bhavati
translated: With this mantra, one should wash one's face with water at dawn. One becomes dear to all people, and becomes the lord of all accomplishments.

original: uoṃ bhūr bhuvaḥ svaḥ svāhā /
analyzed: uoṃ bhūḥ bhuvaḥ svar svāhā
translated: Oṃ bhūr bhuvaḥ svaḥ svāhā.

original: tāmbūlaṃ mantrayitvā yasya dīyate sa vaśyo bhavati /
analyzed: tāmbūlam mantrayitvā yasya dīyate sa vaśyaḥ bhavati
translated: If betel nut is offered to someone after incanting it with this mantra, they become enthralled.

original: uoṃ namo jale mohe hana hana daha daha paca paca matha matha amukaṃ me vaśam ānaya svāhā /
analyzed: uoṃ namaḥ jale mohe hana hana daha daha paca paca matha matha amukam me vaśam ānaya svāhā
translated: Oṃ, salutations! Delude, delude! Strike, strike! Burn, burn! Cook, cook! Churn, churn! Bring such-and-such under my control! Svāhā.

original: atha yakṣiṇīmantrasādhanaṃ surasundarīmanohāriṇīkanakāvatīratikarīkāmeśvarīnaṭyanurāgiṇīpadminī etā aṣṭau yakṣiṇyaḥ kāmanāyāṃ sādhanam /
analyzed: atha yakṣiṇī mantra sādhanam etāḥ aṣṭau yakṣiṇyaḥ kāmanāyām sādhanam
translated: Now, the eight Yakṣiṇīs - Surasundarī, Manohāriṇī, Kanakavatī, Ratikarī, Kāmeśvarī, Naṭyanurāgiṇī, and Padminī - are the means of accomplishment for the fulfillment of desires.

original: atha surasundarīsādhanam uoṃ hrīṃ āgaccha āgaccha surasundari svāhā /
analyzed: atha surasundarī sādhanam uoṃ hrīṃ āgaccha āgaccha surasundari svāhā
translated: Now, the means of accomplishment of Surasundarī: Oṃ hrīṃ, come, come, O Surasundarī, svāhā.

original: vajrapāṇigṛhaṃ gatvā gugguladhūpaṃ dattvā trisaṃdhyaṃ pūjayet sahasraṃ trisaṃdhyaṃ māsaparyantaṃ japet tato māsābhyantare pratyakṣā bhavati
analyzed: vajrapāṇi gṛham gatvā guggula dhūpam dattvā trisaṃdhyam pūjayet sahasram trisaṃdhyam māsa paryantam japet tatas māsa abhyantare pratyakṣā bhavati
translated: Having gone to the abode of Vajrapāṇi, having offered bdellium incense, one should worship at the three junctions of the day. One should recite the mantra one thousand times at the three junctions for a month. Then within a month, she becomes visible.

original: antimadine raktacandanenārghyaṃ dadyāt /
analyzed: antima dine raktacandanena arghyam dadyāt
translated: On the last day, one should offer a respectful offering with red sandalwood.

original: tata āgatya mātā bhaginī bhāryā vā bhavati tāsāṃ yāni karmāṇi tāny eva karoti /
analyzed: tatas āgatya mātā bhaginī bhāryā vā bhavati tāsām yāni karmāṇi tāni eva karoti
translated: Then, having come, she becomes a mother, sister, or wife. She performs the same actions as them.

original: yadi mātā bhavati tadā siddhadravyāṇi rasāyanāni dadāti /
analyzed: yadi mātā bhavati tadā siddha dravyāṇi rasāyanāni dadāti
translated: If she becomes a mother, she gives alchemical substances and elixirs.

original: yadi bhaginī bhavati tadā pūrvavad amūlyaṃ vastraṃ dadāti /
analyzed: yadi bhaginī bhavati tadā pūrvavat amūlyam vastram dadāti
translated: If she is a sister, then as before, one should give an invaluable garment.

original: yadi bhāryā bhavati tadā sarvam aiśvaryaṃ paripūrayati /
analyzed: yadi bhāryā bhavati tadā sarvam aiśvaryam paripūrayati
translated: If she is a wife, then all sovereignty is fulfilled.

original: paraṃ tu varjanīyam ihānyayā saha śayanaṃ sā ca maithunapriyā bhavati anyathā naśyati // /
analyzed: param tu varjanīyam iha anyayā saha śayanam sā ca maithuna priyā bhavati anyathā naśyati
translated: But one should avoid sleeping with another here. She is fond of sexual intercourse, otherwise she perishes.

original: atha manohāriṇīsādhanam uoṃ hīṃ āgaccha āgaccha manohari svāhā /
analyzed: atha manohāriṇī sādhanam uoṃ hīṃ āgaccha āgaccha manohari svāhā
translated: Now, the means of attaining Manohari: Oṃ hīṃ, come, come, O Manohari, svāhā.

original: iha nadīsaṃgame gatvā candanena maṇḍalaṃ kṛtvā agurudhūpaṃ dattvā sahasraikaṃ mantraṃ māsaparyantaṃ pratyahaṃ japet /
analyzed: iha nadī saṃgame gatvā candanena maṇḍalam kṛtvā aguru dhūpam dattvā sahasra ekam mantram māsa paryantam pratyaham japet
translated: Having gone to the confluence of rivers here, having made a circle with sandalwood, having offered aguru incense, one should recite the mantra one thousand times for a month, every day.

original: tato māsānte candanodakenārghyaṃ dadyāt puṣpaphalenaikacittena tasyā arcanaṃ kartavyaṃ🔽tato 'rdharātrasamaye niyatam āgacchati āgatā satī tadājñāṃ karoti suvarṇaśataṃ tasmai
analyzed: tatas māsa ante candana udakena arghyam dadyāt puṣpa phalena ekacittena tasyāḥ arcanam kartavyam  tatas ṛdharātra samaye niyatam āgacchati āgatā satī tad ājñām karoti suvarṇa śatam tasmai
translated: Then at the end of the month, one should offer arghya with sandalwood water, and with one-pointed mind, worship should be done with flower and fruit.

original: sādhakāya pratyahaṃ dadāti // /
analyzed: sādhakāya pratyaham dadāti
translated: Then at midnight, she definitely comes. Having come, she obeys his command and gives one hundred gold coins to that practitioner every day.

original: atha kanakāvatīsādhanam uoṃ hrīṃ kanakāvati maithunapriye āgaccha āgaccha svāhā /
analyzed: atha kanakāvatī sādhanam uoṃ hrīṃ kanakāvati maithuna priye āgaccha āgaccha svāhā
translated: Now, the means of attaining Kanakavati: Oṃ hrīṃ, O Kanakavati, fond of sexual intercourse, come, come, svāhā.

original: vaṭavṛkṣasamīpe sthitvā madyamāṃsādinaivedyaṃ tasyai mūlamantreṇa dattvā śeṣaṃ svayam apy aṅgīkṛtya sahasram ekaṃ mūlamantraṃ japet /
analyzed: vaṭa vṛkṣa samīpe sthitvā madya māṃsa ādi naivedyam tasyai mūlamantreṇa dattvā śeṣam svayam api aṅgīkṛtya sahasram ekam mūlamantram japet
translated: Standing near a banyan tree, having offered wine, meat, and other offerings to her with the root mantra, having accepted the remainder oneself, one should recite the root mantra one thousand times.

original: evaṃ saptadinaparyantaṃ kuryāt /
analyzed: evam sapta dina paryantam kuryāt
translated: One should do this for seven days.

original: aṣṭamyāṃ rātrāv ardharātrasamaye vastrālaṃkārabhūṣitā aṣṭau parivārān ādāyopagacchati /
analyzed: aṣṭamyām rātrau ardharātra samaye vastra alaṃkāra bhūṣitā aṣṭau parivārān ādāya upagacchati
translated: On the eighth night, at midnight, adorned with clothes and ornaments, she comes with a retinue of eight.

original: āgatā sā kāmayitavyā bhāryā vā bhavati dvādaśajanānāṃ vastrālaṃkārabhojanaṃ ca dadāti aṣṭau kalā nityaṃ sādhakāya prayacchati // /
analyzed: āgatā sā kāmayitavyā bhāryā vā bhavati dvādaśa janānām vastra alaṃkāra bhojanam ca dadāti aṣṭau kalāḥ nityam sādhakāya prayacchati
translated: Having come, she should be enjoyed. She becomes the wife of twelve people. She gives clothes, ornaments, and food. She always gives eight arts to the practitioner.

original: atha kāmeśvarīsādhanam uoṃ hīṃ āgaccha āgaccha kāmeśvari svāhā /🔽iha gorocanayā bhūrjapattropari strīrūpāṃ pratimāṃ saṃlikhya ṣoḍaśopacāraiḥ pañcopacārair
analyzed: atha kāmeśvarī sādhanam uoṃ hīṃ āgaccha āgaccha kāmeśvari svāhā  iha gorocanayā bhūrja pattra upari strī rūpām pratimām saṃlikhya ṣoḍaśa upacāraiḥ pañca upacāraiḥ
translated: Now, the means of attaining Kaameshwari: Oom, Heem, come, come, O Kaameshwari, svaha.

original: vā sampūjya tataḥ śayyāyām ekākī ekānte upaviśya tanmanā bhūtvā sahasraṃ japet tato
analyzed: vā sampūjya tatas śayyāyām ekākī ekānte upaviśya tanmanāḥ bhūtvā sahasram japet
translated: Here, having drawn a female form on a birch bark leaf with bovine bezoar, having worshipped with sixteen or five services, then alone in a secluded place on a bed, having become one-pointed, one should recite the mantra one thousand times. Then,

original: māsānte tadbuddhyā svakīyāṃ bhāryāṃ pūjayet /
analyzed: māsa ante tad buddhyā svakīyām bhāryām pūjayet
translated: at the end of the month, one should worship one's own wife with that intention.

original: tato madhusarpirbhyāṃ pratirātraṃ dīpaṃ prajvālya paścān maunaṃ kṛtvā mūlamantraṃ sahasrasaṃkhyaṃ japet /
analyzed: tatas madhu sarpirbhyām pratirātram dīpam prajvālya paścāt maunam kṛtvā mūlamantram sahasra saṃkhyam japet
translated: Then, each night, having lit a lamp with honey and ghee, and remaining silent afterwards, one should recite the root mantra one thousand times.

original: tato 'rdharātrasamaye niyatam āgacchati paraṃ tv anyāḥ striyo varjanīyāḥ // /
analyzed: tatas ṛdharātra samaye niyatam āgacchati param tu anyāḥ striyaḥ varjanīyāḥ
translated: Then, at midnight, she will certainly come, but other women should be avoided.

original: atha ratipriyāsādhanam uoṃ hīṃ āgaccha āgaccha ratikari svāhā /
analyzed: atha ratipriyā sādhanam uoṃ hīṃ āgaccha āgaccha ratikari svāhā
translated: Now, the means of attaining Ratipriyā: Oṃ hīṃ come, come, bringer of pleasure, svāhā.

original: atra paṭe citrarūpiṇī lekhyā vastrakanakālaṅkārabhūṣitā utpalahastā kumarī jātīpuṣpaiḥ prapūjanaṃ kuryāt guggulena dhūpaṃ dadyāt tato 'ṣṭasahasraṃ 🔽pratyahaṃ japet /
analyzed: atra paṭe citra rūpiṇī lekhyā vastra kanaka alaṅkāra bhūṣitā utpala hastā jātī puṣpaiḥ prapūjanam kuryāt guggulena dhūpam dadyāt ṣṭa sahasram  pratyaham japet
translated: Here, a young girl with a beautiful form should be drawn on a cloth, adorned with garments, ornaments, and a blue lotus in her hand. One should worship with jasmine flowers and offer incense with guggula. Then, one should recite [the mantra] one thousand and eight times.🔽One should recite [the mantra] one thousand and eight times every day.

original: māsānte tu vidhivat pūjanaṃ kuryāt /🔽dhūpadīpau prajvālanīyau tato 'rdharātrasamaye 'vaśyam āgacchati āgatā sā strībhāvena🔽kāmayitavyā bhāryā bhavati sādhakasya parivāraṃ pālayati divyaṃ kāmikaṃ bhojanaṃ
analyzed: māsa ante tu vidhivat pūjanam kuryāt  dhūpa dīpau prajvālanīyau tatas ṛdharātra samaye vaśyam āgacchati āgatā sā strī bhāvena  kāmayitavyā bhāryā bhavati sādhakasya parivāram pālayati divyam kāmikam bhojanam
translated: At the end of the month, one should perform the worship according to the rules.

original: ca dadāti // /
analyzed: ca dadāti
translated: Incense and lamps should be lit. Then, at midnight, she will certainly come. When she comes, she should be enjoyed with passion. She becomes the practitioner's wife and protects his retinue. She gives divine, desirable food.

original: atha padminīsādhanam uoṃ hīṃ āgaccha āgaccha padmini svāhā /
analyzed: atha padminī sādhanam uoṃ hīṃ āgaccha āgaccha padmini svāhā
translated: Now, the means of attaining Padminī: Oṃ hīṃ come, come, Padminī, svāhā.

original: svagṛhe candanena maṇḍalaṃ kṛtvā śiraḥsthaṃ kārayet guggulena dhūpaṃ dattvā sahasram ekaṃ pratyahaṃ japet tato māsānte paurṇamāsyāṃ rātrau
analyzed: sva gṛhe candanena maṇḍalam kṛtvā śiraḥ stham kārayet guggulena dhūpam dattvā sahasram ekam pratyaham japet tatas māsa ante paurṇamāsyām rātrau
translated: In one's own house, having made a circle with sandalwood, one should place it on one's head, having offered incense with guggula, one should recite one thousand times every day. Then, at the end of the month, on the full moon night,

original: vidhivat pūjāṃ kṛtvā japet /🔽japānte 'rdharātrasamaye niyatam āgacchati āgatā sā kāmayitavyā bhāryā bhūtvā sarvakāmapradā bhavati rasaṃ rasāyanaṃ siddhadravyaṃ pratyahaṃ
analyzed: vidhivat pūjām kṛtvā japet  japa ante ṛdharātra samaye niyatam āgacchati āgatā sā kāmayitavyā bhāryā bhūtvā sarva kāma pradā bhavati rasam rasāyanam siddha dravyam pratyaham
translated: having made offerings according to the rules, one should recite.🔽At the end of the recitation, at midnight, she definitely comes. Having come, she should be enjoyed. Becoming a wife, she grants all desires. She gives the practitioner every day

original: sādhakāya prayacchati // /
analyzed: sādhakāya prayacchati
translated: nectar, elixir, and perfected substances.

original: atha naṭīsādhanam uoṃ hrīṃ āgaccha āgaccha naṭi svāhā /
analyzed: atha naṭī sādhanam uoṃ hrīṃ āgaccha āgaccha naṭi svāhā
translated: Now, the means of attaining the dancing girl: Oṃ hrīṃ come come dancing girl svāhā.

original: atrāśokatale gatvā matsyamāṃsādyāhāragandhapuṣpādidhūpadīpabaliṃ dattvā sahasraṃ pratyahaṃ japet tataḥ sā māsānte niyatam āgacchati āgatā sā
analyzed: atra aśoka tale gatvā matsya māṃsa ādi āhāra gandha puṣpa ādi dhūpa dīpa balim dattvā sahasram pratyaham japet tatas sā māsa ante niyatam āgacchati āgatā sā
translated: Here, having gone to the foot of an aśoka tree, having offered food such as fish and meat, fragrances, flowers, etc., incense, lamps, and offerings, one should recite one thousand times every day. Then, at the end of the month, she definitely comes. Having come, she

original: mātā bhaginī bhāryā vā bhavati /
analyzed: mātā bhaginī bhāryā vā bhavati
translated: becomes a mother, sister, or wife.

original: yadi mātā bhavati tadā divyaṃ kāmikaṃ bhojanaṃ dadāti vastrasugandhisuvarṇaśataṃ dadāti ca /
analyzed: yadi mātā bhavati tadā divyam kāmikam bhojanam dadāti vastra sugandhi suvarṇa śatam dadāti ca
translated: If she becomes a mother, then she gives divine, desirable food and gives a hundred garments, fragrances, and gold.

original: yadi bhaginī bhavati tadā śatayojanād uttamāṃ striyam ānīya dadāti /
analyzed: yadi bhaginī bhavati tadā śata yojanāt uttamām striyam ānīya dadāti
translated: If she is a sister, then he brings the best woman from a hundred yojanas and gives her.

original: yadi bhāryā bhavati tadā divyaṃ vastraṃ rasāyanam aṣṭadināntareṇa dadāti // /
analyzed: yadi bhāryā bhavati tadā divyam vastram rasāyanam aṣṭa dina antareṇa dadāti
translated: If she is a wife, then he gives divine clothes and elixir every eight days.

original: athānurāgiṇīsādhanam uoṃ hrīṃ anurāgiṇi āgaccha āgaccha svāhā /
analyzed: atha anurāgiṇī sādhanam uoṃ hrīṃ anurāgiṇi āgaccha āgaccha svāhā
translated: Now, the means of attracting a lover: Oṃ hrīṃ to the lover, come, come, svāhā.

original: iha kaśmīrakuṅkumena bhūrjapattre strīsadṛśīṃ pratimāṃ vilikhyāvāhanādikaṃ kṛtvā gandhapuṣpadhūpadīpādikaṃ dattvā tāmbūlāni nivedya sahasraṃ
analyzed: iha kaśmīra kuṅkumena bhūrja pattre strī sadṛśīm pratimām vilikhya āvāhana ādikam kṛtvā gandha puṣpa dhūpa dīpa ādikam dattvā tāmbūlāni nivedya sahasram
translated: Here, having drawn an image of a woman on birch bark with Kashmiri saffron, having performed invocation and so on, having offered incense, flowers, incense, lamps, and so on, having presented betel nuts, one should recite the mantra

original: pratyahaṃ japet /
analyzed: pratyaham japet
translated: one thousand times every day.

original: māsam ekaṃ trisaṃdhyaṃ japet māsānte paurṇamāsyāṃ vidhivat pūjāṃ kṛtvā ghṛtadīpaṃ prajvālya samagrarātrau mantraṃ prajapet /
analyzed: māsam ekam trisaṃdhyam japet māsa ante paurṇamāsyām vidhivat pūjām kṛtvā ghṛta dīpam prajvālya samagra rātrau mantram prajapet
translated: One should recite the mantra three times a day for one month. At the end of the month, on the full moon day, having performed worship according to the rules, having lit a ghee lamp, one should recite the mantra throughout the night.

original: tataḥ prabhātasamaye niyatam āgacchati āgatā sā sarvakāmapradā bhavati divyarasāyanāni dadāti pratyahaṃ ca dīnārāṇāṃ sahasraṃ dadāti /
analyzed: tatas prabhāta samaye niyatam āgacchati āgatā sā sarva kāma pradā bhavati divya rasāyanāni dadāti pratyaham ca dīnārāṇām sahasram dadāti
translated: Then, at dawn, she definitely comes. Having come, she grants all desires and gives divine elixirs. And every day she gives a thousand dinars.

original: tasyāḥ prasādena varṣasahasrāṇy āyuś ca bhavati // /
analyzed: tasyāḥ prasādena varṣa sahasrāṇi āyuḥ ca bhavati
translated: By her grace, one's lifespan becomes a thousand years.

original: atha ṣaṭtriṃśad yakṣiṇyaḥ /
analyzed: atha ṣaṭtriṃśat yakṣiṇyaḥ
translated: Now, the thirty-six Yakshinis:

original: vicitrā vibhramā haṃsī bhīṣaṇī janarañjinī /
translated: Vichitra, Vibhrama, Hamsini, Bhisanini, Janaranjini,

original: viśālā madanā ghaṇṭā kālakarṇī mahābhayā // /
translated: Vishala, Madana, Ghantā, Kālakarnī, Mahābhayā,

original: māhendrī śaṅkhinī cāndrī śmaśānā vaṭayakṣiṇī /
translated: Māhendrī, Śaṅkhinī, Cāndrī, Śmaśānā, Vaṭayakṣiṇī,

original: mekhalā vikalā lakṣmīr mālinī śatapattrikā // /
translated: Mekhalā, Vikalā, Lakṣmī, Mālinī, Śatapatrikā,

original: sulocanā suśobhāḍhyā kapālinī viśālinī /
translated: Surocanā, Suśobhāḍhyā, Kapālinī, Viśālini,

original: naṭī kāmeśvarī svarṇarekhā ca surasundarī // /
analyzed: naṭī kāmeśvarī svarṇarekhā ca surasundarī
translated: Nāṭī, Kāmeśvarī, Svarṇarekhā, and Surasundarī,

original: manoharā pramodānurāgiṇī nakhakeśikā /
translated: Manoharā, Pramodānuraginī, Nakhakeshikā,

original: bhāminī padminī caiva svarṇāvatī ratipriyā // /
analyzed: bhāminī padminī ca eva svarṇāvatī ratipriyā
translated: Bhāminī, Padminī, Svarṇāvatī, and Ratipriyā,

original: ṣaṭtriṃśad etā yakṣiṇyaḥ kathitāḥ siddhikāmadāḥ /
analyzed: ṣaṭtriṃśat etāḥ yakṣiṇyaḥ kathitāḥ siddhi kāma dāḥ
translated: These thirty-six Yakshinis are said to bestow success when desired.

original: karaṅkiṇīmate tantre mahādevena vistarāt // /
analyzed: karaṅkiṇīmate tantre mahādevena vistarāt
translated: In the Karankini Mata Tantra, they have been extensively described by Mahadeva.

original: ārādhanaṃ mahat tāsāṃ pravakṣyāmi samāsataḥ /
analyzed: ārādhanam mahat tāsām pravakṣyāmi samāsatas
translated: I will now briefly explain their great worship.

original: phalaṃ caiva yathā tuṣṭāḥ prayacchanti samāhitam // /
analyzed: phalam ca eva yathā tuṣṭāḥ prayacchanti samāhitam
translated: And the fruit that they, when pleased, grant with concentration.

original: lakṣadvayaṃ japen mantraṃ vaṭavṛkṣatale śuciḥ /
translated: One should recite the mantra two hundred thousand times, pure, at the foot of a banyan tree.

original: paścāc campakapuṣpaiś ca homaṃ madhughṛtānvitam // /
analyzed: paścāt campaka puṣpaiḥ ca homam madhu ghṛta anvitam
translated: Then, with Champaka flowers, one should perform a homa with honey and ghee.

original: kuryād daśāṃśato mantrī śaṃkareṇoditaṃ yathā /
analyzed: kuryāt daśa aṃśataḥ mantrī śaṃkareṇa uditam yathā
translated: The mantra practitioner should offer one-tenth as stated by Shankara.

original: tataḥ siddhā bhaved devi vicitrā vāñchitapradā // /
analyzed: tatas siddhā bhavet devi vicitrā vāñchita pradā
translated: Then, O Goddess, the accomplished one becomes diverse, granting the desired [results].

original: uoṃ vicitre citrarūpiṇi me siddhiṃ kuru svāhā /
analyzed: uoṃ vicitre citra rūpiṇi me siddhim kuru svāhā
translated: Oṃ, O diverse one, having a variegated form, accomplish my success, svāhā.

original: iti mantraḥ /
analyzed: iti mantraḥ
translated: This is the mantra.

original: lakṣadvayaṃ japen mantraṃ śmaśāne nibhṛte niśi /
translated: One should recite the mantra two hundred thousand times in a secluded cremation ground at night.

original: ghṛtāktair guggulair home daśāṃśena kṛte sati // /
analyzed: ghṛta aktaiḥ guggulaiḥ home daśa aṃśena kṛte sati
translated: When the homa is performed with guggula soaked in ghee as one-tenth,

original: vibhramā toṣam āyāti pañcāśanmānuṣaiḥ samam /
analyzed: vibhramā toṣam āyāti pañcāśat mānuṣaiḥ samam
translated: Vibhrama becomes satisfied, along with fifty human beings.

original: dadāti bhojanaṃ dravyaṃ pratyahaṃ śaṃkaro 'bravīt // /
analyzed: dadāti bhojanam dravyam pratyaham śaṃkaraḥ bravīt
translated: Shankara has said that she gives food and wealth every day.

original: uoṃ hrīṃ vibhrame vibhramaṅgarūpe vibhramaṃ kuru bhagavati svāhā /🔽pradeśe nagarasyātha lakṣasaṃkhyaṃ japen manum /
analyzed: uoṃ   vibhrame vibhramam kuru bhagavati svāhā  pradeśe nagarasya atha lakṣa saṃkhyam japet manum
translated: Oṃ hrīṃ, O Vibhrama, having a form of delusion, O Goddess, create delusion, svāhā.🔽Then, in a part of the city, one should recite the mantra one hundred thousand times.

original: padmapattrair ghṛtopetaiḥ kṛte home daśāṃśataḥ // /
analyzed: padma pattraiḥ ghṛta upetaiḥ kṛte home daśa aṃśataḥ
translated: When the homa is performed with lotus petals soaked in ghee as one-tenth,

original: prayacchaty añjanaṃ haṃsī yena paśyati bhūnidhim /
analyzed: prayacchati añjanam haṃsī yena paśyati bhū nidhim
translated: The female swan gives collyrium by which one can see a treasure of land.

original: sukhena taṃ ca gṛhṇāti na vighnaiḥ paribhūyate // /
analyzed: sukhena tam ca gṛhṇāti na vighnaiḥ paribhūyate
translated: One happily takes it and is not overcome by obstacles.

original: uoṃ drīṃ namo haṃsi haṃsavāhinī klīṃ klīṃ svāhā /
analyzed: uoṃ drīṃ namaḥ haṃsi haṃsa vāhinī klīṃ klīṃ svāhā
translated: Oṃ drīṃ, salutations to the female swan, having a swan as vehicle, klīṃ klīṃ, svāhā.

original: tripathastho japen mantraṃ lakṣasaṃkhyaṃ daśāṃśataḥ /
analyzed: tripatha sthaḥ japet mantram lakṣa saṃkhyam daśa aṃśataḥ
translated: One should recite the mantra at the three junctures of the day, one hundred thousand times, one-tenth of which as oblations.

original: uoṃ śrīṃ drīṃ vaṭavāsini yakṣakulaprasūte vaṭayakṣiṇi ehy ehi svāhā /
analyzed: uoṃ śrīṃ drīṃ vaṭavāsini yakṣa kula prasūte vaṭayakṣiṇi ehi ehi svāhā
translated: Oṃ śrīṃ drīṃ O you who reside in the banyan tree, born in the Yakṣa clan, O banyan tree Yakṣiṇī, come, come, svāhā.

original: madhūkavṛkṣatale mantraṃ caturdaśadināvadhi /
translated: At the foot of a madhuka tree, one should recite the mantra for fourteen days.

original: prajapen mekhalā tuṣṭā dadāty añjanam uttamam // /
analyzed: prajapet mekhalā tuṣṭā dadāti añjanam uttamam
translated: If Mekhalā is pleased, she will give the excellent collyrium.

original: uoṃ drīṃ huṃ madanamekhalāyai madanaviḍambanāyai namaḥ svāhā /
analyzed: uoṃ drīṃ hum madanamekhalāyai madana viḍambanāyai namaḥ svāhā
translated: Oṃ drīṃ huṃ to Madanamekhalā, the one who mocks Madana, salutations, svāhā.

original: guhāntaḥstho 'dhare māsatrayaṃ mantraṃ japen naraḥ /
analyzed: guhā antaḥsthaḥ dhare māsa trayam mantram japet naraḥ
translated: A man should recite the mantra for three months, remaining in a cave, at dusk.

original: tataḥ siddhā bhaved devi vikalā vāñchitapradā // /
analyzed: tatas siddhā bhavet devi vikalā vāñchita pradā
translated: Then, O Goddess, she will become accomplished, or if incomplete, she will grant the desired boon.

original: oṃ vikale aiṃ hrīṃ śrīṃ klīṃ svāhā /🔽svagṛhāvasthito raktaiḥ prasūnaiḥ karavīrajaiḥ /
analyzed: om vikale aim   śrīṃ   svāhā  sva gṛha avasthitaḥ raktaiḥ prasūnaiḥ karavīra jaiḥ
translated: Oṃ vikale aiṃ hrīṃ śrīṃ klīṃ svāhā.

original: lakṣam āvartayen mantrī dūrvājyābhyāṃ daśāṃśataḥ // /
translated: Remaining in one's own house, the reciter of mantra should offer one hundred thousand oblations of red karavīra flowers, one-tenth of which as oblations of dūrvā grass and ghee.

original: home kṛte bhavet siddhā lakṣmīnamnī ca yakṣiṇī /
analyzed: home kṛte bhavet siddhā ca yakṣiṇī

original: rasaṃ rasāyanaṃ divyaṃ nidhānaṃ ca prayacchati // /
analyzed: rasam rasāyanam divyam nidhānam ca prayacchati

analyzed: catuṣpatha sthitaḥ lakṣam āpadi prajapet manum

analyzed: mālinī jāyate siddhā divyam khaṅgam prayacchati

analyzed: śatapattra vane yaḥ tu mantra lakṣam japet muniḥ

analyzed: uoṃ drīṃ śatapattrike drīṃ drīṃ śrīṃ svāhā

analyzed: nadī tīra sthitaḥ lakṣa trayam mantrī japet manum

analyzed: ghṛta home daśa aṃśena kṛte devī prasīdati

analyzed: manaḥ pavana vegena yāti ca āyāti sādhakaḥ
translated: The practitioner goes and comes back with the speed of the mind and the wind.

analyzed: uoṃ drīṃ klīṃ sulocane siddhim me dehi dehi svāhā

original: ardharātre gate devī samāgatya prayacchati /

analyzed: śaśa māṃsam ghṛtam cīram mantram āvartayet tatas

analyzed: atha āgatya sadā tasmai mantram añjanam uttamam
translated: Then, always coming to him, the excellent mantra collyrium

analyzed: catur lakṣam japet mantram sāgarasya taṭe śuciḥ
translated: The ascetic should recite this mantra four lakh times on the seashore, pure.

original: pattrapuṣpaphalādīni karoty ākarṣaṇaṃ dhruvam // /
analyzed: pattra puṣpa phala ādīni karoti ākarṣaṇam dhruvam
translated: He can certainly attract leaves, flowers, fruits, and so on.

original: abhaya ghudghutākarṣa karmakartā sṛṣṭiputra amukam ākarṣaya drīṃ /
analyzed: abhaya ghudghuta ākarṣa karma kartā sṛṣṭi putra amukam ākarṣaya drīṃ
translated: O fearless one, the attractor of Ghudhuta, the performer of actions, the son of creation, attract such and such, drem.

original: sahasrāṣṭam imaṃ mantraṃ japet saptadināvadhi /
analyzed: imam mantram japet sapta dina avadhi
translated: One should recite this mantra eight thousand times for seven days.

original: pratyahaṃ maṇibhadrākhyaḥ prayacchaty ekarūpyakam // /
analyzed: pratyaham maṇibhadra ākhyaḥ prayacchati eka rūpyakam
translated: Mani-bhadra gives one silver coin every day.

original: oṃ namo maṇibhadrāya namaḥ pūrṇabhadrāya namo mahāyakṣāya senādhipataye mauddhamauddhadharāya sughaṭamudrāvahe svāhā /
analyzed: om namaḥ maṇibhadrāya namaḥ pūrṇabhadrāya namaḥ mahāyakṣāya senā adhipataye mauddha mauddhadharāya su ghaṭa mudrā āvahe svāhā
translated: Om, salutations to Manibhadra, salutations to Pūrṇabhadra, salutations to the great Yakṣa, the general, the bearer of the Moudha weapon, the one who holds the Sughāṭa mudrā, svāhā.

original: trisaṃdhyaṃ balidānaṃ ca niśāyāṃ prajapen manum /
analyzed: trisaṃdhyam bali dānam ca niśāyām prajapet manum
translated: One should offer oblations at the three junctions of the day and night, and recite the mantra at night.

original: sahasraṃ hi japen nityaṃ yāvat svapnaṃ prajāyate // /
analyzed: sahasram hi japet nityam yāvat svapnam prajāyate
translated: One should always recite the mantra one thousand times until a dream occurs.

original: prāṇināṃ mṛtyusamayaṃ vadaty eva na saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: prāṇinām mṛtyu samayam vadati eva na saṃśayaḥ
translated: It certainly tells the time of death of living beings, there is no doubt.

original: oṃ namo bhagavate rudrāya dehi me vacanasiddhividhānaṃ pārvatīpate hrāṃ hrīṃ hūṃ hreṃ hrauṃ hraḥ /
analyzed: om namaḥ bhagavate rudrāya dehi me vacana siddhi vidhānam pārvatīpate hrāṃ hrīṃ hūm hreṃ hraum hraḥ
translated: Om, salutations to Lord Rudra, O Lord of Pārvatī, give me the method for the accomplishment of speech, hrām hrīm hūm hreṁ hrauṁ hrah.

original: rātrau rātrau japen mantraṃ sāgarasya taṭe śuciḥ /
analyzed: rātrau rātrau japet mantram sāgarasya taṭe śuciḥ
translated: At night, at night, the mantra should be recited on the shore of the ocean, pure.

original: lakṣajāpe kṛte siddho datte sāgaraceṭakaḥ // /
analyzed: lakṣa jāpe kṛte siddhaḥ datte sāgaraceṭakaḥ
translated: When the mantra has been recited one lakh times, it becomes accomplished and gives the servant of the ocean.

original: ratnatrayaṃ tadā maunyaṃ yasmin mantrī sukhī bhavet /
analyzed: ratnatrayam tadā maunyam yasmin mantrī sukhī bhavet
translated: The three jewels are then silent, in which the mantra-holder becomes happy.

original: sahasradaśakaṃ nityaṃ rātrau mantraṃ japet sudhīḥ // /
analyzed: sahasra daśakam nityam rātrau mantram japet sudhīḥ
translated: The wise one should always recite the mantra at night for ten thousand times.

original: taddaśāṃśaṃ madhupayomiśraiḥ padmaiś ca homayet /
analyzed: tad daśa aṃśam madhu payaḥ miśraiḥ padmaiḥ ca homayet
translated: One should offer oblations with lotuses mixed with honey and milk, one-tenth of that.

original: oṃ namo bhagavate rudra dehi me nijarāśiṃ śrīṃ namo 'stu te svāhā /
analyzed: om namaḥ bhagavate rudra dehi me nija rāśim śrīṃ namaḥ stu te svāhā
translated: Om, salutations to Lord Rudra, give me my own wealth, śrīm, salutations to you, svāhā.

original: oṃ hrīṃ amukaṃ rañjaya svāhā /
analyzed: om   amukam rañjaya svāhā
translated: Om hrim, delight such-and-such, svāhā.

original: anena mantreṇa sarvajanās tasmāt tu rañjakā bhavanti niśācaraṃ dhyātvā ātmapāṇinā japanād adṛśyakāriṇīṃ vidyām āpnoti // /
analyzed: anena mantreṇa sarva janāḥ tasmāt tu rañjakāḥ bhavanti niśācaram dhyātvā ātma pāṇinā japanāt adṛśya kāriṇīm vidyām āpnoti
translated: By this mantra, all people become delighted by him. By meditating on the night wanderer and reciting with one's own hand, one attains the knowledge that makes one invisible.

original: oṃ namo rasācāriṇe maheśvarāya mama paryaṭane sarvalokalocanāni bandhaya devy ājñāpayati svāhā /
analyzed: om namaḥ rasā cāriṇe maheśvarāya mama paryaṭane sarva loka locanāni bandhaya devī ājñāpayati svāhā
translated: Om, salutations to the Lord of Rasas, Mahesvara. By the command of the Goddess, bind the eyes of all people during my wanderings, svāhā.

original: sakṛd uccāramātreṇa nṛsiṃhaceṭakākhyo mantro ḍākinyādidoṣaṃ nāśayati /🔽oṃ namo bhagavate hiraṇyakaśipubalavidāraṇāya tribhuvanavyāpakāya bhūtapretapiśācakūṣmāṇḍabrahmarākṣasayoginīḍākinīkulonmūlanāya
analyzed: sakṛt uccāra mātreṇa nṛsiṃhaceṭaka ākhyaḥ mantraḥ ḍākinī ādi doṣam nāśayati  om namaḥ bhagavate hiraṇyakaśipu bala vidāraṇāya tribhuvana vyāpakāya bhūta preta piśāca kūṣmāṇḍa brahmarākṣasa yoginī ḍākinī kula unmūlanāya
translated: By merely reciting it once, the mantra called Nrisinha Chetaka destroys the faults of Dakini and others.🔽Om, salutations to the Blessed Lord who tore apart the strength of Hiranyakashipu, who pervades the three worlds, who uproots the families of Bhutas, Pretas, Pishachas, Kumbhandas, Brahma Rakshasas, Yoginis, and Dakinis,

original: stambhodbhavāya samastadoṣān nāśaya visara kampaya matha hūṃ hṛṃ svāhā ehy
analyzed: stambhodbhavāya samasta doṣān nāśaya visara kampaya matha     svāhā ehi
translated: who arises from the pillar, who destroys all faults, who spreads, shakes, churns, hum hum, svāhā, come,

analyzed: ehi rudraḥ ājñāpayati svāhā
translated: come, Rudra commands, svāhā.

original: prerakaḥ sahasrapādaḥ anidrām ākarṣayati /
analyzed: prerakaḥ sahasrapādaḥ anidrām ākarṣayati
translated: The instigator with a thousand feet attracts the sleepless one.

original: oṃ preraka amukīṃ tava maṇḍalaṃ samāvartaya drāvaya dāhaya saṃtāpaya hauṃ // /
analyzed: om preraka amukīm tava maṇḍalam samāvartaya drāvaya dāhaya saṃtāpaya hauṃ
translated: Om, instigator, make such-and-such return to your circle, melt, burn, torment, hauṃ.

original: Uḍḍāmareśvaratantra /
translated: The Uḍḍāma-reśvara Tantra.

original: Ekādaśaḥ paṭalaḥ
analyzed: ekādaśaḥ paṭalaḥ

analyzed: atha digbandhana mantraḥ

analyzed: vajrakrodhāya mahā dantāya daśa diśaḥ bandha bandha haṃ phaṭ svāhā

original: atha yonisaṃkocanam /
analyzed: atha yoni saṃkocanam

analyzed: kumudam haritālam ca piṣṭvā yonim pralepayet

analyzed: tri rātram pañca rātram ca yoniḥ bhavati saṃyutā
translated: For three nights or five nights, the womb becomes joined.

analyzed: māṃsī candana mustā ca tagaram nāgakesaram
translated: Māṃsī, sandalwood, musta grass, tagara, and ironwood flower -

analyzed: ṛtu kāle kuryāt tadā tad tulya tā bhavet

translated: Having brought the five parts of the egg, cooked in mustard oil,

analyzed: satatam abhilepena sā bhartāram vaśam nayet

translated: The root of the female monkey's horn, one should smear with goat's urine.

analyzed: lepanāt tu tatas śiśnam yatheccham kāmayet balāt
translated: By smearing it, then the penis, one should desire as one wishes, by force.🔽Auspicious long pepper, lac, and poison, increased in sequence,

analyzed: lepam prakṣālitam liṅgam nārī kāmayate cirāt

analyzed: nābhi lepanam iti uktam vīrya stambha karam param

translated: One should draw a twelve-spoked wheel with saffron,

analyzed: bhūrja pattre vastre netre baddha phala ādike
translated: on birch bark or cloth, with the eyes bound with fruits, etc.

analyzed: pattre pattre likhet bījam hrīṃkāram parama ujjvalam
translated: One should write the seed syllable HRIH, extremely radiant, on each leaf,

analyzed: mṛttikābhiḥ samastābhiḥ pratimām kārayet dṛḍham
translated: One should make a firm image with all the clay materials.

original: karṣayet pramadāṃ nṝṇāṃ garvitāṃ tu na saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: karṣayet pramadām nṝṇām garvitām tu na saṃśayaḥ
translated: One should certainly attract the proud women of men,

original: vairāgyaṃ na punar yāti dāsībhāvena tiṣṭhati // /🔽dāḍimaṃ pañcakolaṃ ca lohaṃ vajrorasaṃ ghṛtam /
analyzed: vairāgyam na punar yāti dāsī bhāvena tiṣṭhati  dāḍimam pañcakolam ca loham ghṛtam
translated: and they do not return to dispassion, but remain in a state of servitude.🔽Pomegranate, the five spices, iron, mercury, ghee,

original: cūrṇaṃ bhūmandarā śākhā dantanakhaṃ karoti vai // /
analyzed: cūrṇam bhūmandarā śākhā danta nakham karoti vai
translated: the powder of Bhümānda, the branch, the teeth and nails make the aphrodisiac.

original: manaḥśilā prayaṅguś ca rocanā nāgakesaram /
analyzed: manaḥśilā prayaṅguḥ ca rocanā nāgakesaram
translated: Realgar, red ochre, gorocana, and Nāgakeśara,

original: netrāñjanasamāyuktaṃ sarvasattvavaśaṃkaram // /
analyzed: netra añjana samāyuktam sarva sattva vaśaṃkaram
translated: when combined with collyrium for the eyes, enthrall all beings.

original: Uḍḍāmareśvaratantra /
translated: The Uḍḍāmareśvara Tantra.

original: Dvādaśaḥ paṭalaḥ🔽oṃ hrīṃ śrīṃ klīṃ draṃ caṇḍogre trinetre cāmuṇḍe ariṣṭe hūṃ phaṭ svāhā /
analyzed: dvādaśaḥ paṭalaḥ  om hrīṃ śrīṃ   draṃ caṇḍogre trinetre cāmuṇḍe ariṣṭe hūm phaṭ svāhā
translated: Chapter 12

analyzed: hrīṃ namāmi aham mahādevam nṛsiṃham bhīma rūpiṇam om namaḥ tasmai
translated: Om Hrim Shrim Klim Dram Chandogra Trinetra Chamundari Shta! Hrim! I bow to the great god, the man-lion in a terrible form, Om, salutations to him.

original: śrīpārvaty uvāca /
analyzed: śrī pārvatī uvāca
translated: Shri Parvati said:

original: uḍḍīśena samākīrṇe yogivṛndasamākule /
analyzed: uḍḍīśena samākīrṇe yogi vṛnda samākule
translated: In the place filled with Uddishes and crowded with groups of yogis,

original: praṇamya śirasā gaurī paripṛcchati śaṃkaram // /
analyzed: praṇamya śirasā gaurī paripṛcchati śaṃkaram
translated: Gouri, bowing her head, asks Shankara.

original: śrīśvara uvāca /
analyzed: śrī īśvaraḥ uvāca
translated: Shri Shiva said:

original: śṛṇu tvaṃ hi varārohe siddhyarthaṃ prativāsase /
analyzed: śṛṇu tvam hi varārohe siddhi artham prati vāsase
translated: Listen, O beautiful lady, for the sake of accomplishment, to the abode,

original: taṃ vadiṣyāmi te devi sarvaṃ tat samupāhṛtam // /
analyzed: tam vadiṣyāmi te devi sarvam tat samupāhṛtam
translated: I will tell you all that, O Goddess, which has been brought together.

original: devi yo dvijo mantrais tu viprahanyān na saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: devi yaḥ dvijaḥ mantraiḥ tu viprahanyāt na saṃśayaḥ
translated: O Goddess, if a twice-born person were to kill a Brahmin with mantras, there is no doubt.

original: pūrvoditaṃ mayoḍḍīśaṃ kathyate tava bhaktitaḥ // /
analyzed: pūrva uditam mayā uḍḍīśam kathyate tava bhaktitaḥ
translated: The Uddishes mentioned earlier are being told to you out of devotion.

original: uḍḍīśaṃ ca namaskṛtya rudraṃ caiva sudurjayam /
analyzed: uḍḍīśam ca namaskṛtya rudram ca eva su durjayam
translated: Having bowed to Uddish and Rudra, who is very difficult to conquer,

original: kapardinaṃ virūpākṣaṃ sarvabhūtabhayāvaham // /
analyzed: kapardinam virūpākṣam sarva bhūta bhaya āvaham
translated: The matted-haired one, the disfigured-eyed one, who brings fear to all beings,

original: prathamaṃ bhūtakaraṇaṃ dvitīyonmādanaṃ tathā /
analyzed: prathamam bhūtakaraṇam dvitīya unmādanam tathā
translated: The first is the creation of beings, the second is the maddening,

original: tṛtīyaṃ dveṣaṇaṃ caiva turyam uccāṭanaṃ tathā // /
analyzed: tṛtīyam dveṣaṇam ca eva turyam uccāṭanam tathā
translated: The third is the hating, and the fourth is the scattering.

original: grāmoccāṭaṃ pañcamaṃ ca ṣaṣṭhaṃ ca jalastambhanam /
analyzed: grāma uccāṭam pañcamam ca ṣaṣṭham ca jala stambhanam
translated: The fifth is the expulsion of a village, and the sixth is the immobilization of water.

original: saptamam agnistambhaṃ ca vaśīkaraṇam aṣṭamam // /
analyzed: saptamam agni stambham ca vaśīkaraṇam aṣṭamam
translated: The seventh is the immobilization of fire, and the eighth is subjugation.

original: anyān api prayogāṃś ca śṛṇuṣva vai varānane /
analyzed: anyān api prayogān ca śṛṇuṣva vai varānane
translated: Listen to other rituals as well, O beautiful lady.

original: śivena kathitā yogā uḍḍīśe śāstraniścaye // /🔽andhī ca vandhīkaraṇaṃ mūkīkāras tathaiva ca /🔽gātrasaṃkocanaṃ caiva bhūtajvarakaras tathā // /
analyzed: śivena kathitāḥ yogāḥ uḍḍīśe śāstra niścaye  ca vandhīkaraṇam mūkīkāraḥ tathā eva ca  gātra saṃkocanam ca eva bhūta jvara karaḥ tathā
translated: The yogas narrated by Shiva are in the Uḍḍiśa scripture.🔽The blinding and paralyzing of the body, and likewise the rendering speechless,🔽The contraction of the body, and the causing of fever by spirits,

original: astraśastrasya truṭitaṃ pānīyasya vināśanam /
analyzed: astra śastrasya truṭitam pānīyasya vināśanam
translated: The breaking of weapons and arms, the destruction of water,

original: dadhimadhunāśanaṃ ca nakhakaraṇaṃ tathaiva ca // /
analyzed: dadhi madhu nāśanam ca nakha karaṇam tathā eva ca
translated: The destruction of curd and honey, and likewise the making of nails,

original: gajānāṃ vājināṃ caiva prakopanaṃ parasparam /
analyzed: gajānām vājinām ca eva prakopanam parasparam
translated: The mutual enraging of elephants and horses,

original: ākarṣaṇaṃ bhujaṃgānāṃ mānavānāṃ tathā dhruvam // /🔽sasyavināśanaṃ caiva garbhasyāntardhikāraṇam /
analyzed: ākarṣaṇam bhujaṃgānām mānavānām tathā dhruvam  sasya vināśanam ca eva garbhasya antardhi kāraṇam
translated: The definite attraction of snakes and humans,🔽The destruction of crops, and the causing of miscarriage,

original: vetālāñjanasiddhiś ca ulūkasiddhir api hi // /
analyzed: vetāla añjana siddhiḥ ca ulūka siddhiḥ api hi
translated: The success of the ointment of vetālas, and likewise the success of owls,

original: anyān api mahāraudrān prayogān śṛṇu sāmpratam /
analyzed: anyān api mahā raudrān prayogān śṛṇu sāmpratam
translated: Listen now to other extremely terrible rituals.

original: vidyāmantraprayogāṃś ca auṣadhaṃ cābhicārikam // /
analyzed: vidyā mantra prayogān ca auṣadham ca ābhicārikam
translated: The application of spells and mantras, and the magical medicine,

original: guptā guptatarāḥ kāryā rakṣitavyāḥ prayatnataḥ /
analyzed: guptāḥ guptatarāḥ kāryāḥ rakṣitavyāḥ prayatnataḥ
translated: They should be kept very well hidden and protected with effort.

original: akulīnādhamabuddher bhaktihīnasya vai tathā // /
analyzed: akulīna adhama buddheḥ bhakti hīnasya vai tathā
translated: For one of low birth and inferior intellect, who lacks devotion,

original: hiṃsakasya ca kṣudrasya nindakasya viśeṣataḥ /
analyzed: hiṃsakasya ca kṣudrasya nindakasya viśeṣataḥ
translated: For one who is violent, petty, and especially critical,

original: svārthaṃ phalādilubdhasya upadeśam amanyataḥ // /
analyzed: sva artham phala ādi lubdhasya upadeśam
translated: For one greedy for personal gain and results, who does not value instruction,

original: asmin śāpe pūruṣās te varjanīyāḥ prayatnataḥ /
analyzed: asmin śāpe pūruṣāḥ te varjanīyāḥ prayatnataḥ
translated: In this curse, those men should be carefully avoided.

original: etaiś ca saha saṃyogo na kāryaḥ sarvadā budhaiḥ // /
analyzed: etaiḥ ca saha saṃyogaḥ na kāryaḥ sarvadā budhaiḥ
translated: The wise should never associate with them at all.

original: ya uḍḍīśakriyāśaktibhedaṃ kurvanti mohitāḥ /
analyzed: ye uḍḍīśa kriyā śakti bhedam kurvanti mohitāḥ
translated: Those who, deluded, make distinctions between the power of flight and action,
