analyzed: te duṣṭāḥ durjayāḥ ca eva kim atra bahu bhāṣitaiḥ
translated: They are wicked and difficult to conquer, what more need be said?

original: yadīcchāsiddhim ātmānam ātmārthaṃ hi tathaiva ca /
analyzed: yadi icchā siddhim ātmānam ātma artham hi tathā eva ca
translated: If one desires the accomplishment of one's own desires, for one's own sake and likewise for others,

original: satpūruṣāya dātavyaṃ devagururatāya ca // /
analyzed: sat pūruṣāya dātavyam deva guru ratāya ca
translated: It should be given to a virtuous person, who is devoted to the gods and teachers.

original: prayogās tu prayoktavyāḥ sādhakaiḥ śatrukāraṇe /
analyzed: prayogāḥ tu prayoktavyāḥ sādhakaiḥ śatru kāraṇe
translated: The practices should be employed by practitioners for the sake of enemies.

original: animittā nivartante svātmagrāhe na saṃśayaḥ // /
analyzed: animittāḥ nivartante sva ātma grāhe na saṃśayaḥ
translated: They cease without reason when grasped as one's own self, there is no doubt.

original: asaṃtuṣṭo hy ayuktaś ca prayogān iti nācaret /
analyzed: a saṃtuṣṭaḥ hi a yuktaḥ ca prayogān iti na ācaret
translated: One who is discontented and unfit should not engage in the practices.

original: śāstrasiddhavicārās tu sāmantakoṣakāḥ śubhāḥ // /
analyzed: śāstra siddha vicārāḥ tu sāmantakoṣakāḥ śubhāḥ
translated: But those who have the discernment established by the scriptures, the auspicious borderland treasuries,

original: oṃ glauṃ gaṃ gaṇeśāya namaḥ /
analyzed: om glauṃ gaṃ gaṇeśāya namaḥ
translated: Om glum gam, salutations to Ganesha.

original: mantreṇānena mantrajñaḥ kumbhakāramṛdā tathā /
analyzed: mantreṇa anena mantra jñaḥ kumbhakāra mṛdā tathā
translated: The knower of mantras should make an image of Lambodara with potter's clay using this mantra.

original: lambodaraṃ prakurvīta pūjayed upacārakaiḥ // /
analyzed: lambodaram prakurvīta pūjayet upacārakaiḥ
translated: He should worship it with offerings.

original: sāptāhikaṃ trisaṃdhyāyāṃ japtavyaṃ sāvadhānataḥ /
analyzed: sāptāhikam trisaṃdhyāyām japtavyam sa avadhānataḥ
translated: For seven days, one should recite the mantra three times a day with full attention.

original: sahasraikapramāṇena japāc chāntir bhaviṣyati // /
analyzed: sahasra eka pramāṇena japāt śāntiḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: By reciting it one thousand times, peace will be attained.

original: prātar aṣṭottaraṃ japtvā labhed buddhiṃ śubhāṃ naraḥ /
analyzed: prātar aṣṭa uttaram japtvā labhet buddhim śubhām naraḥ
translated: By reciting it one hundred and eight times in the morning, a man will obtain auspicious intelligence.

original: māsenaikena deveśi śrīlābhaś ca bhaved dhruvam // /
translated: O Goddess of gods, within one month, he will certainly obtain wealth and prosperity.

original: ṣaṇmāsena varārohe mahādhanapatir bhavet /
analyzed: ṣaṣ māsena varārohe mahā dhanapatiḥ bhavet
translated: O beautiful lady, within six months, he will become the lord of great wealth.

original: trikālajñānavettā ca varṣaikena na saṃśayaḥ // /
analyzed: tri kāla jñāna vettā ca varṣa ekena na saṃśayaḥ
translated: Within one year, he will undoubtedly know the knowledge of the three times.

original: aiṃ namaḥ svāhā /🔽prātaḥ sahasravāraṃ tu prajaptena prapūjayet /
analyzed: aim namaḥ svāhā  prātar sahasra vāram tu prajaptena prapūjayet
translated: Aim Namah Svaha.

original: varadāṃ tu mahādevīṃ śvetagandhānulepanaiḥ // /
analyzed: varadām tu mahādevīm śveta gandha anulepanaiḥ
translated: In the morning, one should worship the great goddess Varada, who grants boons, by reciting the mantra one thousand times,

original: puṣpair jāpair dakṣiṇādisopacārais tu pratyaham /
analyzed: puṣpaiḥ jāpaiḥ dakṣiṇa ādi sa upacāraiḥ tu pratyaham
translated: with white unguents, flowers, recitations, and offerings such as dakshina, every day.

original: saptame divase hy evaṃ vāgaiśvaryaṃ prajāyate // /
analyzed: saptame divase hi evam vāc aiśvaryam prajāyate
translated: On the seventh day, in this way, the power of speech is generated.

original: bhavet sadyaḥ pravaktā ca śrutismṛtidharo 'pi ca /
analyzed: bhavet sadyas pravaktā ca śruti smṛti dharaḥ ca
translated: He becomes a speaker immediately and also a knower of the Vedas and Smritis.

original: bāndhavaḥ sarvabhūtānāṃ cirāyuḥ sukham edhate // /
analyzed: bāndhavaḥ sarva bhūtānām cira āyuḥ sukham edhate
translated: He becomes a friend to all beings, lives a long life, and prospers with happiness.

original: oṃ klīṃ mantreṇānena deveśi sādhakaḥ japam ārabhet /
analyzed: om klīṃ mantreṇa anena deveśi sādhakaḥ japam ārabhet
translated: O Goddess of the gods, the practitioner should begin the recitation with the mantra Om Kleem.

original: raktavastrāvṛto nityaṃ tathā kuṅkumajāṅgale // /
analyzed: rakta vastra āvṛtaḥ nityam tathā kuṅkuma jāṅgale
translated: Always covered in red garments and smeared with saffron paste,

original: saptāhajapamātreṇa hy ānayet tridaśāṅganām /
analyzed: sapta aha japa mātreṇa hi ānayet tridaśa aṅganām
translated: By merely reciting for seven days, one can summon the celestial maidens.

original: oṃ drīṃ drīṃ drīṃ drīṃ svāhā /
analyzed: om drīṃ drīṃ drīṃ drīṃ svāhā
translated: Om Drim Drim Drim Drim Svaha.

original: pūrvavidhāno hi japed ekāntasaṃsthitaḥ // /
analyzed: pūrva vidhānaḥ hi japet ekānta saṃsthitaḥ
translated: One should recite while abiding in solitude, following the aforementioned procedure.

original: ākarṣeti striyaṃ śastāṃ sālaṃkārāṃ suvāsasam /
analyzed: ākarṣa iti striyam śastām sa alaṃkārām su vāsasam
translated: One should recite, 'I attract such and such a woman, suitable, adorned with ornaments, and beautifully dressed.'

original: oṃ haiṃ haḥ huṃ /
analyzed: om haiṃ haḥ hum
translated: Om Hem Hah Hum.

original: ūrdhvadṛṣṭiprayogeṇa japel lakṣatrayaṃ priye // /
analyzed: ūrdhva dṛṣṭi prayogeṇa japet lakṣa trayam priye
translated: O beloved, one should recite three hundred thousand times, using the method of upward gaze.

original: sarvapāpavinirmukto jāyate khecare pade /
analyzed: sarva pāpa vinirmuktaḥ jāyate khecare pade
translated: One becomes free from all sins and is born in the state of a sky-goer.

original: oṃ drīṃ kārīṇḍaḥ kṣaḥ kṣīṃ phaṭ svāhā /
analyzed: om drīṃ kārīṇḍaḥ     phaṭ svāhā
translated: Om Drim Karinda Ksh Kshrim Phat Svaha.

original: ekapādasthito bhadre japed aṣṭottaraṃ śatam // /
analyzed: eka pāda sthitaḥ bhadre japet aṣṭa uttaram śatam
translated: O fortunate one, standing on one foot, one should recite one hundred and eight times.

original: yad yat prārthayate vastu tad dadāti dine dine /
analyzed: yat yat prārthayate vastu tat dadāti dine dine
translated: Whatever object one desires, it is given day by day.

original: yajen naraviśeṣaṃ ca devāgnigurubrāhmaṇaiḥ // /
analyzed: yajet nara viśeṣam ca deva agni guru brāhmaṇaiḥ
translated: One should worship the king with gods, fire, gurus, and Brahmins.

original: oṃ śrīṃ kṣīṃ lohaṃ muñca kili kili amukaṃ kāṭaya kāṭaya mātaṃgini svāhā /
analyzed: om śrīṃ   loham muñca kili kili amukam kāṭaya kāṭaya mātaṃgini svāhā
translated: Om Shrim Kshrim Loham Munch Kili Kili Amukam Kata Kata Matangini Svaha.

original: mantreṇānena pūrvāhṇe pūjayann upacārakaiḥ /
analyzed: mantreṇa anena pūrvāhṇe pūjayan upacārakaiḥ
translated: Reciting this mantra in the morning, worshipping with offerings,

original: śarāvaṃ pūrayitvā tu catuṣpathe baliṃ haret // /
analyzed: śarāvam pūrayitvā tu catuṣpathe balim haret
translated: Having filled a pot, one should offer oblations at a crossroads.

original: samantraṃ kṣipyati pumān puruṣaṃ yadi paśyati /
analyzed: sa mantram kṣipyati pumān puruṣam yadi paśyati
translated: If a man throws it with the mantra, and if he sees a man,

original: ātmacintitakāryāṇi sādhayaty eva nānyathā // /
analyzed: ātma cintita kāryāṇi sādhayati eva na anyathā
translated: then his own thought-out tasks will be accomplished, not otherwise.

original: oṃ stambhini svāhā kapālini svāhā drīṃ drīṃ vaiṣādārthini svāhā chaḥ chaḥ /
analyzed: om stambhini svāhā kapālini svāhā drīṃ drīṃ vaiṣāda arthini svāhā chaḥ chaḥ
translated: Om, to the paralyzer, svāhā. To the skull-bearer, svāhā. Drim drim, to the one who desires misfortune, svāhā. Chuh chuh.

original: mantreṇa mṛttikāṃ japtvā pratārya saptadhā jale /
analyzed: mantreṇa mṛttikām japtvā pratārya saptadhā jale
translated: Having recited the mantra over clay, one should knead it seven times in water,

original: saṃmukhībhūya kṣiptvā ca japtvā cāyutaṃ vāsare // /
analyzed: saṃmukhībhūya kṣiptvā ca japtvā ca ayutam vāsare
translated: and having thrown it in the presence of the deity, and having recited it ten thousand times during the day,

original: tena siddho bhaven mantraḥ sādhakasya na saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: tena siddhaḥ bhavet mantraḥ sādhakasya na saṃśayaḥ
translated: then the mantra will be accomplished for the practitioner, there is no doubt.

original: oṃ śrīṃ kṣāṃ kṣīṃ kṣūṃ kṣaiṃ kṣauṃ kṣaḥ /
analyzed: om śrīṃ kṣāṃ kṣīṃ kṣūṃ kṣaiṃ kṣauṃ kṣaḥ
translated: Om, shrim, kshām, kshīm, kshūm, ksheim, kshaum, kshah.

original: madhyāhnasamaye sūryasammukhe japam ācaret // /
analyzed: madhyāhna samaye sūrya sammukhe japam ācaret
translated: At midday, one should perform the recitation facing the sun.

original: ayutaṃ japtamātreṇa svasāmarthyaṃ prapaśyati /
analyzed: ayutam japta mātreṇa sva sāmarthyam prapaśyati
translated: By merely reciting it ten thousand times, one will see one's own power.

original: tasya dṛṣṭinipātena dvipadaś ca catuṣpadaḥ // /
analyzed: tasya dṛṣṭi nipātena dvipadaḥ ca catuṣpadaḥ
translated: By the fall of his gaze, two-legged and four-legged creatures

original: jvarābhibhūtā jāyante apūrvā mantrasampadaḥ /
analyzed: jvara abhibhūtāḥ jāyante apūrvāḥ mantra sampadaḥ
translated: will be overcome by fever, and unprecedented wealth of mantras will arise.

original: oṃ haṃsaḥ haṃsaṃ so 'haṃ svāhā /
analyzed: om haṃsaḥ haṃsam saḥ haṃ svāhā
translated: Om, haṃsa, haṃsa, I am that, svāhā.

original: ekaviṃśatijaptena jalena jvarapīḍitaḥ // /
analyzed: ekaviṃśati japtena jalena jvara pīḍitaḥ
translated: One who is afflicted by fever, by merely reciting it twenty-one times with water,

original: vimucyate pānamātrāt sadyaḥ svasthaś ca jāyate /
analyzed: vimucyate pāna mātrāt sadyas svasthaḥ ca jāyate
translated: By merely drinking it, one is immediately liberated and becomes well.

original: oṃ drīṃ namo ghoreśvari ghoramukhi cāmuṇḍe ūrdhvakeśi vikṛtānane drīṃ drīṃ huṃ phaṭ huṃ svāhā /
analyzed: om drīṃ namaḥ ghoreśvari ghoramukhi cāmuṇḍe ūrdhvakeśi vikṛta ānane drīṃ drīṃ hum phaṭ hum svāhā
translated: Om Drim, salutations to the fierce goddess, the fierce-faced Chamundi, with upward-streaming hair, with a distorted face, Drim Drim Hum Phat Hum Svaha.

original: ayaṃ sarvadalanamantraḥ // /
analyzed: ayam sarva dalana mantraḥ
translated: This is the mantra for destroying all.

original: oṃ drīṃ drīṃ drīṃ phaṭ phaṭ phaṭ svāhā sarvagrahāṇāṃ trāsanaṃ kuru kuru aṅguliprahāreṇa /
analyzed: om drīṃ drīṃ drīṃ phaṭ phaṭ phaṭ svāhā sarva grahāṇām trāsanam kuru kuru aṅguli prahāreṇa
translated: Om Drim Drim Drim Phat Phat Phat Svaha, frighten all the planets, do it, do it, with a snap of the fingers.

original: oṃ sraṃ srāṃ sriṃ srīṃ sruṃ srūṃ sreṃ sraiṃ sroṃ srauṃ sraṃ sraḥ ha raṃ rauṃ rīṃ rūṃ raiṃ reviḥ chuṃ chuṃ haṃsaḥ amṛtavarcase svāhā /
analyzed: om sraṃ srāṃ sriṃ srīṃ sruṃ srūṃ sreṃ sraiṃ sroṃ srauṃ sraṃ sraḥ ha raṃ rauṃ rīṃ rūṃ raiṃ reviḥ chuṃ chuṃ haṃsaḥ amṛta varcase svāhā
translated: Om Sram Sram Srim Srim Srum Sru Srem Srem Srom Sroum Sram Srah, Ha Ram Raum Rim Rurum Rem Rei Chhum Chhum Hamsa, to the one with the radiance of nectar, Svaha.

original: anena mantreṇodakaṃ śarāvaṃ saṃkṣipyāṣṭottaraśatenābhimantritaṃ kṛtvā pibet prātar utthāya saṃvatsareṇa vallīpalitavarjito bhavati /
analyzed: anena mantreṇa udakam śarāvam saṃkṣipya aṣṭottaraśatena abhimantritam kṛtvā pibet prātar utthāya saṃvatsareṇa vallī palita varjitaḥ bhavati
translated: With this mantra, one should fill a pot with water, enchant it with one hundred and eight recitations, and drink it upon rising in the morning. In one year, one becomes free from wrinkles and gray hair.

original: vṛkṣasthāvarajaṅgamākṛtiṃ samāṅgīkārāc ca vyāghralomādikaṃ pūrvodaryāṃ bhasmīkaroti sarvajanapriyo bhavati cirāyur bhavati /
analyzed: vṛkṣa sthāvara jaṅgama ākṛtim samāṅgīkārāt ca vyāghra loma ādikam pūrva udaryām bhasmīkaroti sarva jana priyaḥ bhavati cira āyuḥ bhavati
translated: And by accepting the form of a tree, immobile or moving, one reduces to ashes the tiger's hair and so on in the previous verse. One becomes dear to all people, and has a long life.

original: oṃ namo bhagavate rudrāya caṇḍeśvarāya huṃ huṃ huṃ phaṭ svāhā /
analyzed: om namaḥ bhagavate rudrāya caṇḍeśvarāya hum hum hum phaṭ svāhā
translated: Om, salutations to Lord Shiva, the fierce lord, hum hum hum phat svaha.

original: anena mantreṇa japaṃ kṛtvā śīghram īpsitaṃ labhet // /
analyzed: anena mantreṇa japam kṛtvā śīghram īpsitam labhet
translated: By doing japa with this mantra, one will quickly obtain the desired [results].

original: oṃ hūṃ drīṃ kṣaṃ kṣāṃ kṣiṃ kṣīṃ kṣuṃ kṣūṃ kṣeṃ kṣaiṃ kṣoṃ kṣauṃ kṣaṃ kṣaḥ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā /
analyzed: om hūm drīṃ kṣaṃ kṣāṃ kṣiṃ kṣīṃ kṣuṃ kṣūṃ kṣeṃ kṣaiṃ kṣoṃ kṣauṃ kṣaṃ kṣaḥ hūm phaṭ svāhā
translated: Om hum drem ksh ksh ksh ksh ksh ksh ksh ksh ksh ksh ksh ksh ksh ksh ksh ksh ksh ksh ksh ksh ksh hum phat svaha.

original: imaṃ mantraṃ pūrvaṃ lakṣam ekaṃ japet taddaśāṃśam ayutaṃ havanaṃ kuryāt /
analyzed: imam mantram pūrvam lakṣam ekam japet tad daśa aṃśam ayutam havanam kuryāt
translated: One should first do one lakh japa of this mantra, and then do homa ten thousand times, which is one-tenth of that.

original: ekaikaṃ samidhaṃ ghṛtāktāṃ juhuyāt siddho bhavati gaṅgāgoloke na te meghāḥ praṇaśyanti na ca varṣanti vāsavo nadasamudraṃ śoṣayati meghastambho 🔽bhavati /
analyzed: ekaikam samidham ghṛta aktām juhuyāt siddhaḥ bhavati gaṅgā goloke na te meghāḥ praṇaśyanti na ca varṣanti vāsavaḥ nada samudram śoṣayati  bhavati
translated: One should offer each sacrificial twig dipped in ghee. One becomes accomplished. The clouds do not perish, nor do they rain, nor does Indra dry up the rivers and oceans. The clouds are immobilized.

original: udakamadhye sthitvā japaṃ karoty anāvṛṣṭikāle 'tivṛṣṭiṃ karoti /
analyzed: udaka madhye sthitvā japam karoti anāvṛṣṭi kāle tivṛṣṭim karoti
translated: [The practitioner] stands in the water and does japa during a drought, causing excessive rain.

original: oṃ drīṃ pracalite kubere hūṃ hūṃ kili kili svāhā /
analyzed: om drīṃ pracalite kubere hūm   kili kili svāhā
translated: Om drem pracalite kubere hum hum kili kili svaha.

original: pūrvavelāyām ādarśadīpasamīpe ṣaḍaṅgulena bhājane sūryamaṇḍale kumāraṃ vāme veśayati pūrvam ayutajapaḥ kartavyaḥ pañcopacāreṇa pūjā ca kartavyā
analyzed: pūrva velāyām ādarśa dīpa samīpe ṣaṣ aṅgulena bhājane sūrya maṇḍale kumāram vāme veśayati pūrvam ayuta japaḥ kartavyaḥ pañca upacāreṇa pūjā ca kartavyā  /
translated: In the early morning, near a mirror and lamp, in a six-finger-width vessel, one places the youth in the solar orb on the left. First, ten thousand japa should be done, and worship with the five offerings should be performed.

original: pūrvābhiś ca svarājye /
analyzed: pūrvābhiḥ ca sva rājye
translated: And with the previous ones, in one's own kingdom.

original: oṃ śrīṃ himajāte prayaccha me dhanaṃ svāhā /
analyzed: om śrīṃ himajāte prayaccha me dhanam svāhā
translated: Om Shri, born from snow, give me wealth, svaha.

original: anena mantreṇa siddhārthakaṃ ghṛtamiśritaṃ hunet aṣṭottaraśate na annapānavimiśritaṃ
analyzed: anena mantreṇa siddhārthakam ghṛta miśritam hunet aṣṭottaraśate na anna pāna vimiśritam
translated: With this mantra, one should offer sesame seeds mixed with ghee one hundred and eight times, mixed with food and drink,

original: sahasreṇa hunet manasaḥ prārthitaṃ labhet ayutaṃ hunec chrīsumanā bhavet lakṣaṃ huned
analyzed: sahasreṇa hunet manasaḥ prārthitam labhet ayutam hunet śrī su manāḥ bhavet lakṣam hunet
translated: one should offer one thousand times, one will obtain what one desires in one's mind. By offering ten thousand times, one will become prosperous and well-disposed. By offering one hundred thousand times,

original: grāmaśataṃ labhet // /
analyzed: grāma śatam labhet
translated: one will obtain one hundred villages.

original: oṃ namo namaḥ /
analyzed: om namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Om, salutations, salutations.

original: imaṃ mantraṃ śataṃ japet sarvakāmaprado 'yaṃ mantraḥ // /
analyzed: imam mantram śatam japet sarva kāma pradaḥ yam mantraḥ
translated: One should recite this mantra one hundred times. This mantra grants all desires.

original: oṃ drīṃ śrīṃ sārase siddhikari krīṃ namaḥ svāhā /
analyzed: om drīṃ śrīṃ sārase siddhikari   namaḥ svāhā
translated: Om Drim Shrim, to the crane, the bestower of success, Krim, salutations, svaha.

original: imaṃ mantraṃ lakṣam ekaṃ japed raktakaravīraiś ca pūjayet satataṃ sarvakāmado 'yaṃ mantraḥ // /
analyzed: imam mantram lakṣam ekam japet rakta karavīraiḥ ca pūjayet satatam sarva kāma daḥ yam mantraḥ
translated: One should recite this mantra one hundred thousand times and always worship with red oleander flowers. This mantra grants all desires.

original: oṃ druṃ kṣeṃ kṣeṃ huṃ kṣaḥ amukaṃ kṣaḥ svāhā /
analyzed: om drum kṣeṃ kṣeṃ hum kṣaḥ amukam kṣaḥ svāhā
translated: Om Drum Kshrem Kshrem Hum Kshrah Amukam Kshrah Svaha.

original: anena mantreṇa rājikālavaṇatuṣakaṇṭakaśivanirmālyaṃ tailena yutaṃ hunet samastaśrībhājanaṃ bhavati // /
analyzed: anena mantreṇa rājikā lavaṇa tuṣa kaṇṭaka śiva nirmālyam tailena yutam hunet samasta śrī bhājanam bhavati
translated: With this mantra, one should offer asafoetida, black salt, chaff, thorns, and shiva's cast-off flowers mixed with oil. One becomes a recipient of all prosperity.

original: oṃ huṃ huṃ huṃ lūṃ laṃ lauṃ huṃ laḥ amukaṃ chaḥ chaḥ svāhā /
analyzed: om hum hum hum lūṃ laṃ lauṃ hum laḥ amukam chaḥ chaḥ svāhā
translated: Om Hum Hum Hum Lum Lam Laum Hum Lah Amukam Chhah Chhah Svaha.

original: anena mantreṇa siddhārthaṃ bhasmanā saha mantritaṃ kartavyaṃ yasya gṛhe prakṣipya mantrabalipāṃśvair ākṣipet tasya bāhustambho bhavati /
analyzed: anena mantreṇa siddhārtham bhasmanā saha mantritam kartavyam yasya gṛhe prakṣipya ākṣipet tasya bāhu stambhaḥ bhavati
translated: With this mantra, one should make a paste of white mustard seeds and ash, and throw it in the house of the person one wishes to paralyze. His arm will become paralyzed.

original: ripusainyāgre kṣipet śatrusainyastambho bhavati aśvagajanarā niśceṣṭā bhavanti vikalā bhavanti samantādevākulā bhavanti // /
analyzed: ripu sainya agre kṣipet śatru sainya stambhaḥ bhavati aśva gaja narāḥ niśceṣṭāḥ bhavanti vikalāḥ bhavanti samantāt eva ākulāḥ bhavanti
translated: If one throws it in front of the enemy army, the enemy army will be paralyzed. Horses, elephants, and men will become motionless and disabled, and will become agitated all around.

original: oṃ ruṃ ruṃ mukhe svāhā /
analyzed: om ruṃ ruṃ mukhe svāhā
translated: Om rum rum in the mouth, svaha.

original: anena mantreṇa japtatailena mukhaṃ prakṣālya tilatailena gātrābhyaṅgaṃ vā vidhāya vātādikaṃ dinasaptakena naśyati /
analyzed: anena mantreṇa japta tailena mukham prakṣālya tila tailena gātra abhyaṅgam vā vidhāya vāta ādikam dina saptakena naśyati
translated: By reciting this mantra, one should wash the face with anointed oil, or apply oil to the body, and wind and other [ailments] will be destroyed in seven days.

original: aiṃ mātaṃgi vimalāvati vikarāle drīṃ chaḥ chaḥ svāhā /
analyzed: aim mātaṃgi vimalāvati vikarāle drīṃ chaḥ chaḥ svāhā
translated: Aim Matangi Vimalavati Vikarale Drim Chh Chh Svaha.

original: anena mantreṇa japāpuṣpaṃ parijapya vārīṇi nadyādau homayet saptāhena īpsitaṃ phalaṃ labhet /
analyzed: anena mantreṇa japā puṣpam parijapya vārīṇi nadī ādau homayet sapta ahena īpsitam phalam labhet
translated: By reciting this mantra over jasmine flowers and offering them in a river, etc., one will obtain the desired fruit in seven days.

original: kārtavīryārjuno nāma rājā bāhusahasrabhṛt /
analyzed: kārtavīrya arjunaḥ nāma rājā bāhu sahasra bhṛt
translated: There was a king named Kartavirya Arjuna, who had a thousand arms.

original: tannāmakīrtanād eva hṛtaṃ naṣṭaṃ ca labhyate // /
analyzed: tad nāma kīrtanāt eva hṛtam naṣṭam ca labhyate
translated: By merely reciting his name, what is lost or stolen is recovered.

original: nityaṃ nityaṃ japet kiṃcid vidyāṃ vittasya prāptaye /
analyzed: nityam nityam japet kiṃcid vidyām vittasya prāptaye
translated: One should always recite some mantra for the attainment of wealth.

original: oṃ maṃ kiṇi svāhā /
analyzed: om maṃ kiṇi svāhā
translated: Om, mam, kini, svāhā.

original: iti vṛścikamantraḥ /
analyzed: iti vṛścika mantraḥ
translated: This is the mantra for scorpions.

original: oṃ huṃ huṃ haṃsaḥ haṃsaṃ so 'haṃ so 'haṃ svāhā /
analyzed: om hum hum haṃsaḥ haṃsam saḥ haṃ saḥ haṃ svāhā
translated: Om, hum, hum, haṃsa, haṃsa, so 'ham, so 'ham, svāhā.

original: iti sarvaviṣāpaharaṇamantraḥ /
analyzed: iti sarva viṣa apaharaṇa mantraḥ
translated: This is the mantra for removing all poisons.

original: mayūrapicchena kuśena śareṇa śaradaṇḍena vā taddehe sammārjanaṃ kuryāt /
analyzed: mayūra picchena kuśena śareṇa śara daṇḍena vā tad dehe sammārjanam kuryāt
translated: One should rub the body with peacock feathers, kuśa grass, an arrow, or the stalk of an arrow.

original: haṃ hāṃ hiṃ hīṃ huṃ hūṃ heṃ haiṃ hoṃ hauṃ haṃ haḥ chaḥ chaḥ svāhā /
analyzed: haṃ hāṃ him hīṃ hum hūm heṃ       haṃ haḥ chaḥ chaḥ svāhā
translated: Ham, hām, him, hīṃ, hum, hūṃ, hem, haiṃ, hom, hauṃ, ham, haḥ, chḥ, chḥ, svāhā.

original: imaṃ gokṣīrasadṛśaṃ vāraṃ vāraṃ vicintayed vā varānanamukhe śirasi śarīre tataḥ kaṇṭhe
analyzed: imam go kṣīra sadṛśam vāram vāram vicintayet vā vara ānana mukhe śirasi śarīre tatas kaṇṭhe
translated: One should contemplate this water, which is like cow's milk, again and again, in the mouth of the excellent face, on the head, on the body, then on the throat,

original: tato hṛdi nābhimaṇḍale guhye tathā sarvāṅge cintayet tathā pūrakeṇa varārohe kaṇṭhadaṣṭo 'pi jīvati /
analyzed: tatas hṛdi nābhi maṇḍale guhye tathā sarva aṅge cintayet tathā pūrakeṇa varārohe kaṇṭha daṣṭaḥ jīvati
translated: then on the heart, on the navel circle, on the genitals, and on all the limbs. In the same way, O beautiful lady, by inhaling, one who bites the throat also lives.

original: oṃ gaṃ gaṇapataye mahāgaṇapataye vighnaharāya mataṃgasambhavāya lambodarāya gaurīpriyaputrāya hrīṃ gāṃ namaḥ raṃ haṃ kṣaḥ svāhā /
analyzed: om gaṃ gaṇapataye mahāgaṇapataye vighnaharāya mataṃga sambhavāya lambodarāya gaurī priya putrāya   gāṃ namaḥ raṃ haṃ   svāhā
translated: Om, gam, to Gaṇapati, to Mahāgaṇapati, to the remover of obstacles, born from Matanga, with a pendulous belly, to the beloved son of Gaurī, hrīṃ gam, salutations, ram, ham, kṣaḥ, svāhā.

original: gorocanāviṣarājikāpippalīnīcayavair mahātailena saha devadattaiś ca lakṣitān ālikhet
analyzed: gorocanā viṣarājikā pippalī nīca yavaiḥ mahātailena saha devadattaiḥ ca lakṣitān ālikhet
translated: One should draw them marked with cow bile, poison, asafoetida, long pepper, barley, with great oil, and with devadatta.

original: nimbakāṣṭhena pratikṛtiṃ hutvā pṛṣṭhato likhet sadyo jvaravilopo bhavati śāntir bhavati // /
analyzed: nimba kāṣṭhena pratikṛtim hutvā pṛṣṭhatas likhet sadyas jvara vilopaḥ bhavati śāntiḥ bhavati
translated: If one offers a likeness with neem wood and writes on the back, the fever will be destroyed immediately and peace will be attained.

original: Uḍḍāmareśvaratantra /
translated: Uḍḍāmareśvara Tantra.

original: Trayodaśaḥ paṭalaḥ
analyzed: trayodaśaḥ paṭalaḥ
translated: Chapter 13

original: oṃ drīṃ vidyāstambhini stambhini chaḥ chaḥ svāhā /
analyzed: om drīṃ vidyāstambhini stambhini chaḥ chaḥ svāhā
translated: Om Drim, to the one who paralyzes knowledge, paralyze, chh chh, svaha.

original: imaṃ mantraṃ prathamam ayutam ekaṃ japet paścān manasā saṃsmaret /
analyzed: imam mantram prathamam ayutam ekam japet paścāt manasā saṃsmaret
translated: One should first recite this mantra ten thousand times, and then recall it in the mind.

original: vanamadhye 'pi bhojanaṃ prāpnoti /
analyzed: vana madhye bhojanam prāpnoti
translated: Even in the middle of a forest, one will obtain food.

original: oṃ hauṃ namo bhagavate mahārudrāya uḍḍāmareśvarāya huṃ huṃ chaṃ chaṃ drīṃ drīṃ svāhā /
analyzed: om   namaḥ bhagavate mahārudrāya uḍḍāmara īśvarāya hum hum chaṃ chaṃ drīṃ drīṃ svāhā
translated: Om Haum, salutations to the Blessed Lord, to the Great Rudra, to the Lord of the Uḍḍāmas, hum hum, chh chh, drim drim, svaha.

original: anena mantreṇābhiṣekārthaṃ sahasravārajaptaṃ kalaśaṃ kārayet tanmadhye pañcaratnaṃ
analyzed: anena mantreṇa abhiṣeka artham sahasra vāra japtam kalaśam kārayet tad madhye pañcaratnam
translated: With this mantra, one should have a thousand-times-consecrated water pot made for the purpose of consecration. Having placed the five jewels

original: nidhāya śvetavastreṇa veṣṭayet nānāphalasusaṃcūrṇaṃ nānāratnopaśobhitaṃ taddvārakagṛhavāsaṃ
analyzed: nidhāya śveta vastreṇa veṣṭayet nānā phala su saṃcūrṇam nānā ratna upaśobhitam tat dvārakā gṛha vāsam
translated: in its middle, one should wrap it with a white cloth. Having strewn it with various fruit powders and adorned it with various jewels, one should carry that water pot to the dwelling place of the doorkeeper.

original: kalaśaṃ dhṛtvā rātrau striyā saha śmaśāne vanaspatau vā ekavṛkṣe vā sarittaṭe samudragāminyāṃ
analyzed: kalaśam dhṛtvā rātrau striyā saha śmaśāne vanaspatau vā eka vṛkṣe vā sarit taṭe samudra gāminyām
translated: At night, one should go with a woman to a cremation ground, to a tree, to a solitary tree, to the bank of a river that flows into the ocean,

original: nadyāṃ vā catuṣpathe vā gacchet /
analyzed: nadyām vā catuṣpathe vā gacchet
translated: to a crossroad, or to a place where four roads meet.

original: tataś ca kalaśaṃ nītvā strī vandhyā vā mṛtavatsā vā durbhagā vā kākavandhyā vā bhaṅgā sarvajanapriyā bhavati pīḍitā udvartayet /
analyzed: tatas ca kalaśam nītvā strī vandhyā vā mṛta vatsā vā durbhagā vā kākavandhyā vā bhaṅgā sarva jana priyā bhavati pīḍitā udvartayet
translated: Then, taking the pot, a barren woman, a woman whose child has died, an unfortunate woman, a woman with a dead fetus, a woman with a disfigured body, or a woman who is afflicted, should anoint herself.

original: priyaṅguḥ kuṅkumaṃ gorocanā nāgakesaro dūrvā haridre dve siddhārthakadvayaṃ vacā
translated: Priyangu, saffron, gorocana, nagakesara, durva, the two haridra, two siddhaarthas, vacha,

original: punarnavāpāmārgo 'rkaś citrakaṃ śālmalī lakṣmaṇā tālamūlī śatāvarī vandhyā karkaṭī
analyzed: punarnavā apāmārgaḥ rkaḥ citrakam śālmalī lakṣmaṇā tālamūlī śatāvarī vandhyā karkaṭī
translated: Punarnava, Apamarga, Arka, Citraka, Shalmali, Lakshmana, Talamuli, Shatavari, Vandhya, Karkata,

original: balā kṣīriṇī mṛgapippalī tathā cirāṇi supattrāṇy uśīraṃ ghṛtaṃ madhu tathā palāśapuṣpapattrāṇi
analyzed: balā kṣīriṇī mṛgapippalī tathā cirāṇi su pattrāṇi uśīram ghṛtam madhu tathā palāśa puṣpa pattrāṇi
translated: Bala, Kshirini, Mrigadhamani, the old good leaves, Ushira, ghee, honey, and Palasha flower leaves,

original: ambarabilvapattrāṇy aśvagandhādīni sugandhadravyāṇi sarvāṇi sarve sādhyaviśeṣataḥ
analyzed: ambara bilva pattrāṇi aśvagandhā ādīni sugandha dravyāṇi sarvāṇi sarve sādhya viśeṣataḥ
translated: Amba, Bilva leaves, Ashvagandha and other fragrant substances, all according to the specific requirements of the remedy,

original: anyad udvartayed gātraṃ śirolepano yaḥ punaḥ kalaśaṃ prakṣipya snāpayet labhate striyaṃ
analyzed: anyat udvartayet gātram śiraḥ lepanaḥ yaḥ punar kalaśam prakṣipya snāpayet labhate striyam
translated: One should anoint another part of the body, and if one applies oil to the head, one should put the pot aside and bathe. One obtains a woman.

original: sadā udvartanavastraṃ tyaktvā paravastraparidhānaṃ kuryāt /
analyzed: sadā udvartana vastram tyaktvā para vastra paridhānam kuryāt
translated: Always discarding the anointing cloth, one should wear another's clothes.

original: bhadrāsane vyavasthitā / / / Zeichenjh kuryād vāri niḥkṣipya kumbhasthitaṃ yā strīṇāṃ madhye samākarṣayati yantraṃ tatas tāṃ sammukhastriyam
analyzed: bhadrāsane vyavasthitā kuryāt vāri niḥkṣipya kumbha sthitam yā strīṇām madhye samākarṣayati yantram tatas tām sammukha striyam
translated: Seated on an auspicious seat, she should make the signs, having poured water into the pot. The woman who attracts the machine in the midst of women, then that woman in front of her,

original: arcayet /
analyzed: arcayet
translated: she should worship.

original: vastrālaṃkārasindūrasugandhikusumādibhiḥ /🔽gṛhārcāṃ kārayed devaṃ śivaṃ devyā sahārcayet // /
analyzed: vastra alaṃkāra sindūra sugandhi kusuma ādibhiḥ  gṛha arcām kārayet devam śivam devyā saha arcayet
translated: With clothes, ornaments, vermilion, fragrant flowers, and so on,🔽she should perform the worship of the house, and worship Lord Shiva along with the Goddess.

original: dakṣiṇāṃ sa pumān dadyāt śvetāṃ gāṃ vatsasaṃyutām /
analyzed: dakṣiṇām sa pumān dadyāt śvetām gām vatsa saṃyutām
translated: That man should give a dakshina, a white cow along with her calf.

original: atha snānaphalaṃ vakṣye yathoktaṃ tripurāriṇā // /
analyzed: atha snāna phalam vakṣye yathā uktam tripurāriṇā
translated: Now I will speak of the fruits of bathing, as stated by the enemy of Tripura (Shiva).

original: putrārthī labhate putraṃ dhanārthī labhate dhanam /
analyzed: putra arthī labhate putram dhana arthī labhate dhanam
translated: One who desires a son obtains a son, one who desires wealth obtains wealth,

original: śāntyarthī śāntim āpnoti durbhagā subhagā bhavet // /
analyzed: śānti arthī śāntim āpnoti durbhagā subhagā bhavet
translated: one who desires peace obtains peace, an unfortunate woman becomes fortunate.

original: bhraṣṭarājyas tathā rājā rājyaṃ prāpnoti niścitam /
analyzed: bhraṣṭa rājyaḥ tathā rājā rājyam prāpnoti niścitam
translated: A king who has lost his kingdom certainly regains his kingdom.

original: abhāryo labhate bhāryāṃ sukhārthī sukham āpnuyāt // /
analyzed: abhāryaḥ labhate bhāryām sukha arthī sukham āpnuyāt
translated: One who is without a wife obtains a wife, one who desires happiness obtains happiness.

original: iti strīpuruṣayoḥ snānaphalam // /
analyzed: iti strī puruṣayoḥ snāna phalam
translated: Thus are the fruits of bathing for women and men.

original: huṃ amukaṃ huṃ phaṭ svāhā /
analyzed: hum amukam hum phaṭ svāhā
translated: Hrum amuka hum phat svaha.

original: śmaśāne gatvā ulūkakapotakāñjīrāṇām atisatvaraṃ stanyaṃ gṛhītvā japet saptāhena // /
analyzed: śmaśāne gatvā ulūka kapota kāñjīrāṇām ati sa tvaram stanyam gṛhītvā japet sapta ahena
translated: Having gone to a cremation ground, taking the milk of an owl, a pigeon, and a kanji bird very quickly, one should recite the mantra for seven days.

original: huṃ amukaṃ phaṭ phaṭ svāhā anena mantreṇa bhānuvṛkṣasamīpe sthitvāyutaikaṃ japet tataḥ kaṭutailena daśāṃśena havanaṃ kuryāt nipātīkaraṇaṃ bhavati
analyzed: hum amukam phaṭ phaṭ svāhā anena mantreṇa bhānu vṛkṣa samīpe sthitvā ayuta ekam japet tatas kaṭutailena daśa aṃśena havanam kuryāt nipātīkaraṇam bhavati
translated: With this mantra, standing near a sun tree, one should recite one thousand times. Then, with pungent oil, one should offer oblations ten times. It becomes a means of causing death.

original: oṃ oṃ oṃ iti mantraṃ pūrvam ayutaṃ japtvānāvṛṣṭikāle japen mahāvṛṣṭir bhavati /
analyzed: om om om iti mantram pūrvam ayutam japtvā anāvṛṣṭi kāle japet mahā vṛṣṭiḥ bhavati
translated: Om Om Om - having previously recited this mantra ten thousand times, one should recite it during a drought. There will be heavy rain.

original: oṃ hrīṃ varade svāhā /
analyzed: om hrīṃ varade svāhā
translated: Om Hrim Varada Svaha.

original: imaṃ mantraṃ pūrvam ayutaṃ japtvā taddaśāṃśaṃ palāśasamidbhir havanaṃ kuryāt ghṛtaṃ hunet tataḥ sārvakālikaṃ phalaṃ labhet /
analyzed: imam mantram pūrvam ayutam japtvā tad daśa aṃśam palāśa samidbhiḥ havanam kuryāt ghṛtam hunet tatas sārvakālikam phalam labhet
translated: Having previously recited this mantra ten thousand times, one should offer oblations with Palasha twigs ten times that number, and offer ghee. Then one will obtain fruits at all times.

original: huṃ huṃ huṃ naṃ naṃ naṃ amukaṃ huṃ phaṭ svāhā /
analyzed: hum hum hum naṃ naṃ naṃ amukam hum phaṭ svāhā
translated: Hum Hum Hum Nam Nam Nam Amukam Hum Phat Svaha.

original: imaṃ mantraṃ pūrvam ayutaṃ japtvā khādirasamidho rudhireṇa liptvā taddaśāṃśaṃ hunet
analyzed: imam mantram pūrvam ayutam japtvā khādira samidhaḥ rudhireṇa liptvā tad daśa aṃśam hunet
translated: Having previously recited this mantra ten thousand times, one should smear Khadira twigs with blood and offer oblations ten times that number.

original: yasya nāmnā sa sahasraikena mahendrajvareṇa gṛhyate ayutahavanena nipātanaṃ tathānenaiva
analyzed: yasya nāmnā sa sahasraikena mahendra jvareṇa gṛhyate ayuta havanena nipātanam tathā anena eva
translated: By whose name, he is seized by the great Indra fever in one thousand, and by an oblation of ten thousand, he is brought down. In the same way, by this very mantra,

original: mantreṇāpāmārgasamidho hunet ayutasaṃkhyakāḥ trimadhuyutāḥ tato vibhīṣaṇādayo rākṣasā
analyzed: mantreṇa apāmārga samidhaḥ hunet ayuta saṃkhyakāḥ trimadhu yutāḥ tatas vibhīṣaṇa ādayaḥ rākṣasā
translated: one should offer oblations of Apamarga twigs counted in ten thousands, mixed with the three sweet things. Then Vibhishana and other demons

original: varadā bhavanti // /
analyzed: vara dāḥ bhavanti
translated: become givers of boons.

analyzed: om hūm vām vīṃ vūm vaiṃ vauṃ vaṃ vaḥ om hum phaṭ svāhā  ayam jvara grahaṇa mantraḥ  om aim kṣili kili phaṭ svāhā  anena mantreṇa trimadhu yuktam uḍumbaram pūrvam ayutam japtvā sahasra ekam homayet anāvṛṣṭi kāle mahā vṛṣṭim karoti

original: imaṃ mantraṃ pūrvam ayutaṃ tu juhuyāt taddaśāṃśaṃ nyagrodhasamidho madhuyuktā hunet sahasramātrahomena mahārājapatnī vaśagā bhavati anyalokastrīṇāṃ
analyzed: imam mantram pūrvam ayutam tu juhuyāt tad daśa aṃśam nyagrodha samidhaḥ madhu yuktāḥ hunet sahasra mātra homena mahā rāja patnī vaśagā bhavati anya loka strīṇām
translated: One should first offer this mantra ten thousand times, and one-tenth of that number of Nyagrodha sticks smeared with honey. By offering just one thousand oblations, the wife of a great king becomes subject.

original: tu kā kathā // /
analyzed: tu kā kathā
translated: What to speak of other women in the world?

original: oṃ drīṃ gomukhi gomukhi sahasrasutālā bhīmabhogapiśitabhūmau āgacchatu svāhā // /🔽anena mantreṇa raktakaravīraṃ kṣaudreṇa saṃyuktaṃ hunet vaśakāmo lavaṇaṃ hunet striyam
analyzed: om drīṃ gomukhi gomukhi sahasrasutālā bhīma bhoga piśita bhūmau āgacchatu svāhā  anena mantreṇa rakta karavīram kṣaudreṇa saṃyuktam hunet vaśa kāmaḥ lavaṇam hunet striyam
translated: Om Drim Gomukhi Gomukhi Sahasrasutaala Bhimabhoga Pishitabhoumau Agacchatu Svaha.🔽 With this mantra, one should offer red Karavira flowers smeared with honey. One who desires control should offer salt.

original: ākarṣayati pūrvasaṃyuktaṃ premakāmaḥ sindūraṃ hunet purakṣobho bhavati tuṣakaraṭaṃ
analyzed: ākarṣayati pūrva saṃyuktam prema kāmaḥ sindūram hunet pura kṣobhaḥ bhavati tuṣa karaṭam
translated: It attracts women. One who desires love should offer vermilion previously mixed. There is agitation in the city. One should offer chaff and chaff.

original: huned abhicārakarma bhavati mahāmāṃsaṃ ghṛtasaṃyuktaṃ hunet mahādhanapatir bhavet // /
analyzed: hunet abhicāra karma bhavati mahāmāṃsam ghṛta saṃyuktam hunet mahā dhanapatiḥ bhavet
translated: It becomes a magical rite. One should offer great flesh mixed with ghee. One becomes a great lord of wealth.

original: oṃ namo bhagavate rudrāya uḍḍāmareśvarāya huṃ phaṭ svāhā /
analyzed: om namaḥ bhagavate rudrāya uḍḍāmara īśvarāya hum phaṭ svāhā
translated: Om, salutations to Lord Rudra, the Lord of the Uddamara, Hum Phat Svaha.

original: anena mantreṇa śrīphalasaṃyuktaṃ ghṛtaṃ hunet śatahomena prajñā bhavati sahasreṇa
analyzed: anena mantreṇa śrīphala saṃyuktam ghṛtam hunet śata homena prajñā bhavati sahasreṇa
translated: With this mantra, one should offer ghee mixed with bilva fruit. By offering one hundred oblations, one becomes wise. By offering one thousand oblations,

original: golābho bhavati lakṣeṇa grāmasahasralābho bhavati sapādalakṣeṇa bhraṣṭarājyaṃ rājā
analyzed: gola ābhaḥ bhavati lakṣeṇa grāma sahasra lābhaḥ bhavati sa pāda lakṣeṇa bhraṣṭa rājyam rājā
translated: By one lakh, one obtains cows. By one and a quarter lakh, one obtains a thousand villages. A king who has lost his kingdom

original: prāpnoti // /
analyzed: prāpnoti
translated: obtains it back.

original: oṃ aiṃ drīṃ huṃ phaṭ svāhā /
analyzed: om aim drīṃ hum phaṭ svāhā
translated: Om Aim Drim Hum Phat Svaha.

original: anena mantreṇa kākamāṃsaṃ kukkuṭabījaṃ kaṭutailena hunet sahasraikena drīṃkārāntaṃ
analyzed: anena mantreṇa kāka māṃsam kukkuṭa bījam kaṭutailena hunet sahasra ekena drīṃkāra antam
translated: With this mantra, one should offer oblations of crow meat, chicken seed, and pungent oil. By one thousand, one should repeat the name ending with Drim.

original: nāma saṃjapya yasya nāmnā japet sa conmatto bhavati sahasraikena taṇḍulahomena sustho bhavati // /
analyzed: nāma saṃjapya yasya nāmnā japet sa ca unmattaḥ bhavati sahasra ekena taṇḍula homena susthaḥ bhavati
translated: By whomsoever's name one repeats, he becomes insane. By one thousand oblations of rice, one becomes well.

original: oṃ aiṃ śrīṃ kṣaṃ klīṃ svāhā /
analyzed: om aim śrīṃ kṣaṃ klīṃ svāhā
translated: Om Aim Shrim Ksham Kleem Svaha.

original: anena mantreṇa japaḥ kāryaḥ saptavārajaptena dehaśuddhir bhavati śatajaptena sarvatīrthasnānaphalaṃ
analyzed: anena mantreṇa japaḥ kāryaḥ sapta vāra japtena deha śuddhiḥ bhavati śata japtena sarva tīrtha snāna phalam
translated: With this mantra, the repetition should be done. By repeating seven times, there is purification of the body. By repeating one hundred times, one gets the fruit of bathing in all the holy places.

original: bhavati sahasreṇa dhīvṛddhiḥ ayutena sahasragranthakartā mahān kavir bhavati ekalakṣeṇa
analyzed: bhavati sahasreṇa dhī vṛddhiḥ ayutena sahasra grantha kartā mahān kaviḥ bhavati eka lakṣeṇa
translated: By one thousand, there is increase in intelligence. By ten thousand, one becomes a great poet who composes thousands of verses. By one lakh,

original: śrutidharo bhavati dvilakṣeṇa samastaśāstrajño bhavati trilakṣeṇātītānāgatavartamānajño
analyzed: śruti dharaḥ bhavati dvi lakṣeṇa samasta śāstra jñaḥ bhavati tri lakṣeṇa atīta anāgata vartamāna jñaḥ
translated: one becomes a reciter of the Vedas. By two lakhs, one becomes a knower of all scriptures. By three lakhs, one becomes a knower of the past, future, and present.

original: bhavati caturlakṣeṇa grahapatir bhavati pañcalakṣeṇa vedavedāntapurāṇasmṛtiviśeṣajño
analyzed: bhavati catur lakṣeṇa grahapatiḥ bhavati pañca lakṣeṇa veda vedānta purāṇa smṛti viśeṣa jñaḥ
translated: By four lakhs, one becomes the lord of the planets. By five lakhs, one becomes an expert in the Vedas, Vedanta, Puranas, and Smritis.

original: bhavati ṣaḍlakṣair vajratantur bhavati saptalakṣair nadīṃ śoṣayati hariharabrahmādiṣu
analyzed: bhavati ṣaṣ lakṣaiḥ vajra tantuḥ bhavati sapta lakṣaiḥ nadīm śoṣayati hari hara brahma ādiṣu
translated: With six hundred thousand, one becomes a Vajra-thread. With seven hundred thousand, one can dry up a river. With eight hundred thousand, one can make friends with Hari, Hara, Brahma, and others.

original: sakhyaṃ bhavati nocet vajroktena vidhinā japet tadā saṃskṛto 'yaṃ darśakena vā maharṣiṇā
analyzed: sakhyam bhavati no ced vajra uktena vidhinā japet tadā saṃskṛtaḥ yam darśakena vā mahā ṛṣiṇā
translated: If not, one should recite according to the method spoken by Vajra. Then, this one is purified by the seer or the great sage.

original: śatena samo bhavati sahasreṇa saṃtāparahito bhavati punar apy ayutena purakṣobhako
analyzed: śatena samaḥ bhavati sahasreṇa saṃtāpa rahitaḥ bhavati punar api ayutena pura kṣobhakaḥ
translated: With one hundred thousand, one becomes equal to a hundred. With one million, one becomes free from torment. Again, with ten million, one becomes an agitator of cities.

original: bhavati ṣaḍguṇena trailokyaṃ kṣobhayati tṛtīyena saptapātālaṃ kṣobhayati caturthena
analyzed: bhavati ṣaḍguṇena trailokyam kṣobhayati tṛtīyena sapta pātālam kṣobhayati caturthena
translated: With six times that, one agitates the three worlds. With the third, one agitates the seven netherworlds. With the fourth,

original: svargaṃ kṣobhayati pañcamenordhvagān saptalokān kṣobhayati ṣaḍguṇena trailokyaṃ kṣobhayati
analyzed: svargam kṣobhayati pañcamena ūrdhva gān sapta lokān kṣobhayati ṣaḍguṇena trailokyam kṣobhayati
translated: one agitates heaven. With the fifth, one agitates the seven worlds above. With six times that, one agitates the three worlds.

original: saptamena dvipadacatuṣpadādiprāṇimātraṃ kṣobhayati aṣṭamena sthāvarajaṅgamam ākarṣayati
analyzed: saptamena dvipada catuṣpada ādi prāṇi mātram kṣobhayati aṣṭamena sthāvara jaṅgamam ākarṣayati
translated: With the seventh, one agitates all beings, including bipeds and quadrupeds. With the eighth, one attracts the immobile and the moving.

original: navamena svayam eva sarvalokeṣu nāradavad anāvṛtagatir bhavati daśalakṣeṇa kartum
analyzed: navamena svayam eva sarva lokeṣu nārada vat anāvṛta gatiḥ bhavati daśa lakṣeṇa kartum
translated: With the ninth, one becomes like Narada, with unobstructed movement in all worlds. With ten million, one becomes able to create,

original: akartum anyathā kartuṃ kṣamo bhavati /
analyzed: a kartum anyathā kartum kṣamaḥ bhavati
translated: destroy, and transform.

original: punar apy amṛtakṣepaṇavidhinā japet sakṛd api naraḥ śvetakaravīrakusumatrimadhuyuktām
analyzed: punar api amṛta kṣepaṇa vidhinā japet sakṛt api naraḥ śveta karavīra kusuma trimadhu yuktām
translated: Again, a man should recite [the mantra] even once according to the method of casting the nectar, and offer oblations together with the three sweet things and white karavīra flowers.

original: āhutiṃ dadyāt sarvajanapriyo bhavati aśokapuṣpāṇi saghṛtaṃ hunet śokarahito bhavati
analyzed: āhutim dadyāt sarva jana priyaḥ bhavati aśoka puṣpāṇi sa ghṛtam hunet śoka rahitaḥ bhavati
translated: If one offers oblations of aśoka flowers with ghee, one becomes free from sorrow.

original: bhraṣṭarājyaprāptikāmaḥ śrīphalahomaṃ kuryāt bhraṣṭarājyaṃ prāpnoti ājyayuktapadmapuṣpāṇi
analyzed: bhraṣṭa rājya prāpti kāmaḥ śrīphala homam kuryāt bhraṣṭa rājyam prāpnoti ājya yukta padma puṣpāṇi
translated: One who desires to regain a lost kingdom should perform a homa with bilva fruits. One regains a lost kingdom. One should offer oblations of lotus flowers mixed with ghee,

original: athavā kumudinīpuṣpāṇi homayet /
analyzed: athavā kumudinī puṣpāṇi homayet
translated: or one should offer oblations of kumudini flowers.

original: nipātakāmaḥ kaṭutailayuktaṃ mayūramāṃsaṃ hunet kūṭena maraṇaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: nipāta kāmaḥ kaṭutaila yuktam mayūra māṃsam hunet kūṭena maraṇam bhavati
translated: One who desires to cause a downfall should offer oblations of peacock meat mixed with pungent oil. Death by conspiracy occurs.

original: pūgīphalaṃ kaṭutailaṃ lohacūrṇaṃ ca hunet samastadehe visphoṭakā bhavanti /
analyzed: pūgī phalam kaṭutailam loha cūrṇam ca hunet samasta dehe visphoṭakāḥ bhavanti
translated: If one offers oblations of betel nut, pungent oil, and iron filings, blisters will form all over the body.

original: kṣīripattrabilvapattrahomena śāntir bhavati /
analyzed: kṣīri pattra bilva pattra homena śāntiḥ bhavati
translated: Peace is achieved by offering oblations of kshiri leaves and bilva leaves.

original: tilasamidhaḥ sakaṭutailā hunet tena vidveṣaṇaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: tila samidhaḥ sa kaṭutailāḥ hunet tena vidveṣaṇam bhavati
translated: If one offers oblations of sesame twigs mixed with pungent oil, enmity occurs.

original: dhattūracūrṇe sāsthicūrṇe sakaṭutailalohacūrṇe ca hute śīghraṃ śatrunāśo bhavati /
analyzed: dhattūra cūrṇe sa asthi cūrṇe sa kaṭutaila loha cūrṇe ca hute śīghram śatru nāśaḥ bhavati
translated: If one offers oblations of dhattura powder, bone powder, pungent oil, and iron filings, the enemy is quickly destroyed.

original: mahāmāṃsaṃ saghṛtaṃ hunet mano'bhīṣṭaṃ sarvaṃ bhavati // /
analyzed: mahāmāṃsam sa ghṛtam hunet manaḥ bhīṣṭam sarvam bhavati
translated: If one offers oblations of great flesh with ghee, everything desired by the mind occurs.

original: Uḍḍāmareśvaratantra /
translated: Uḍḍāmareśvara Tantra.

original: Caturdaśaḥ paṭalaḥ
analyzed: caturdaśaḥ paṭalaḥ
translated: Chapter 14

original: klīṃ kāmāture kāmamekhale viṣayiṇi vararati bhagavati amukaṃ me vaśaṃ kuru vaśaṃ kuru klīṃ namaḥ svāhā /
analyzed: klīṃ kāma āture kāmamekhale viṣayiṇi vararati bhagavati amukam me vaśam kuru vaśam kuru klīṃ namaḥ svāhā
translated: Klim, O passionate one, O girdle of desire, O enjoyer of objects, O blessed goddess of love, bring such-and-such under my control, bring under my control, klim, salutations, svaha.

original: anena mantreṇa bhojanakāle saptagrāsān saptavārābhimantritān bhuñjīta /
analyzed: anena mantreṇa bhojana kāle sapta grāsān sapta vāra abhimantritān bhuñjīta
translated: With this mantra, at the time of eating, one should eat seven mouthfuls, enchanted seven times.

original: saptame divase strī vā puruṣo vā vaśībhavati svaṃ ca dadāti /
analyzed: saptame divase strī vā puruṣaḥ vā vaśībhavati svam ca dadāti
translated: On the seventh day, a woman or a man becomes enthralled and gives herself.

original: oṃ huṃ svāhā /
analyzed: om hum svāhā
translated: Om, hum, svaha.

original: imaṃ mantraṃ trisaṃdhyaṃ japet śatrunāśo bhavati /
analyzed: imam mantram trisaṃdhyam japet śatru nāśaḥ bhavati
translated: One should recite this mantra at the three junctions of the day; it destroys enemies.

original: klīṃ kāli kāli mahākāli kole kinyā svāhā /
analyzed: klīṃ kāli kāli mahākāli kole kinyā svāhā
translated: Klim, Kali Kali, Maha-Kali, Kole, Kinnya, svaha.

original: imaṃ mantraṃ pūrvam ayutaṃ japtvā saṃdhyākāle sahasraikaṃ homayet tataḥ kaṅkālī varadā bhavati suvarṇacatuṣṭayaṃ pratyahaṃ dadāti // /
analyzed: imam mantram pūrvam ayutam japtvā saṃdhyā kāle sahasra ekam homayet tatas kaṅkālī vara dā bhavati suvarṇa catuṣṭayam pratyaham dadāti
translated: Having previously recited this mantra ten thousand times, one should offer one thousand oblations at twilight. Then Kankali becomes the bestower of boons and gives four gold coins every day.

original: oṃ drīṃ drīṃ draṃ draiṃ drauṃ draḥ huṃ namaḥ svāhā /
analyzed: om drīṃ drīṃ draṃ draiṃ drauṃ draḥ hum namaḥ svāhā
translated: Om, drim drim, dram dram, draum drah, hum, salutations, svaha.

original: anena mantreṇa pūrvam evāyutaṃ japtvā kevalam ājyaṃ hunet asmād ākarṣaṇaṃ bhavati // /
analyzed: anena mantreṇa pūrvam eva ayutam japtvā kevalam ājyam hunet asmāt ākarṣaṇam bhavati
translated: With this mantra, having previously recited it ten thousand times, one should offer only ghee oblations; from this, attraction is accomplished.

original: oṃ drauṃ drauṃ hīṃ hīṃ huṃ namaḥ svāhā /
analyzed: om drauṃ drauṃ hīṃ hīṃ hum namaḥ svāhā
translated: Om, draum draum, him him, hum, salutations, svaha.

original: anena mantreṇa pūrvavidhinā japtvārdhamāsād ākarṣaṇaṃ bhavati // /
analyzed: anena mantreṇa pūrva vidhinā japtvā ardha māsāt ākarṣaṇam bhavati
translated: By reciting this mantra according to the previous method for half a month, one will attract [someone].

original: oṃ haṃ oṃ hūṃ hūṃ hīṃ svāhā /
analyzed: om haṃ om     hīṃ svāhā
translated: Om ham om hrim hrim svaha.

original: iti pūrvakhaṅgabhedaḥ // /
analyzed: iti
translated: Thus ends the previous sword division.

original: sarvasaṃjīvanīmantraḥ oṃ huṃ drīṃ draṃ drauṃ draḥ huṃ huṃ /
analyzed: sarva saṃjīvanī mantraḥ om hum drīṃ draṃ drauṃ draḥ hum hum
translated: The mantra of the reviver of all: Om hum drem dram draum drah hum hum.

original: anena mantreṇa sarvajvaranāśanaṃ bhavati // /
analyzed: anena mantreṇa sarva jvara nāśanam bhavati
translated: By this mantra, all fevers are destroyed.

original: dīṃ haṃ sini svāhā /
analyzed: dīṃ haṃ sini svāhā
translated: Dim ham sinisvaha.

original: anena mantreṇa sarvajanavaśīkaraṇam // /
analyzed: anena mantreṇa sarva jana vaśīkaraṇam
translated: By this mantra, all people are enthralled.

original: oṃ hīṃ namaḥ hīṃ phaṭ svāhā /🔽imaṃ mantraṃ sādhyanāmnāyutaṃ japet śavāsanasthito hṛdayaṃ na prakāśayet / / /
analyzed: om hīṃ namaḥ hīṃ phaṭ svāhā  imam mantram sādhya nāmnā ayutam japet śavāsana sthitaḥ hṛdayam na prakāśayet
translated: Om him namaḥ him phat svaha.🔽Reciting this mantra ten thousand times with the name of the one to be accomplished, sitting on a corpse, one should not reveal one's heart.

original: Zeichenjh amukīṃ tāṃ / / / Zeichenjh saṃgṛhya guṭikāṃ kṛtvā mukhe prakṣipya
analyzed: amukīm tām saṃgṛhya guṭikām kṛtvā mukhe prakṣipya
translated: Taking the sign of such and such, making a pill, putting it in the mouth,

original: vidyādharatvaṃ bhavati // /
analyzed: vidyādhara tvam bhavati
translated: one attains the state of a sky-walker.

original: oṃ hīṃ huṃ namaḥ /
analyzed: om hīṃ hum namaḥ
translated: Om him hum namaḥ.

original: imaṃ mantraṃ pūrvavidhinā japet pādukāsiddhir bhavati // /
analyzed: imam mantram pūrva vidhinā japet pādukā siddhiḥ bhavati
translated: Reciting this mantra according to the previous method, one attains the power of sandals.

original: oṃ kṣaṃ kṣaṃ hrīṃ huṃ phaṭ svāhā /
analyzed: om kṣaṃ kṣaṃ hrīṃ hum phaṭ svāhā
translated: Om ksham ksham hrim hum phat svaha.

original: imaṃ mantraṃ pūrvakrameṇa japed vetālasiddhir bhavati // /
analyzed: imam mantram pūrva krameṇa japet vetāla siddhiḥ bhavati
translated: Reciting this mantra in the previous sequence, one attains the power of the vetala.

original: oṃ hrīṃ svāhā /
analyzed: om hrīṃ svāhā
translated: Om hrim svaha.

original: anena mantreṇa narakapālaṃ gṛhītvā tasmin naratailaṃ dattvā tasmin vāyasacakṣuḥsaṃvardhinīṃ
analyzed: anena mantreṇa nara kapālam gṛhītvā tasmin nara tailam dattvā tasmin vāyasa cakṣuḥ saṃvardhinīm
translated: Having taken the skull of a man with this mantra, having put human oil in it, one should light a wick made of the eyes of a crow in it.

original: vartikāṃ prajvālayet kṛṣṇapakṣāmāvāsyāyāṃ śanivāre andhakūpe śmaśāne vā śūnyāyatane
analyzed: vartikām prajvālayet kṛṣṇa pakṣa amāvāsyāyām śanivāre andhakūpe śmaśāne vā śūnya āyatane
translated: On the new moon day of the dark fortnight, on a Saturday, in a blind well, in a cremation ground, or in an empty house,

analyzed: vā kajjalam pātayitavyam tāvat kālam pūrva uktam mantram japet yāvatā kālena varti śeṣam
translated: one should let the lamp soot fall. One should recite the previously mentioned mantra for as long as it takes for the remaining wick to

original: prajvalati avasāne prabhūtabalidānaṃ kartavyaṃ tatra balistambham ādāya tena siddhāñjanenāñjitanayanaḥ
analyzed: prajvalati avasāne prabhūta bali dānam kartavyam tatra bali stambham ādāya tena siddhāñjanena añjita nayanaḥ
translated: ignite. At the end, one should offer a large bali. Having taken the bali post there, with the eyes anointed with the accomplished collyrium,

original: surāsurair api na dṛśyate 'nyalokasya kā kathā // /
analyzed: sura asuraiḥ api na dṛśyate nyalokasya kā kathā
translated: one is not seen even by gods and demons, what to speak of other people.

original: oṃ hraṃ hrīṃ hūṃ hraiṃ hrauṃ hraḥ hrīṃ hrīṃ iti śaṅkhinīvidyā /
analyzed: om hraṃ hrīṃ hūm hraiṃ hraum hraḥ hrīṃ hrīṃ iti śaṅkhinī vidyā
translated: Om hram hrim hum hraum hrah hrah hrim hrim - this is the Shankhini Vidya.

original: oṃ hīṃ huṃ iti puṣpāñjalivedhaḥ /
analyzed: om hīṃ hum iti puṣpa añjali vedhaḥ
translated: Om him hum - this is the flower-jali-vedha.

original: huṃ huṃ iti huṃkāravedhaḥ /
analyzed: hum hum iti huṃkāra vedhaḥ
translated: Hum hum - this is the humkara-vedha.

original: oṃ hrīṃ huṃ ity ālayavedhaḥ /
analyzed: om   hum iti ālaya vedhaḥ
translated: Om hrim hum - this is the alaya-vedha.

original: hrāṃ śivāvedhamantraḥ /
analyzed: hrāṃ śivā vedha mantraḥ
translated: Hraum is the mantra for Shiva-vedha.

original: hrīṃ iti bhramarāvartasaṃghaṭṭavedhaḥ /
analyzed: hrīṃ iti bhramara āvarta saṃghaṭṭa vedhaḥ
translated: Hrim is the vedha for the union of the bee and the whirlpool.

original: oṃ drīṃ huṃ chaḥ chaḥ svāhā /
analyzed: om drīṃ hum chaḥ chaḥ svāhā
translated: Om drem hum chash chash svaha.

analyzed: akṣara ekam pūrva āvarta krameṇa lekhitavyam
translated: One syllable should be written in the clockwise sequence.

original: tato bhūrjapattre imaṃ mantraṃ likhitvā gṛhadvāre dehalyā ekadeśe dhṛte sati gṛhasarpam uccāṭayati vivaradvāri dhṛte vivarastho naśyaty eva
analyzed: tatas bhūrja pattre imam mantram likhitvā gṛha dvāre dehalyāḥ eka deśe dhṛte sati gṛha sarpam uccāṭayati vivara dvāri dhṛte vivara sthaḥ naśyati eva
translated: Then, having written this mantra on a birch bark leaf, if it is held in one place on the threshold outside the door of the house, it drives away house snakes. If it is held at the entrance to a hole, the one living in the hole is destroyed.

original: raktakaravīrapuṣpam āmrapattrabhasmanā liptaṃ tatkṣaṇād eva śubhraṃ bhavati tathā gandhakadhūpenāpi bhāvitena śuktir bhavati /
analyzed: rakta karavīra puṣpam āmra pattra bhasmanā liptam tad kṣaṇāt eva śubhram bhavati tathā gandhaka dhūpena api bhāvitena śuktiḥ bhavati
translated: The flower of red oleander smeared with the ash of mango leaves becomes white instantly. Similarly, when impregnated with the fumes of mercury, it becomes a conch shell.

original: loke hayamāra ityākhyasya raktakaravīrasya puṣpaṃ tūlavartikāgandhakena saha saṃyojya tatkṣaṇād eva jvalati /
analyzed: loke hayamāraḥ iti ākhyasya rakta karavīrasya puṣpam tūla vartikā gandhakena saha saṃyojya tad kṣaṇāt eva jvalati
translated: In the world, the flower of the red oleander called Hayamāra, when combined with cotton wick and mercury, instantly catches fire.

original: tathā ṭaṅkanaharidrābhyāṃ kṛte lepe kuṅkumakāntir bhavati // /
analyzed: tathā ṭaṅkana haridrābhyām kṛte lepe kuṅkuma kāntiḥ bhavati
translated: Similarly, when smeared with turmeric and haridra, it becomes fragrant like saffron.

original: purāṇaśuṣkagomayaṃ yadā jale pātayet tadā bhīmoṣmaṇā tasmād budbudam utpadyate /
analyzed: purāṇa śuṣka gomayam yadā jale pātayet tadā bhīma ūṣmaṇā tasmāt budbudam utpadyate
translated: When old dry cow dung is thrown into water, a bubble arises from it due to its terrible heat.

original: evaṃ gauraṃ tu bhūmyupari bhūtalaṃ spṛṣṭvā raktakaravīravṛkṣo jāyate iti /
analyzed: evam gauram tu bhūmi upari bhū talam spṛṣṭvā rakta karavīra vṛkṣaḥ jāyate iti
translated: In the same way, when the earth is touched on the ground, a red oleander tree is born.

original: rūpake tāmre bhramara iva kumbhe samarpayet kiṃcid anuyogitvena mano'nurāgo bhavati tāmbūlarāgataḥ naśyati haridrārāgo ravikiraṇāt // /
analyzed: rūpake tāmre bhramare iva kumbhe samarpayet kiṃcid anuyogi tvena manonurāgaḥ bhavati tāmbūla rāgataḥ naśyati haridrā rāgaḥ ravi kiraṇāt
translated: Just as a bee is placed in a copper vessel as an object of slight attachment, so the mind becomes attached to betel nut dye, which is destroyed by turmeric dye from the sun's rays.

original: oṃ huṃ sati kurur upakṣiśabdataḥ kuralakuṅkumena iti prasiddhiḥ kroñca ity api tasya
analyzed: om hum sati kuruḥ upakṣi śabdataḥ kurala kuṅkumena iti prasiddhiḥ kroñcaḥ iti api tasya
translated: Om, hum, sati, kuru, from the sound of the bird, with the saffron of the kurara bird, this is well-known, also called a crane.

original: nāma jihvākrīṃkṛtaṃ vāmakaratalamadhyalagnaparilepaṃ darśayitvā uditaviśvadhārābhasmanā
analyzed: nāma jihvā krīṃ kṛtam vāma kara tala madhya lagna parilepam darśayitvā udita viśva dhārā bhasmanā
translated: Having shown the name smeared in the middle of the left palm, with the ashes of the rising universal stream,

original: punar api karatalalagnāt pradarśya gatyāścaryamate śiśudugdhabhāvitāt śodhayitvā🔽gavādidugdhaṃ coṣṇaṃ kāṃsyapātre kṛtvā tīkṣṇataraṃ dhṛtvā taṇḍulanikṣepaṇena kṣīraṃ bhavati // /🔽bhūrjapattrapuṭakaṃ tilatailena dīpayitvā vividhabhakṣyānnaṃ sādhayet yathā lauhabhājane sādhyate /
analyzed: punar api kara tala lagnāt pradarśya gati āścarya mate śiśu dugdha bhāvitāt śodhayitvā  gavādi dugdham ca uṣṇam kāṃsya pātre kṛtvā tīkṣṇataram dhṛtvā taṇḍula nikṣepaṇena kṣīram bhavati
translated: again, having shown from what is attached to the palm, O Gati, O Acarya, having purified from what is impregnated with the milk of a child,🔽and having heated cow's milk and so on in a brass vessel, having taken it very sharp, the milk becomes by the addition of rice.🔽Having ignited a betel leaf packet with sesame oil, one should prepare various edible foods as it is prepared in an iron vessel.

original: vārtākarañjikāpalam iti tat sūtreṇa veṣṭayitvā dīpayitvā ca jvālayet tenāvisūtreṇa veṣṭite ca sūtraṃ saṃdahyate vārtākaś ca pacyate // /
analyzed: vārtāka rañjikā palam iti tat sūtreṇa veṣṭayitvā dīpayitvā ca jvālayet tena avi sūtreṇa veṣṭite ca sūtram saṃdahyate vārtākaḥ ca pacyate
translated: One pala of eggplant and Randia seeds, having wrapped that with a thread and ignited it, one should light it. By that, when wrapped with a thread, the thread burns and the eggplant is cooked.

original: ādipaṅktau sapta svarān saṃlikhya tadadhaḥpaṅktau kādisaptavargāt saṃlikhya tadadhaḥpaṅktau
analyzed: ādi paṅktau sapta svarān saṃlikhya tad adhas paṅktau ka ādi sapta vargāt saṃlikhya tad adhas paṅktau
translated: Having written the seven vowels in the first row, having written the seven classes beginning with ka in the row below that, in the row below that,

original: haridrādikrameṇālekhanīyā tatra svaravarṇayojanena saṃkocanād akṣarakoṣṭhādisaṃsparśanāt saṃjāyate /
analyzed: haridrā ādi krameṇa ālekhanīyā tatra svara varṇa yojanena saṃkocanāt akṣara koṣṭha ādi saṃsparśanāt saṃjāyate
translated: it should be written in the order of turmeric and so on. There, by the combination of vowels and letters, by contraction, by touching the squares of letters and so on, it arises.

original: bahuṣu madhyeṣu dattasaṃjñākṛtasaṃketaś cauraḥ svadṛṣṭim api saptasaptasvarādau jānāti /
analyzed: bahuṣu madhyeṣu datta saṃjñā kṛta saṃketaḥ cauraḥ sva dṛṣṭim api sapta sapta svara ādau jānāti
translated: The thief, having given a sign in the midst of many, and having made an agreement, knows even his own sight in the seven-seven notes etc.

original: vyāpāramadhye kṣaṇarasikaś cauro jñāyate kṛto bhadradravye // /
analyzed: vyāpāra madhye kṣaṇa rasikaḥ cauraḥ jñāyate kṛtaḥ bhadra dravye
translated: The thief who is fond of action in the midst of activity is known to be made of good substance.

original: kutrāpi dhattūrakabījaṃ kṣiptvā tad vā bhakṣati tadā tadguṇādiphalaṃ labhyate asau cauraḥ iti /
analyzed: kutra api dhattūraka bījam kṣiptvā tat vā bhakṣati tadā tad guṇa ādi phalam labhyate asau cauraḥ iti
translated: Having thrown the seed of Dhattura somewhere, if he eats it, then the fruit of its qualities etc. is obtained. And that thief is known.

original: svalpacaracaurās tu vastulābhe pradātāraḥ /
analyzed: su alpa cara caurāḥ tu vastu lābhe pradātāraḥ
translated: But small thieves give the gift when they obtain the object.

original: kṣīryarkādivṛkṣadugdhena saṃlikhitaṃ cauranāmākṣaraṃ karatale 'pi likhitam anantaraṃ
analyzed: kṣīri arka ādi vṛkṣa dugdhena saṃlikhitam caura nāma akṣaram kara tale likhitam anantaram
translated: The name of the thief written on the palm with the milk of a tree like Kshiri Arka etc. is also written.

original: bhūrjapattre kṛtam api mardane sparśayitvā bhakṣituṃ tato dadāti aparilikhitaṃ cauranāma
analyzed: bhūrja pattre kṛtam api mardane sparśayitvā bhakṣitum tatas dadāti a parilikhitam caura nāma
translated: Having touched what is written on the birch bark leaf after grinding, he then gives it to be eaten. And the name of the thief is not completely written.

original: pattrayuktaṃ ca arigṛhagarbhamṛttikākāṇḍakaṃ bhavati /🔽jale sādhunāma pattrayuktamṛttikā ca jale majjati tataḥ spṛṣṭvā kriyate asau cauraḥ iti /
analyzed: pattra yuktam ca ari gṛha garbha mṛttikā kāṇḍakam bhavati  jale sādhu nāma pattra yukta mṛttikā ca jale majjati tatas spṛṣṭvā kriyate asau cauraḥ iti
translated: And the leaf is united with the clay of the womb of the enemy's house.🔽The clay united with the leaf sinks in water. Then having touched it, he is made the thief.

original: kṣīritarudugdhalikhitakṣudralekhe aṅgāracūrṇena marditāḥ spaṣṭā bhavanti /
analyzed: kṣīri taru dugdha likhita kṣudra lekhe aṅgāra cūrṇena marditāḥ spaṣṭāḥ bhavanti
translated: The small writing written with the milk of a milky tree becomes clear when ground with charcoal powder.

original: kūṭo 'pi viparītalikhitavarṇa ādarśādau pratikṛtibhāvāpanno varṇavaiparītyāt prativivardhitanyāsaḥ atidṛḍhā masī bhavati // /🔽nimbatālake samatāmrabhājane yāmamātramarditena vidhir astu samabhāgatā yathā āmalakīharītakīvibhītakanimbakhādirāṇām
analyzed: kūṭaḥ pi viparīta likhita varṇaḥ ādarśa ādau pratikṛti bhāva āpannaḥ varṇa vaiparītyāt prativivardhita nyāsaḥ ati dṛḍhā masī bhavati
translated: Even a counterfeit, written with reversed letters on a mirror or such, becomes a reflection due to the reversal of the letters, and when applied with increased force, becomes very firm ink.🔽Let the procedure be such that there is equal proportion of amalaki, haritaki, bibhitaki, nimba, and khadira, pounded for one yama in a copper vessel of equal size.

original: nīrākhyārājakaravīrarasaiḥ samastarasakajjalamuktamardanaprakāreṇa yāmamātreṇa pratyekaṃ
analyzed: nīra ākhyā rāja karavīra rasaiḥ samasta rasa kajjala mukta mardana prakāreṇa yāma mātreṇa pratyekam
translated: By the method of pounding with the juice of the king of karavira called nira, each for one yama,

original: yena prakāreṇa masidravyaṃ jāyate /
analyzed: yena prakāreṇa masi dravyam jāyate
translated: by whatever method the ink substance is produced.

original: śirīṣavṛkṣatvakcūrṇaṃ khadiraṃ vinā tāmbūlarāgaṃ janayati /
analyzed: śirīṣa vṛkṣa tvac cūrṇam khadiram vinā tāmbūla rāgam janayati
translated: The powder of the bark of the shirisha tree, without khadira, produces the color of betel.

original: tiryaka bhūmau nārikelaphalam asthisahitaṃ mukhena karṇikāyām ekena prahāreṇa dvidhā bhavati /
analyzed: bhūmau nārikela phalam asthi sahitam mukhena karṇikāyām ekena prahāreṇa dvidhā bhavati
translated: A coconut fruit with its shell, lying horizontally on the ground, is split in two by a single blow with the mouth on the pericarp.

original: laghukāṣṭhasūkṣmaracitapākāṃ vinā pādaikaṃ vā bhramati /
analyzed: laghu kāṣṭha sūkṣma racita pākām vinā pāda ekam vā bhramati
translated: Without being cooked in a small piece of wood or being made very thin, it moves on one foot.

original: guñjāphalāsthiliptaṃ stambhitaṃ taduttarapādaṃ prayojya prapadātyantaṃ bhramati tadā pādatale tālakāralagnā uttiṣṭhati /
analyzed: guñjā phala asthi liptam stambhitam tad uttara pādam prayojya prapada atyantam bhramati tadā pāda tale tāla kāra lagnā uttiṣṭhati
translated: Smeared with the pith of a guñja fruit, the next foot is applied and it moves to the very end of the foot, then it rises up when held by the palm of the foot.

original: evaṃ laghukāṣṭhanirmitāsamakaḥ pāpapurahāsārthaṃ dattamukhaveṣṭaṃ kiṃcit yas tena sitavastrādau kaṭyāṃ lagnam upatiṣṭhamānās tiṣṭhati // /
analyzed: evam pāpa pura hāsa artham datta mukha veṣṭam kiṃcid yaḥ tena sita vastra ādau kaṭyām lagnam upatiṣṭhamānāḥ tiṣṭhati
translated: Thus, a piece of charcoal made from light wood, given to a sinful man for the purpose of laughing, remains attached to his waist in a white cloth, etc., with a little mouth-covering.

original: evaṃ niviḍāmbarapihitajambādau adhomukhakāṃsyabhājananihitam aṅgāraṃ na dahati vastraṃ
analyzed: evam nibiḍa ambara pihita jamba ādau adhomukha kāṃsya bhājana nihitam aṅgāram na dahati vastram
translated: Thus, charcoal placed in an inverted brass vessel in a dense-covered jambu, etc., does not burn the cloth,

original: dahati cāpi śiśirajalamiśritam api ānataphalacūrṇabhāvitakalaśaḥ tīkṣṇaś ca kāṃsyabhājananihitaṃ
analyzed: dahati ca api śiśira jala miśritam api ānata phala cūrṇa bhāvita kalaśaḥ tīkṣṇaḥ ca kāṃsya bhājana nihitam
translated: but it also burns even when mixed with cold water. A sharp brass vessel placed in a pot seasoned with the powder of ripe fruit

original: guruḍḍanāpy aśaktaṃ na bhavati tadānīṃ tiktaṃ yāti yac chuktaṃ miṣṭam eti kajjalacavikācūrṇābhyāṃ
analyzed: aśaktam na bhavati tadānīm tiktam yāti yat śuktam miṣṭam eti kajjala cavikā cūrṇābhyām
translated: is not unable to gurgle then. What is bitter becomes sweet with the powders of soot and chavika.

original: kramasaṃlikhitapustakamadhyakāraṇe 'pi yatheṣṭayā pacyate yathā kaṭāhe ramyatare🔽madhunāgniprajvalite sakuṇḍādau jalapūrṇe adhomukhe ujjvalaṃ svayam eti dhūmābhyāṃ
analyzed: krama saṃlikhita pustaka madhya kāraṇe yathā iṣṭayā pacyate yathā kaṭāhe ramyatare  madhunā agni prajvalite sa kuṇḍa ādau jala pūrṇe adhomukhe ujjvalam svayam eti dhūmābhyām
translated: Even in the middle of a book written in sequence, it is cooked as desired, just as in a beautiful cauldron.🔽When ignited with honey in a fire pit, etc., filled with water, inverted, the smoke rises by itself with the two smokes,

original: svayam udgirati vartidvaye śaśaviṣṭhāpūrṇagarbhe kamaṭhair adhovartiviṣṭhāyitāpi
analyzed: svayam udgirati varti dvaye śaśa viṣṭhā pūrṇa garbhe kamaṭhaiḥ adhas varti viṣṭhāyi tā api
translated: it emits by itself in a pair of wicks filled with the womb of rabbit dung, even when pressed down by the dung of a tortoise below.

original: upari jvalajjvālājvalitavartijvālām api jvalitadhūmam aṅgāratīkṣṇaśikhayā nāḍikādau /
analyzed: upari jvalat jvālā jvalita varti jvālām api jvalita dhūmam aṅgāra tīkṣṇa śikhayā nāḍikā ādau
translated: Even on a burning wick with blazing flames, the burning smoke is seen with the sharp flame of a tube, etc.

original: vālivāte 'yaṃ prayogaḥ kāryaḥ /
analyzed: vāli vāte yam prayogaḥ kāryaḥ
translated: This practice should be done in a strong wind.

original: vāmakarāṅguliparyantaṃ gopitaṃ sūtracihnam apy acihnaṃ ca dṛśyate janasya viṣamasamākṣareṇa vīkṣite kālaḥ asamam api puruṣaṃ jānīyāt /
analyzed: vāma kara aṅguli paryantam gopitam sūtra cihnam api acihnam ca dṛśyate janasya viṣama sama akṣareṇa vīkṣite kālaḥ asamam api puruṣam jānīyāt
translated: The end of the fingers of the left hand, hidden and marked with a thread, is also seen as unmarked by the public. When looked at with unevenly accented syllables, one should know the time, even if it is uneven, of a person.

original: pañcadāḍime śikhare masiguṇite yaddhi bhavati tāvat guṭike vijānīyāt /
analyzed: pañca dāḍime śikhare masi guṇite yat hi bhavati tāvat guṭike vijānīyāt
translated: On the peak of five pomegranates, multiplied by the quality of ink, one should know that much in a pill.

original: akālavakre sati kālam atha phalacūrṇena militvā bhasmanā saha ghṛtena kākañjikā sahasā bhavati // /
analyzed: akāla vakre sati kālam atha phala cūrṇena militvā bhasmanā saha ghṛtena kākañjikā sahasā bhavati
translated: If it is out of season and crooked, then the time, and when mixed with fruit powder, with ashes, with ghee, the kākañjikā quickly becomes.

original: agādhasthirajale dhūmacūrṇena likhitacintādi bhītavad bhāṣate na nimajjatīti /
analyzed: agādha sthira jale dhūma cūrṇena likhita cintā ādi bhīta vat bhāṣate na nimajjati iti
translated: In deep, still water, written thoughts, etc. with smoke powder, speak as if frightened, it does not sink.

original: samadaśaghṛtajadhṛtasamāveśārdhaṃ dhṛtamūṣalaṃ tiṣṭhati // /
analyzed: sama daśa ghṛta ja dhṛta samāveśa ardham dhṛta mūṣalam tiṣṭhati
translated: A half-held pestle stands in the half-immersion of ghee with equal parts of sesame oil and ghee.

original: puṣyanakṣatre kuṅkumāvartitena bāṇena dūrastham api lakṣyaṃ bālo 'pi vidhyate /
analyzed: puṣya nakṣatre kuṅkuma āvartitena bāṇena dūra stham api lakṣyam vidhyate
translated: In the Puṣya constellation, even a child pierces a target from a distance with an arrow smeared with saffron.

original: ṣaṇḍaṃ gomayānāṃ vartidīpakāntyā dagdhaṃ madhye hataśaśarudhiraṃ dṛśyate tatrāpi tailaṃ yat kiṃcid iti /
analyzed: ṣaṇḍam gomayānām varti dīpa kāntyā dagdham madhye hata śaśa rudhiram dṛśyate tatra api tailam yat kiṃcid iti
translated: In a wick of cow dung ash, burnt by the light of a lamp wick, in the middle, with the blood of a hare removed, even there, some oil is seen.

original: śvetārkaphale tūlakaṃ sarṣapasamaṃ tailenaikīkṛtavartikadīpajvālāyāṃ gṛhoparivaṃśādidāru sarvaṃ sarpa iva dṛśyate /
analyzed: śveta arka phale tūlakam sarṣapa samam tailena ekīkṛta vartika dīpa jvālāyām gṛha upari vaṃśa ādi dāru sarvam sarpaḥ iva dṛśyate
translated: In the fruit of the white arka plant, a cotton ball the size of a mustard seed, made into a wick with oil, in the flame of a lamp, all the wood of the house beams and so on appears as if it were a snake.

original: bhujagataile sacchidrabhāṇḍe bhujaṃgaṃ kṣiptvā acchidrabhāṇḍāntare vyavasthitam agnipātena jalaṃ jvalati /
analyzed: bhujaga taile sa chidra bhāṇḍe bhujaṃgam kṣiptvā acchidra bhāṇḍa antare vyavasthitam agni pātena jalam jvalati
translated: In oil in the arm, having thrown a snake into a vessel with a hole, placed in another vessel without a hole, by the falling of fire, the water burns.

original: tadaiva tailaṃ pūrvaprakāreṇa kṛṣṇāṣṭamyāṃ maṇḍūkatailāṅkitena sarvaṃ śātrava sarvaṃ bhavati /🔽dīpakāntyā dīpayitvā yat kiṃcic ca kukkuṭapakṣicañcvādividagdhanālalakṣitā satī hṛtā🔽lekhā yadāyāti harikapālaṃ dhṛtvā bhavati tadā taj jalapūrṇāṃ ca kalaśaṃ riktakaṃ
analyzed: tadā eva tailam pūrva prakāreṇa kṛṣṇa aṣṭamyām maṇḍūka taila aṅkitena sarvam śātrava sarvam bhavati  dīpa kāntyā dīpayitvā yat kiṃcid ca kukkuṭa pakṣi cañcu ādi vidagdha nāla lakṣitā satī hṛtā  lekhā yadā āyāti hari kapālam dhṛtvā bhavati tadā tat jala pūrṇām ca kalaśam riktakam
translated: At that very time, the oil, marked with frog oil in the previous way, on the eighth day of the dark fortnight, becomes all the enemies.🔽Having illuminated with the light of a lamp, whatever is marked with a stalk bitten by the beak of a cock bird, when the line comes, holding the skull of Hari, then that full water pot becomes empty.

original: bhavati tathā maricaśuṇṭhī pippalīcūrṇenobhābhyāṃ vāmacaraṇatalaṃ liptvā tenāhato
analyzed: bhavati tathā marica śuṇṭhī pippalī cūrṇena ubhābhyām vāma caraṇa talam liptvā
translated: And having smeared the sole of the left foot with the powder of black pepper, ginger, and long pepper, struck with that,

original: vṛkṣaḥ kalpavṛkṣaś ca nameruphalaṃ prasūyate // /🔽kṛṣṇā gauḥ prasavakāle tadvat samānavarṇaṃ jarāyur āgatatvena prajāreṇḍalā phalaṃ
analyzed: vṛkṣaḥ kalpavṛkṣaḥ ca nameru phalam prasūyate  kṛṣṇā gauḥ prasava kāle tadvat samāna varṇam jarāyuḥ āgata tvena prajā reṇḍalā phalam
translated: A tree becomes a wish-fulfilling tree, and the Meru fruit is produced.🔽A black cow, at the time of giving birth, gives birth to a placenta of the same color, and seeing the fruit of the Jarāndha fruit,
